drinks.comment: This is a great tasting drink that packs a punch. Enjoy it from the Dog House Boys in West Milford, NJ!!!!
drinks.name: Dog House Dew

drinks.comment: If you follow these directions, you get a drink that looks brown, but slowly changes color so you have a green layer above a yellow layer. The cherry at the bottom of the glass adds to the reverse sunrise effect. -- The name: Esirnus = Sunrise backwards.
drinks.name: Esirnus

drinks.instructions: Mix and serve to cure the common cold.
drinks.name: NyQuil
ingredients: A few Drops green Food coloring

drinks.comment: About Six Dirty Dogs will make you act pretty damn dirty.
drinks.name: Dirty Dog

drinks.instructions: Chill the shot glass until a frost has developed on it. All ingredients should be chilled. Add the Aftershock and several small crystals, then add the Vodka, and finally the Cranberry juice.
drinks.name: Flaming Cocaine

drinks.instructions: Order of pour: Pint glass iced, 3/4 oz Vodka, 3/4 oz Rum, 3/4 oz Triple Sec. 1/2 fill sweet and sour, 1/2 fill seven-up, splash grenadine to get a slight pink color

drinks.comment: Also known as "Cock Sucker" and "Slippery Nipple".
drinks.name: Butterbee

drinks.instructions: Pour first vodka, then Bailey's, then Kahlua into a cocktail glass over crushed ice. Add vanilla extract. Stir and serve.

drinks.instructions: Shake. Strain into ice filled glass. Garnish with a slice of pineapple and a straw.
drinks.name: Turbo

drinks.comment: Very good to take after you have drunk a very hot drink. It cools you down to the core!
drinks.name: Ice bolts

drinks.comment: It's the best way to make it, absolutely the best!
drinks.name: Sex on the Beach #12

drinks.comment: Also known as a "Liver transplant in a glass".
drinks.name: Red Hot

drinks.comment: Just visualize yourself on the white sands of and Aruban beach. Nothing beats it!

drinks.comment: If you like this, try the Cuban Manhattan!

drinks.instructions: Stir or shake vigorously until a frothing head appears. Strain into sour glasses. Garnish with a slice of orange or a Maraschino Cherry.
drinks.name: Bermuda Rum Swizzle

drinks.comment: The drink was discovered by a group of malcontents at Colorado College wasting away a snowy eve (by being wasted). It was named after the primary ingredient and a filipino contributor who christened the drink that night, and a toilet the next day. We take no responsibility for individual results. P.S. We do not recommend inhalation of fumes.
drinks.name: Tropiflipano

drinks.comment: After three Specials you need to take a manditory break to let the alcohol catch up with you. This drink is strong enough to be dangerous because you cannot taste the Vodka!
drinks.name: Topher Special

drinks.instructions: Mix brandy, milk and brown sugar on ice. Top with ginger ale
drinks.name: Shotgun Lou

drinks.instructions: Mix in a shot glass and enjoy.
drinks.name: Big Time

drinks.comment: How do you think all those elves make it through the Christmas season?
drinks.name: The Drunken Elf

drinks.comment: You can make a full shot of this, but it goes down VERY hot! Make sure it does not touch your mouth! Just pour it into your throught. Great drink if you are starting to get sleepy at a party!!
drinks.name: Burn

drinks.comment: The strict recipe does not have any sugar, but I like to add a little.
drinks.name: Aviation

drinks.comment: This drink got it's name because of it's unique effect on the digestive system. You may find yourself dropping a green bomb early the next morning!
drinks.name: Green Bomber

drinks.comment: Very light and refreshing. A good summertime drink, but tasty anytime.
drinks.name: Betsy Clear

drinks.comment: A friend of mine mixed this for herself at a party and I enjoyed it so much that I decided to try making it myself. It is a very refreshing summer drink especially if you like either peachy stuff or pink lemonade. Enjoy!

drinks.comment: Excellent drink and doesn't taste like vodka at all.
drinks.name: Hawaiian Sunset

drinks.instructions: Pour beer, ginger ale, vodka, light rum, and ameretto in a funnel. Turn the funnel while you drink it.

drinks.instructions: Pour 151 last and light.

drinks.comment: The Aliz and Champagne should be cold because the drink is better served chilled not with ice. I prefer to use Hennessy for the cognac and Moet  Chandon for the champagne. However any champagne and cognac will work.

drinks.instructions: Ice first, next is the liquor and then the pop.

drinks.comment: Will create a red, white and blue layered drink.

drinks.instructions: Chill and serve in large shot glass

drinks.comment: Enjoy while you can still see strait!

drinks.instructions: Shake all! in glass with 3 ice cubes

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients over ice and stir.

drinks.comment: If you love coconut, try this!

drinks.comment: From the Jell-o website you can order jiggler molds in various shapes and themes. They're relatively inexpensive and are great for theme parties (we used the halloween jiggler mold to make jiggler shots for a halloween party, they came out really cool) This recipe worked for four molds, but can be cut in half.

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients over ice and mix in a shaker
drinks.name: Blue Whale

drinks.comment: A great tasting shot invented by Jen in the Beacon Hill Pub in Boston.

drinks.comment: Vayr amount of milk to taste.

drinks.instructions: Combine cream soda and gin. Stir well
drinks.name: The N8er T8er

drinks.comment: This is the first drink we ever had. We got someone to go in and buy us some rum (when we were under age) but they bought us rye whiskey instead. We did not know what to mix it with so we got ginger ale and then some limeade. We mixed 3 oz drinks and it was smooth! We recommend Canadian Club Rye Whiskey as that is the BEST and it is what we used that night. The name came from a Phil Collins video," living in a nuclear world", when we were trying to figure out a name, a Rubber Chicken flew by on the video. That's all folks!
drinks.name: Rubber Chicken
ingredients: Fill with 1 part Limeade mix from concentrate

drinks.comment: Maker's Mark is a bourbon whiskey from Loretta Ky with limited distribution.
drinks.name: Mark n' Club

drinks.instructions: Just drink it as soon as you mix it, and it might taste funny because of the prune juice but you should get an effect out of it.

drinks.comment: The #1 bestseller drink in the the Puertoricans beaches!

drinks.comment: Drink is also known as a Jolly Rancher.

If you can't get your hands on Sweetened Condensed Milk, use regular milk, sugar and sweetener instead. -- P.S: make sure ice-cream is plain, if it's got like chips and stuff inside, it won't be as nice. Enjoy!

This recipe is based on one which came from Zaphod Beeblebrox's, a bar in Ottawa. However, the drink has circulated around Nova Scotia fandom a lot and has probably changed a bit.

drinks.comment: This is "the best drink in existence." Drinking one is like having your brains smashed out by a slice of lemon wrapped around a LARGE gold brick. Drink...but...very carefully....

drinks.comment: This is a great drink for those cold winter nights when regular hot chocolate doesn't do the trick.

drinks.comment: Printed in Hamar Arbeiderblad, December 14. 1996.
drinks.name: Bisp

drinks.instructions: All sodas and alcohol should be chilled an mixed with a stirring stick before topped with whipped cream and a cherry.

drinks.comment: Designed, tested and appoved by the brave men and women of the West Virginia University Drink Research Center.

drinks.comment: Designed, tested and approved by the brave men and women of the West Virginia University Drink Research Center.
drinks.name: Peppermint Aztec

drinks.comment: For a more creamy refreshment, blend with ice and half-and-half.

drinks.instructions: Fill collins glass with ice. Add malibu and fill with pineapple juice. Add grenadine and splash of 7-up.

drinks.comment: I made this drink up in college. It is named for my childhood hero and my favorite Disney character. Its sweet flavor and golden color remind me of that silly, nilly, willy old bear. I tend to like this drink best on hot, humid nights. The cream soda really takes the edge off of the whiskey. You can adjust the ingredients to taste, but too much cream soda tends to make this drink almost sickly-sweet. It's definitely a whiskey lover's drink.
drinks.name: Pooh Bear

drinks.comment: The crisp snap of ginger ale makes this cocktail perfect for an afternoon nip, or if you're in the mood for something light, fancy and bubbly. Variations: Poor White Trash: Substitute Sprite for Ginger Ale. Trailer Trash: Substitute Lemon-Lime Slice for Sprite.
drinks.name: White Trash

drinks.instructions: Add one shot of butterscotch Schnapps to the hot chocolate. Top off with Bailey's.

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients(in any order) in a large tub, which can hold several gallons. Stir so that the Sherbert is completely dissolved. With the exception of the kool-aid and sherbert, as much or little of the other ingredients may be used.

drinks.instructions: Shake and Strain the Butterscotch, Bailey's, and Goldschlager into a cocktail glass. Float the Sambuca, then sprinkle Cinnamon or Nutmeg into drink (Before you flame the drink). Just before presentation, flame the drink. As the Sambuca burns, the cinnamon will sparkle. A dazzling effect if the bartender or server is walking with the drink while it's burning (give the comet a tail).
drinks.name: Bailey's Comet #1

drinks.instructions: Shake and Strain contents into a highball glass filled with ice. Tastes just like the popsicle
drinks.name: Dreamsicle #2

drinks.comment: This is a very tasty drink.
drinks.name: Imagination

drinks.comment: This is not a joke drink, it is strong and very few people actually enjoy it, but some of us do, after you shoot the drink start poring down the beer, or else you will be lighing under the water tap the rest of the evening. :)
drinks.name: Harakiri shot

drinks.comment: Posted to rec.food.recipes by Janie McKinney.
drinks.name: Crockpot Mulled Cider
ingredients: 1 piece Ginger root , 1 inch, peeled and thinly sliced
8 cups Apple cider or apple juice

drinks.comment: Posted to rec.food.recipes by Dan Aleksandrowicz.
drinks.name: Grand Marnier

drinks.instructions: In a heavy saucepan, combine the ingredients and warm over low heat. When small bubbles appear around the sides of the pan, remove it from the heat and let the mixture sit at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes. Place the pan back on the stove and rewarm the mixture, whisking it briefly to redistribute the skin that forms on the milk's surface. Remove the vanilla bean half, scrape out the seeds with a sharp knife, and return the seeds to the milk. Pour the vanilla milk into two 8-ounce mugs and top with sprinklings of cinnamon or canela. Drink hot.
drinks.name: Hot Vanilla
ingredients: Ground Cinnamon or canela for granish

drinks.instructions: Shake. Strain over ice. Float coke on top.

drinks.instructions: Layer in cordial glass.

drinks.comment: Usually made in a large batch using above ratios and served punch style at parties.

drinks.comment: Source: The Book "Els coctels del Boadas"
drinks.name: Joan Miró

drinks.comment: Tia Maria or Creme de Cacao may be used in place of the Kahlua.

drinks.comment: Nice smooth taste. Close to tequila sunrise.

drinks.comment: Created in the Dorms of Northeastern University in Boston, after a Red Sox game.

drinks.comment: If this excellent database had a category called disgusting drinks I guess that this drink would appear there, but it taste better than it looks.

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredientes in a shaker ( with ice) and shake it !! enjoy....

drinks.comment: Invented by a great drunk, James Hong.

drinks.name: Sour Apple #2

drinks.instructions: Serve warm. Straight into the shot glass.
drinks.name: The End of the World

drinks.comment: May be odd to look at, but tastes delicious, (definitely for the sweet tooth) and goes down very well.
drinks.name: Chameleon

drinks.instructions: Add one shot of Southern Comfort and a splash of Dr. Pepper in a shot glass.
drinks.name: Flaming Hurley

drinks.instructions: Mix three shots together in a glass. Pour over ice. Sit down and drink.
drinks.name: The Bootlegger

drinks.comment: Taste like Raspberry. The only complaint is that your tongue will look like a smurf's beacuse of the Blue Tattoo.
drinks.name: Tattooed Smurf

drinks.comment: I made this drink at College and served it to my friends. They got hammered and called it the bitch slap cause it knocks you on your ass. Be careful though, it is really strong!
drinks.name: Bitch Slap

drinks.instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a big ol' jar and enjoy!
drinks.name: Jim Kroener

drinks.comment: It is similar to a Melon Sour but with more kick. Don't let the Everclear scare you away - this drink as mixed is around 20% alcohol. It is very smooth and many people have liked it.
drinks.name: Melon Jones

drinks.comment: This is great drink for when you don't want to drink something citrus-based, or on warm nights. If you make it right it should taste like an apple tree (or cherryapple tree if you add grenadine). Named after an infamous University of Illinois Bus Line.
drinks.name: Orchard Downs

drinks.instructions: Add all ingredients to a cocktail shaker or pitcher with several ice cubes and stir. Strain into glass straight up or on the rocks and garnish with a stick of celery.
drinks.name: Bullshot #4

drinks.instructions: Blend ingredients with crushed ice.
drinks.name: Eroticolada

drinks.comment: Also known as Hurricane
drinks.name: 40 Water

drinks.instructions: Shake ice, vodka and melon liquer. Strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Melonoma

drinks.instructions: Combine all ingredients and serve as a shot or mixed drink.
drinks.name: Fruit Salad

drinks.comment: This one will knock you off your feet!
drinks.name: Axe Murderer

drinks.instructions: This drink is best when shaken and strained, but the proper way is to layer the drink. Kahlua is poured first, then Bailey's is next, and Frangelico is layered on top.
drinks.name: B-51

drinks.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
drinks.name: Mickey Mouse

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice and top off with cranberry juice.
drinks.name: Funky Cold Medina

drinks.instructions: Mix over ice in highball glass.
drinks.name: Campari Orange

drinks.instructions: Just mix Amer Picon and beer in a pilsner.
drinks.name: Picon Biere

drinks.comment: Dreamed up one slow evening at the DayBreak in Mountain View, CA.
drinks.name: Sno-Cone

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into sour glass.
drinks.name: Tie Me To The Bedpost #1

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients into blender and blend until smooth.
drinks.name: Kiwi Colada

drinks.comment: Can also be blended in blender!
drinks.name: Glaucoma

drinks.instructions: Pour malibu rum in a highball glass, and top with orange juice. Stir. Add grenadine by tilting glass and pouring grenadine down side by flipping the bottle vertically very quickly. The grenadine should go straight to the bottom and then rise up slowly through the drink.
drinks.name: Malibu Sunrise

drinks.instructions: Moisten rim of coffee mug with lime and dip rim in sugar. Pour liqueurs into mug and fill with coffee. Top with whipped cream.
drinks.name: Cancun Coffee

drinks.instructions: Layer with 151 rum on top. Light on fire - Burn for 5 seconds - Blow it out and drink.
drinks.name: Flaming Blue Jesus

drinks.comment: Makes a nice foamy drink with a chocolate-mint flavour, which is quite rich tasting. Was made in an Irish pub in the Annapolis valley of Nova Scotia. Became a local favorite and specialty.
drinks.name: Jeremiah

drinks.instructions: First pour vodka, then soy sauce, into the shot glass.
drinks.name: Manchurian Candidate

drinks.comment: The mix of cranberry juice and Collins mix covers the taste of vodka very well. This is an excellent drink!
drinks.name: Cran-Collins

drinks.instructions: Mix with ice in a hurricane glass.
drinks.name: Tie Me To The Bedpost, Baby

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients with ice in mixing glass. Shake and strain.
drinks.name: Raspberry Kiss

drinks.instructions: Serve on the rocks or blend with ice to make a Frozen Melon Margarita.
drinks.name: Melon Margarita

drinks.comment: It is really sweet.. an actual good-tasting shot
drinks.name: Sammy Slammer

drinks.comment: I suppose you could substitute vanilla liqueur or vodka for the southern comfort.
drinks.name: Vanilla Coke

drinks.instructions: Fill glass Half full of ice. Add Southern Comfort and peach schnapps. Fill glass with ginger ale. stir and serve.
drinks.name: Peachy Comfort

drinks.comment: As with all flaming drinks, please make sure drink is out before drinking!
drinks.name: Bonsai Pipeline

drinks.comment: This drink is also known as a beam me up scotty, only layer ingredients in shooter glass and drink!
drinks.name: Fuck Me Up

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients in coffee mug, top with whipped cream.
drinks.name: Hot Butterscotch Cocoa

drinks.instructions: Pour the malibu rum, banana liqueur, and cherry brandy. Add the ice and sprite. Add lime wedge and serve.
drinks.name: Cornholio's Revenge

drinks.instructions: Place ice in glass and pour in the five liquors. Next pour in the the orage juice and the sour mix. Finally shake and garnish with an orange slice.
drinks.name: Five in the Morning

drinks.instructions: Pour 3/4 oz Absolut Citron in a highball glass, balance with cranberry juice, top with 7-up, and garnish with lime.
drinks.name: Mazerati

drinks.instructions: Pour 1/2 oz. of Blue Curacao and a 1/2 oz. of vodka in a highball glass. Top with Pineapple juice and a splash of 7-up. Garnish with a cherry.
drinks.name: Coast-Line

drinks.comment: Make sure you serve over ice. Taste great.
drinks.name: Purple Fantasy

drinks.comment: From the alcoholics in Rm. 607.
drinks.name: 607 Special

drinks.instructions: Pour 1/2 oz. vodka and a 1/2 oz. blueberry schnapps in a tall glass. Balance with cranberry juice.
drinks.name: Blue-Woo

drinks.instructions: Put Kahlua in the glass. Put vodka in the (same) glass. Put tonic in the (same) glass. Suck from the bottom up with two straws.
drinks.name: Kahlua Madness

drinks.instructions: Mix Southern Comfort and Lime Juice in the Martini Glass. Top off with a pinch of Powdered Sugar. Add One Large Ice Cube. Serve.
drinks.name: Lion Tamer

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice. Pour into a highball glass. Garnish with a cherry.
drinks.name: Tie Me To The Bedpost #2

drinks.comment: This drink was made by two American high school students on an exchange trip in Germany. The drink should be green at the time of consumption.
drinks.name: Green Widow

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice in glass, stir and serve.
drinks.name: Long Summer Night

drinks.instructions: In a shaker, mix ingredients with ice and shake vigorously. Strain over ice in a Hurricane glass. Garnish with pineapple wedge and cherry.
drinks.name: El Nino

drinks.instructions: Add all ingredients into shot glass, slam it on the table and shoot it, followed promptly with a beer.
drinks.name: Wild Berry Pop-Tart

drinks.instructions: Layer Kahlua, Creme de Cacao, and Bailey's (on top), then top with a splash of vodka.
drinks.name: Oreo Cookie

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingrediants with ice and strain. Serve chilled.
drinks.name: 8 Seconds

drinks.comment: It tases amazingly good. We named this while listing to the URge then everone got wasted (187).
drinks.name: 187 URge

drinks.comment: If you mix it right all you should taste is the sprite. It has a bit of a twang to it.
drinks.name: Vodka Ricki

drinks.comment: Anyone who has read the Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy can appreciate the name of this drink. Most of my customers have trouble pronouncing it. But you can have a lot of fun forcing people to remember it when they order. This one is very popular with the ladies, as it is VERY easy to drink, and hey, I just like the name of it.
drinks.name: Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster #5

drinks.instructions: In a blender, crush a hand full or two of ice. Then add the frozen pink lemonade and Malibu Rum. Blend until it becomes somewhat smooth (usually less than 30 seconds). Then add the whipped cream while leaving the blender running. This will add the consistency to your drink and therefore the amount of whipped cream is to your discression. Blend until smooth and serve.
drinks.name: Malibu Pink Panther

drinks.instructions: Pour vodka and rum over ice. Add 7-up and stir. Add Amaretto (without stirring) and enjoy.
drinks.name: 357 Magnum

drinks.instructions: Layer in shot glass.
drinks.name: L.A.P.D. Nightshift

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Green Sneaker

drinks.instructions: Fill highball half full with ice. Add coconut rum. Fill with eggnog. Stir in grenadine to desired red (no more than 1 oz).
drinks.name: Southern Santa

drinks.comment: This is a feature drink from a restaurant I worked in.
drinks.name: Smooth Sailing

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients in bowl and mix well.
drinks.name: Jim Beam's Redneck Friend

drinks.instructions: Mix blue curacao and melon liqueur (cold strain for best results) and top off with 2 splashes of Canadian Club Rye.
drinks.name: Rocky Mountain Bear Fuck

drinks.instructions: Mix liquor and juices in mixing cup and blend. Pour over ice in collins glass top with grenadine and splash of 7-up. Garnish with a flag or two cherries.
drinks.name: Mandy Sea

drinks.comment: This drink came about one of those nights when you have nothing for mix and you have to improvise. Lo and behold the fruit punch proved to be very tasty.
drinks.name: Jamaican Jambaylaya

drinks.instructions: stir well with ice. Adding a few drops of hot sauce for flavor is optional.
drinks.name: Bloody Pearl Harbor

drinks.comment: Invented at the Red Bear Lounge, Marion Indiana, October 1996, By Dene "The Dragon" Whelchel. -- 7-up  Ice can be added, as this is a very potent drink.
drinks.name: Red Dragons Breath

drinks.comment: This is a favorite shooter of ours at Sports Fans in DC. It should be a green color.
drinks.name: Fat Box

drinks.comment: Discovered by Hernan Barangan and Chris Newnan in Jan 1989
drinks.name: Hershey Squirts

drinks.comment: If done properly you can end up with a blue/green/pink/purple drink, but it is best to experiment.
drinks.name: Purple Helmeted Warrior

drinks.comment: Drink fast with a straw. If you are slow your straw will burn. Be careful!
drinks.name: Flaming Asshole

drinks.instructions: Pour both liquors in a shot glass.
drinks.name: Killer Bee

drinks.instructions: Fill mug half way with beer. Splash Rum on Tequila in shot glass, then light with match. Drop flaming shot glass in mug. Drop in a lime slice. Chug it.
drinks.name: Sweaty Mexican

drinks.comment: The ginger beer makes the drink.
drinks.name: Dark and Stormy #2

drinks.instructions: Add the egg nog and Goldschlager together in a bowl. Add nutmeg if desired.
drinks.name: Schlag-n-nog

drinks.comment: I prefer to not mix it as I get to progress into a stronger drink as the jar get nearer to the end. -- Made by a Colorado College Goalie when he is depressed and needs a drink.
drinks.name: Depressed Goalie

drinks.comment: Straight cranberry juice works just as well, but its not as sweet.
drinks.name: Aggie Punch

drinks.instructions: Half fill glass with crushed ice. Add rum, triple sec, orange juice, and pineapple juice. Stir. Add Grenadine and top with cherry and other fruit.
drinks.name: Tropical Sunrise

drinks.instructions: Add limeade concentrate, Pisco, and triple sec in blender. Add ice until blender is full. Blend on high speed adding water until blender is full while blending. Serve in margarita glass rimmed with salt if desired.
drinks.name: Pisco-rita

drinks.instructions: Blend quickly and serve.
drinks.name: Green Ocean

drinks.comment: Equivilent to about 6 or 7 drinks, the wild combo of hard liquors will get you drunk, guarranteed, nothing's left to chance with this one!
drinks.name: Westwood Ice Tea

drinks.comment: Great sweet drink for relaxing. Not a party drink, don't drink this expecting to get wasted, you wont, expect to drink, and be relaxed.
drinks.name: Santa Monica Pier

drinks.comment: This is a delicious drink. Drink it with your girlfriend/boyfriend, or a close friend, with slow jams in the background.
drinks.name: Cinnamon Toast Crunch

drinks.comment: If you want to get wasted fast, with less volume in a sweet and warm drink, this is the perfect drink for you. No drinking party should be complete without a shot of 49er Gold Rush!
drinks.name: 49er Gold Rush

drinks.instructions: Pour each ingredient in a shaker. Shake well. Serve over ice.
drinks.name: Wild Wendy

drinks.instructions: Layer liquors in a shot glass.
drinks.name: Afterlanche

drinks.instructions: Pour three liquors in a shot glass. Better if chilled, prettier if layered.
drinks.name: Uncle Sam

drinks.comment: An extra strong and extra delicious Margarita, guaranteed a party hit!
drinks.name: Rieber Red Margarita

drinks.comment: This is a strong margarita. But the great mix of the Strawberry mix and the Sweet and Sour Mix make an incredible impression.
drinks.name: Gayley Avenue Margarita

drinks.comment: This is an incredibly delicious drink, like an alcoholic orange sherbert. Its a great party drink, and a great kickback drink.
drinks.name: 3rd Street Promanade

drinks.comment: "Oh show me, the way, to the next whiskey bar, oh don't ask why, oh don't ask why, for if we don't find, the next whiskey bar, I tell you we must die, I tell you we must die, I tell you, I tell you, I tell you we must die!" -- This one's harsh ladies, and gentleman. Any whiskey lover will love it.
drinks.name: Jim Morrison

drinks.comment: This drink is extremly harsh, so be careful with it!
drinks.name: Death From Above

drinks.instructions: Start with ice filled beer mug. Add tabasco first. Shake twice, a bad blend is terrible!
drinks.name: Klingon Blood Wine

drinks.comment: You can add a dash of nutmeg or cinnamon on top.
drinks.name: Ice Cappuccino

drinks.comment: You can add nutmeg or cinnamon on top.
drinks.name: Insomniac

drinks.instructions: Blend all ingredients. Pour into Poco grande glass.
drinks.name: Dark Indulgence

drinks.instructions: Blend all ingredients and pour into champagne flute. Add a small piece of edible dry ice.
drinks.name: Cyber Smoke

drinks.instructions: Blend all ingredients and pour into cocktail glass. Add a piece of edilbe dry ice.
drinks.name: Forbidden Smoke

drinks.instructions: Pour two of each ingredients in a shot glass then use a coaster to put one shot glass over the top of one another.
drinks.name: 360 degress

drinks.instructions: Pour and build in a tall glass or collins glass. Fill with 7-up. Garnish with cherry and lime.
drinks.name: Diva

drinks.instructions: stir until ingredients are mixed well.
drinks.name: Bananas and Cream

drinks.instructions: light on fire for five seconds blow out and suck through a straw.
drinks.name: Flaming Fruit Trees

drinks.instructions: mix banana and watermelon liqueur in shot glass top with vodka.
drinks.name: Absolutely Fruity

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients and light on fire. Blow out flame, saddle up, and enjoy the ride!
drinks.name: Fiery Blue Mustang

drinks.instructions: add in the order written and mix then add the grenadine
drinks.name: Chocolate Covered Cherry Shot

drinks.instructions: Mix all together and take all at once as a shot.
drinks.name: Indian Summer

drinks.comment: This drink was invented by a friend at Carnegie-Mellon University. It's a great party drink! Thanks to Evan Benoit!
drinks.name: Dr. Kevorkian

drinks.comment: If the proportions seem a little strong feel free to change the amounts of ingredients as needed, or a few shots of water instead of some of the shots of rum. This recipe should make enough for 2-4 people, depending upon the size of your margarita glasses.
drinks.name: Blonde Bombshell

drinks.instructions: Pour pear brandy and lime juice over ice in glass. Fill with sprite.
drinks.name: Lennart

drinks.instructions: Mix together and have a good time.
drinks.name: Schnappster

drinks.comment: This drink was created by Chad Spooner at the Ore House restaurant in Vail, Colorado. If you are in town, stop by and have an Orange Surfboard with him!
drinks.name: Orange Surfboard

drinks.comment: Do not blend!! Do not serve in a hurricane glass!
drinks.name: Lime Vodka Collins

drinks.instructions: Combine all ingredients in mug. Let stand until room temperature. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Flaming Anus

drinks.comment: This is a very popular drink in Door Co. Wisconsin (The Cape Cod of the Midwest), where cherries are one of the largest crops in the area.
drinks.name: Cherry Bomb #2

drinks.comment: If you like cherry cheesecake, this Award-winning shot is as close as you can get to the real thing without all of the grams of fat.
drinks.name: Door County Cherry Cheesecake

drinks.comment: This is the type of drink where you can barely taste the Vodka unless you mix more than 1/2 oz. of Vokda in with the Snapple. If you like Snapple and have ever thought of mixing alcohol with your favorite non-iced tea flavor, then this is the drink for you.
drinks.name: Smirnoff Snapple Spikage
ingredients: Fill with Kiwi Strawberry or Grapeade Snapple

drinks.instructions: Pour in the ingredients - Then put a dash of Angostura on the cube - put it in the champagne by using a tong.
drinks.name: Kordulas Special

drinks.comment: By adding the shot to coffee, a "Steamy Girl Scout" will be made.
drinks.name: Naked Girl Scout

drinks.comment: Our regimental drink, easy to drink.
drinks.name: Little Black Devil

drinks.comment: Drinking and fire can be a bad mix, be careful. This drink was invented by Jason Halfman
drinks.name: The Other Half

drinks.instructions: It is best to use a large cooler with a spout. The amount of Vodka and Gin you use depends on the size of your cooler. Add the ingredients to your prefered taste.
drinks.name: Yellow Motherfuckers

drinks.comment: The drink has a very sweet taste. However, it can can be ruined by adding too much grenadine. So, be careful.
drinks.name: Russian Candy

drinks.comment: Play some Sargent Pepper's Lonely Heart's Band or other Beatle's favorites and enjoy.
drinks.name: The Ringo

drinks.comment: The name says it all. Don't expect to survive the next three days.
drinks.name: Ebola

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients in glass over ice and enjoy!
drinks.name: Atomic Watermelon

drinks.instructions: Pour 2 1/2 oz. frangelico into a tall glass and fill with strong coffee. Top with a scoop of ice-cream.
drinks.name: Snow Cap Columbian Monk

drinks.instructions: Place a few ice cubes into the glass, add the Aftershock, then the Kool-Aid. Stir to mix. Enjoy
drinks.name: KoolShock

drinks.comment: This is a common drink and may be listed under different titles. This is the Northern U.S. name for it.
drinks.name: Bacci Ball

drinks.instructions: Pour Frangelico into glass, then honey, next lemon peel and cloves and fill snifter with hot water.
drinks.name: Hot Nun

drinks.comment: Cream soda doesn't have much carbonation in the first place, so try not to stir too much.
drinks.name: Captain's and Creme

drinks.instructions: Fill shot glass with 1/3 oz Amaretto and 2/3 oz root beer schnapps, next drop shot glass into mug of beer and drink before it fizzes over the mug.
drinks.name: Dive Bomber

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients into shaker over ice. Shake ans strain.
drinks.name: Evil Tongue

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice or snow. Pour in lemonade. Add Vodka. Splash in grenadine (it should seep to the bottom).
drinks.name: Igloo Sue

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Serve in a longdrink glass.
drinks.name: Aperol Schuhmann

drinks.instructions: Mixed in a shaker on ice. Serve in a Tumbler on crushed ice
drinks.name: Zombie #5

drinks.comment: This drink was shown to me by a friend who created it with his fraternity brothers. They are the ones who deserve the credit. I placed it in here so all could try this tasty drink.
drinks.name: Hiroshima Bomber

drinks.comment: Can be made as a drink by adding more cream
drinks.name: Captain Crunch

drinks.instructions: Pour in the 6 oz. of triple sec to the sweet tea and add the juice of 2 lemon wedges to it. Leave lemon wedges in drink then add 5 ice cubes. Stir gently.
drinks.name: Tea-riffic

drinks.comment: We invented this on our last day of finals.
drinks.name: Winter Tropic

drinks.instructions: Pour Vodka and gin simultaneously. Add strawberry and cranberry together. Fill the rest with orange juice.
drinks.name: Carman's Dance
ingredients: Fill with Orange juice without pulp

drinks.instructions: Pour blueberry schnapps into champagne flute. Fill with champagne.
drinks.name: Blow Blue Bubbles

drinks.comment: This drink is one of those that will sneak up on you. If mixed right you won't be able to taste the alcohol. Make sure you got room for you party guests to sleep. Enjoy
drinks.name: Shark's Mai Tai

drinks.comment: This is basically a glass of iced coffee with a White Russian and a shot of VanderMint
drinks.name: Siberian Dutchman

drinks.instructions: Mix with ice, strain into a shot glass.
drinks.name: Rocky Mountain Motherfucker #2

drinks.instructions: Pour apple pucker into glass, add granadine, then fill glass with lemonade. Can be served on ice.
drinks.name: April's Apple

drinks.comment: Invented by some guys in Tucson, Arizona in 1989 at a hotel party near the U of A campus.
drinks.name: Polish Professor

drinks.comment: I made my sour mix from 3 parts sugar added to 2 parts water, then heated till boiling. This syrup mixture was then added to equal a equal part of Lemon or Lime juice. The ginger ale was to make the drink less sweet. My twist on the Whiskey Sour. I suggest using Rye Whiskey. - D.G. Dec/97.
drinks.name: Neuralizer

drinks.instructions: Combine vermouth and Absolut in mixing glass over ice and stir. Strain into a cocktail glass with a salted rim.
drinks.name: Salt and Pepper Martini

drinks.instructions: Pout all ingredients in a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain into large white wine glasses half-filled with crushed ice.
drinks.name: Wrightsville Sunset

drinks.instructions: Combine Malibu Rum and Blue Curacao shake, then add juices.Serve over ice in highball glass.
drinks.name: Malibu Pop

drinks.comment: Really nice for parties and for drinking together with Sangria.
drinks.name: Peach Punch

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Tropical Peach Martini

drinks.comment: A great christmas drink!
drinks.name: Red Rudolph

drinks.instructions: Blend Pear Liqueur, Milk and Ice Add 7-up to taste
drinks.name: Snowflake

drinks.instructions: Mix hot water and jello. Add rum. Pour into 2 ounce cups. Serve after the jello has set.
drinks.name: Jello Shot

drinks.comment: Have chaser ready!
drinks.name: Lava

drinks.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with strawberry.
drinks.name: Aperol '86

drinks.instructions: Pour Apoerol and gin over ice in a highball glass. Stir. Fill with sparkling white wine.
drinks.name: Shaft

drinks.instructions: Shake all ingredients with ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Ortensia

drinks.comment: Created by Joe and JR on a random Tuesday night at 5 am.
drinks.name: Leprechaun's Gold

drinks.comment: If you have access to fresh mint, this will make for some memorable (or blissfully forgettable) summer nights. Although Minneapolis has its downsides, sipping these with friends on the porch was not one of them.
drinks.name: Lawn Boy

drinks.comment: Adjust rum and amaretto to taste
drinks.name: Lewie

drinks.comment: Trader  Trapper, Moorhead, MN.
drinks.name: Thunder and Lighting

drinks.comment: This is the version I learned. Enjoy, but be careful of the high boot factor.
drinks.name: Screaming Nazi #2

drinks.comment: Tastes just like a Orange Julius.
drinks.name: Screaming Epsilon

drinks.comment: A bunch of friends and I figured this drink out at a party in the fall of '97, and we pretty much all like it.
drinks.name: Green Summer

drinks.instructions: Two ice cubes , 2oz of crown, 1 shot of vodka, and fill the rest with coca cola
drinks.name: C-MOB

drinks.instructions: Pour butterscotch over rum. Do not stir.
drinks.name: Bleacher Creature

drinks.comment: If asthma attack occurs, quickly follow with a Purple Motherfucker.
drinks.name: Asthma Attack

drinks.comment: This drink is sooo tasty that Generations Y  Z won't be able to pass it up either!
drinks.name: Generation X

drinks.instructions: Put 4 ice cubes in shaker. Add ingredients. shake well and serve in a margarita glass. Garnish with lime.
drinks.name: Donkey Semmen

drinks.comment: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota. Bailey's Irish Cream can be substituted for the Swiss Mocha Cream Liqueur.
drinks.name: Naked Shake

drinks.instructions: Combine ingredients in an empty shaker. Shake vigorously then pour contents into a tall cocktail glass filled with crushed ice. Garnish with a slice of orange, a wedge of pineapple or a cherry (or all three).
drinks.name: Mullens Mai Tai

drinks.comment: Just one of the creations invented at The RoadHouse NightClub in International Falls, Minnesota -- Bailey's Irish Cream can be substituted for the Swiss Mocha Cream Liqueur.
drinks.name: Mistletoe

drinks.comment: In honor of a bartender who said vodka makes her vicious!
drinks.name: Vicious Kiss

drinks.comment: A strong drink that flushes your tastebuds with layers of sweet, then sour, then tequila, then bitter.
drinks.name: Quick's Killaritas

drinks.comment: Recipe courtesy of Teresa at H.L. Franklin's in Birmingham, Alabama.
drinks.name: Smoothie

drinks.comment: This is a fruity drink that was invented by a friend of mine and i should give him credit for it. He introduced it to me, so here's to you Bobby!
drinks.name: A Fuzzy Thing

drinks.instructions: Mix in shot glass. Serve.
drinks.name: Funky Chicken

drinks.comment: I'm more of a baker and chef than a bartender. I put one of these together while making a Harvey Wallbanger Cake. The first time I made it, it had equal parts Galliano and Vodka. This made it lose alot of it's screwdriver taste. Oh, and the cake turned out fine, even after a couple of these. Enjoy. - Cody
drinks.name: Italian Screw

drinks.comment: This was the first legal drink that I had which was served to me by a bartender who has bartended throughout the states.
drinks.name: Naked Surfer

drinks.instructions: Add banana, strawberry, pinapple, ice, and captain morgan, into blender, and mix into slush. Pour into glass, top with cherry and orange slice on side.
drinks.name: Laura's Surprise

drinks.comment: I use 2 oz shot glasses to mix this into a glass. You can modify it for a pitcher or punch bowl or whatever, I suppose. My Fiance  I came up with this last New Years, and it was a hit at our party.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Banana

drinks.comment: Sometimes it is best to make it right in the can of Mountain dew.
drinks.name: Fluxuation Cocktail

drinks.comment: Great after rodeo drink.
drinks.name: Bull Breaker

drinks.instructions: Lick hand and put a dash of salt on hand, then lick salt and drink Cuervo first, then orange juice, then tomatoe juice.
drinks.name: Rooster Tail

drinks.instructions: Fill shot glass 2/3 full with Bailey's and then top it off with Crown Royal.

drinks.comment: The amount can be slightly more or less, depending on the drinker's preference. Women tend to prefer more 7-Up and men tend to prefer more beer when asked. BUT, half and half are the ususal measurements. -- This drink is very popular in most of Spain, but especially in Madrid. You order it if you really don't want to drink a lot. It's a very "social" drink. People not used to drinking find it very gentle. In Spain, 7-Up is known, but "gaseosa" is what's used in the drink. My Spanish friends who visit the USA prefer 7-Up to other "gaseosa" substitutes.

drinks.comment: This drink was created in honor of famed Chicago Blackhawk Steve Dubinsky. Its inspiration came from a night of drinking and watching the Mighty Blackhawks. In an overtime thriller, Steve made a "sprawling" attempt to stop a shot. While his attempt to be hero failed miserably(and the Hawks lost), it still looked pretty cool. In honor of this moment we drank the innagural "Sprawling Dubinsky" one part Johnnie Walker Red and one part Johnnie Walker Black because of the Hawks colors. One part Citron, because the Hawks suck, and finally a touch of amaretto for flavor.
drinks.name: Sprawling Dubinsky

drinks.comment: This drink can be made as a regular or tall shot or can be built gently (so as to preserve the fizz) in a bottle for pouring into many individual shot glasses for a 'Group Head Slam'. Keep doing these 'til you understand the expression, "Eppa, Eppa, Andele!"

drinks.comment: I created this drink last summer when I was looking for something strong yet tropical to drink. The high concentration of alcohol in the brandy, ouzo, etc. provided an array of fullness, while the Blue Curacao, lemon and lime juices provided the tropical flavour. The ice is there simply to chill the mixture and so that you experience brain freeze when you drink the thing. If you're still standing up straight after drinking one of these, let me know you're alive and that you had the balls to take the challenge of drinking one. Enjoy!

drinks.comment: Bacardi 151 is essential to the proper effect of this drink. The taste of the 151 should be hidden by the Bailey's, Kahlua, and Amaretto. The shot will go down smooth and hit hard a couple of minutes later - thus, the brain destroyer. How hard this drink hits depends on big a dash of 151 you add. Don't add too much or the shot won't go down smooth. Much respect must go out to my boy, Armand Aquino, who showed me how to make this shot. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Brain Destroyer

drinks.comment: Q: how many trashed blokes does it take too chate de chate de chaytch? A: Two!! -- Steve and Simon@British Embassy Rock Bar, Redhill, Surrey, England .

drinks.comment: This is how I learned to make the famous drink of Larchmont Yacht Club on Long Island Sound. It is named for the great drinking/racing family of Commodore, Bizzy, and Jimmy Montesano. You can look for their name on sailing trophies everywhere. When at Larchmont a Monte-Sano is standard operating gear for all activites. Best when made by the pitcher for all the crew, paid for by the skipper.
drinks.name: Monte-Sano

drinks.comment: Its a very cool and tropical drink that is popular here in the northwest part of the states

drinks.comment: Great on a summer day. Inspired (with apologies) by James Lee Burke's Dave Robicheaux novels. Try also with Dr. Pepper.

drinks.comment: Inspired by the "Moscow Mule" or just plain "Mule", which is the same drink with vodka.
drinks.name: Kentucky Mule

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into glass with light ice, can also be served as a shooter
drinks.name: Red Frog

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice and strain over ice cherry garnish
drinks.name: Sexual Trance

drinks.instructions: Put the Spiced Rum in the glass. Fill with cherry coke. Stir.
drinks.name: Spiced Cherry

drinks.instructions: Boil one cup water. Add the package of cherry jello. Stir for 2 minutes. Then pour in the cup of spiced rum. Stir until mixed. Pour into a pan and refrigerate.
drinks.name: Spiced Cherry Jello

drinks.instructions: Pour pink grapefruit juice and ginger ale into punch bowl. Pour raspberry juice or 12 oz frozen raspberries into punch bowl (if using frozen raspberries, be sure to stir to un-thaw after adding to punch bowl). Add sherbet into punch and stir until majority of it is melted.
drinks.name: Raspberry Punch

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice chips.
drinks.name: Cocoboodo

drinks.comment: I made this up for a few guys at T  C or Town  Country Inn in Orwell, Ohio. Now everyone drinks it.
drinks.name: Crystal Virgin

drinks.instructions: Pour the liqueur into the glass first, then add the Cider. Serve cold.
drinks.name: Baked Apple

drinks.instructions: Add the Cider to the liqueur. Serve Cold
drinks.name: Green Apple Cider

drinks.instructions: Add the Cider to the liqueur. Serve Cold
drinks.name: Black Bird Cider

drinks.comment: This drink works best in the Bionic drinking game, so keep playing.
drinks.name: The Bionic Drink
ingredients: Fill with Grapefruit juice or soda

drinks.comment: This is a nice alternative to traditional Martini. The strong tast of the Midori cuts the bitterness of the Gin a bit (and makes the drink bright green). Just imagine how intrigued everyone will be when you walk around the party with a martini glass with what looks like antifreeze in it.
drinks.name: Martian Martini

drinks.comment: This drink is a classic to the old mint chocolate flavor usually found in ice cream.
drinks.name: Tainted Heart

drinks.comment: This drink was created while I had a case of Poison Ivy. It has a special meaning. The Kahlua stands for the poison, and the Aftershock stands for the body. When layered, the poison has been touched. When mixed, the poisonous oils have been drank.
drinks.name: Poison Ivy

drinks.instructions: Mix over ice. Shake and serve.
drinks.name: Amaretto Paradise

drinks.instructions: Shake and serve.
drinks.name: '57 Chevy

drinks.comment: I work at a restuarant as a bartender and there is a waitress who is from Turkey. She can not speak English very well so she often orders drinks mispronouning them. One day she ordered a fat cat on the rocks meaning vodka on the rocks. So the manager and I decided to invent a drink called a Fat Cat.
drinks.name: Fat Cat

drinks.instructions: Pour the liquor first, then the OJ and then the lemon juice. Stir the drink a little bit and then drink.
drinks.name: Pimp & Hoe

drinks.instructions: Pour the OJ first, then mix in the Everclear and the Cointreau.
drinks.name: Orange Demon

drinks.instructions: Combine over Ice. Stir.
drinks.name: Mudslide #5

drinks.instructions: Mix in all ingredients in a shaker, strain into a cocktail glass, and garnish with pineapple wedge and cherry.
drinks.name: Frooty Biznitch

drinks.instructions: Layer ingredients in a tall shot glass: Grenadine, Chambord, Aftershock and Absolut Kurant. Drink should have varying layers of red.
drinks.name: Cooter Cork

drinks.instructions: Chill martini glass with ice and water. Fill cocktail shaker with ice, vodka, Cointreau, Grand Marnier, lime juice, and sour mix. Shake vigorously until shaker is frosty. Empty martini glass and rim with salt and sugar mix. Pour contents into glass and garnish with lime wedge. Serve.
drinks.name: Tini Rita

drinks.comment: Garnish is optional, required if serving to the public, but at home, I don't generally have flags in my fridge! This Cocktail is best when consumed on a cool summer eve while lying on your hammock! - Dedicated to my fabulous June '98 bartending class in Atlantic Beach, NC. Good luck to you all, and may you be blessed with lots of TIPS!!
drinks.name: Boardwalk Breeze

drinks.comment: A brand new bartenders first attempt at creating a drink. Looks good to me says her instructor!!! What do you think?
drinks.name: Belinda's Fuzzy Melon

drinks.instructions: Shake and Strain or Roll. No Garnish.
drinks.name: Elmo

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients into collins glass filled with ice. Add lime juice. Stir and drop lime slice into drink.
drinks.name: Peach Tequila

drinks.comment: If you mix this properly, you will hardly taste any alcohol.
drinks.name: Cowboy's Comet

drinks.comment: This makes 2 perfect drinks. Multiply recipe for larger groups. Believe me, everybody comes back for more!
drinks.name: Smoothe Operator

drinks.instructions: Layer in order shown, Midori, Bailey's, Jager.
drinks.name: Loch Ness Monster

drinks.instructions: Add ice, vodka, sour mix, cranberry and lime juice. Shake and serve with a garnish of lemon
drinks.name: Pink Lemonade #2

drinks.instructions: Stir all ingredients and serve over ice. Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry
drinks.name: Fruitloops

drinks.comment: This is a actually a combination of a Kamakazi and an Alabama Slammer. It also makes a good shooter.
drinks.name: Red Death

drinks.comment: You may can serve this drnk in a chilled cocktail glass without ice. The ice is nice in the summer, but it is not needed to make a good drink.
drinks.name: D.R.F.O.

drinks.instructions: Stir with cracked ice in a shaker and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a lemon zest over the drink and float the zest on top.
drinks.name: Emerald Martini

drinks.instructions: Stir with cracked ice in a shaker and pour into a chilled cocktail glass. Twist a lemon zest over the drink and float the zest on top.
drinks.name: Emerald Vodka Martini

drinks.instructions: Fill champagne flute one-third full with mango juice. Top with champagne. Stir gently and garnish with a slice of mango.
drinks.name: Mango Bellini

drinks.comment: This is an excellent tasting drink....it can be done with out the Grenadine, if you don't like the taste, but then it's just a "brain". Regardless, this is one of the better drinks around simply for taste....it'll get ya drunk, too, though! Get to it!!!!
drinks.name: Cerebral Hemorage

drinks.instructions: Mix all five together then chill.
drinks.name: Brown Eye Opener

drinks.comment: Discovered this while trying to come up with a punch for a staff party.
drinks.name: Split Beaver

drinks.comment: Be careful, this on will knock you on your ass. This will teach you a lesson. I had a hard-core drinker slam a few of these, he puked on my couch in his sleep!
drinks.name: Super Bloody Screwdriver

drinks.comment: Enjoy on a hot summer afternoon!!!
drinks.name: Splender Blenders

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice, strain, serve in cocktail glass
drinks.name: Stinger #2

drinks.instructions: Mix with whatever is available
drinks.name: Hairy Happy Trail

drinks.comment: Found on the Bailey's web page
drinks.name: Sexual Chocolate

drinks.instructions: Fill Collins glass one-half full of ice, add ingredients and stir. Garnish with a lime wedge, if desired.
drinks.name: Thanksgiving Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Pour all the contents into a shot glass at once.
drinks.name: Fire Ant Torture

drinks.comment: This drink was conceived at a party in Falmouth on Cape Cod during the summer of '97.
drinks.name: Screaming Multiple Orgasm On The Beach

drinks.comment: You can live off of these things, use discretion as to amount of rum. The listed ingredients are for Mount Gay but you may wish to increase tonic water level if cheaper or spiced rum is used.
drinks.name: Livingston

drinks.comment: A great tasting shot, that looks fancy, and does not require a chaser!
drinks.name: Black Death

drinks.comment: My brother, Todd, invented this drink. It serves the family name well.
drinks.name: McTavish

drinks.instructions: Mix over ice, shake and serve.
drinks.name: Scorpion's Tail

drinks.instructions: Add Jgermeister to a highball glass whith three ice cubes. Fill with tonic Water and garnish whith orange slice.

drinks.instructions: Garnish with a cherry on the rim of the glass.
drinks.name: Cherry Blossom

drinks.comment: This is a semi-sweet drink. Majority of women love this!

drinks.comment: The drink is supposed to have a light orangeish-pink color to it. When mixed properly, you will only be able to taste a smoothly sweet pineapple taste.

ingredients: 1 shot Cherry juice or 1 tblsp of Grenadine

drinks.instructions: Mix vodka and peppermint schnapps and add a dash of Tobasco.
drinks.name: Hot Shot #2

drinks.comment: Russian B-52 (i.e. the Soviet Backfire Bomber)
drinks.name: Backfire

drinks.comment: Makes a surprisingly smooth cocktail.
drinks.name: Special Tequini

drinks.instructions: Put ice in a glass, add the rest in order. Drink through a straw.
drinks.name: Wooholly Fuck

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice, add Capt. Morgan and malibu. Fill with the pineapple juice. Float 1/2 oz of grenadine and then add 1/2 oz of a dark rum (meyers) for color. Found this to a very popular drink at my bar.

drinks.comment: Delicious. Inspired by Steve Hogarth
drinks.name: Ice Cream Genius

drinks.instructions: Mix Jack Daniels, vodka, blue curacao and ice cubes in cocktail shaker. Shake and strain into glass and top up to desired level with 7-up.

drinks.instructions: Layer in a shot glass.

drinks.comment: Tastes a little like hot chocolate, but with a kick!

drinks.instructions: Add Bourbon, Vodka, then 7-Up in Wiskey Sour glass and stir.

drinks.comment: Delisous also with a oz of coke.
drinks.name: Tangazé

drinks.comment: The purpose on mixing the Blue Curacao with the Vodka is to enable the Blue to "float". Since it is a syrup in itself, if poured alone, the Blue Curacao would sink to the bottom, mix with the Grenadine and cause a hideous purple mess. When poured successfully, this drink makes an excellent conversation piece and can result in a rewarding night.
drinks.name: Inverted Traffic Light

drinks.comment: A great warmer-upper - Even on mild days! Warning: This is a very rich drink. Not for the weak of heart (nor ones with clogged arteries)!
drinks.name: Jen's Creamy Sighs

drinks.comment: For those who don't like salted glasses, substitute red party sugar, for a sweeter, prettier drink, excellent for the novice margarita drinker.
drinks.name: Ultimate Blue Frozen Margarita

drinks.instructions: Mix with a stirrer in a pitcher then pour over ice into glasses. A Thanksgiving tradition for the truly disfunctional family!
drinks.name: Turkey Trot

drinks.comment: Use sparingly
drinks.name: Rumple Shock

drinks.instructions: Combine all 4 ingredients into a shot glass and slam it.
drinks.name: Electric Storm

drinks.comment: This drink should be drank with caution, as too many (ie. more than one)could be hazardous to the participant's health. These drinks tend to sneak up on a person. Even one who has only had one.
drinks.name: Horny Bull #3

drinks.comment: This drink was huge at a bar in Peoria, IL called Gilligan's Tropical Hideaway. It was served in plastic fishbowls. We also poured Grenadine into plastic sharks and dumped them into the fishbowl. Looked just like a SHARK ATTACK! This drink is a guideline, we used blueberry Kool-aid but they don't make it anymore, so I substituted Schnapps. Mix to taste. Happy drinking.

drinks.instructions: mix the Vodka and the Parfait d'Amour in the glass and fill of with Bitter Lemon
drinks.name: Poison

drinks.comment: I invented this drink for people who don't care for the taste of wiskey. This is a very smooth drink. We serve this every year for our annual St. Patricks Day wild game feed!

drinks.comment: Light drink for those days you're sitting by the pool.
drinks.name: Scooley Slammer

drinks.instructions: Blend all ingredients and pour over ice.
drinks.name: Ultimate June Bug

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice in cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Chocolate Cow

drinks.instructions: Using a jigger glass (3oz shot glass) mix 1/3 of each part then top with club soda. Cover and shake lightly.

drinks.instructions: Pour the Fresca over the SoCo.
drinks.name: The Real June Bug

drinks.comment: This came from the Palladium night club AND Carlos n' Charlie's of Acapulco.

drinks.instructions: Chill the tequila and the Cointreau and serve in a shot glass straight up.

drinks.comment: A small varyiation from the norm, but definately worth the extra zip.

drinks.comment: To my knowledge, my brother Gary invented this drink.
drinks.name: Beam Scream

drinks.comment: This sounds like a lot of ingredients but it really does taste good!
drinks.name: Magnum

drinks.instructions: Place a coaster on top, pound on table twice, guzzle it!
drinks.name: Tequila Bom-Bom

drinks.comment: I do believe that this is my own creation. Try it, I think you will like it.

drinks.instructions: Mix in glass. Serve on the rocks (optional).

drinks.comment: Got this drink from my ex girlfriend, the only good thing she left me.
drinks.name: Purple Peril

drinks.instructions: Fill mixing glass with ice, add Malibu, amaretto, creme de cacao, and cream. Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
drinks.name: Almond Joy #2

drinks.comment: A Rusty Nail but with Irish Mist instead of Scotch. Does it have any other names?

drinks.comment: Great drink for after skiing or anything else. Famous traditional drink at the "Backhome Cafe" in Rutland, Vermont. The Backhome Cafe is also 20 minutes (on a bad day) from Killington, Vermont.

drinks.comment: An infamous drink by TP from Penn State!
drinks.name: Sonoma

drinks.instructions: Mix all three ingredients in a mixing glass, along with 1 cup crushed ice. Strain into margirita glass and serve immediately!
drinks.name: Neon-Geek

drinks.instructions: Pour each ingredient in shot glass floating each time. Make sure Galliano is on top.
drinks.name: K.G.B. #2

drinks.instructions: Layer, in order.
drinks.name: After Dark

drinks.comment: A special day in your second grade class. Your special day. The raspberry tootsie pops your mother gave you to share with the rest of the class. You're older now, and your tastes have changed, but there's nothing like a soothing drink to take you back to your 8th Birthday.
drinks.name: 8th Birthday

drinks.comment: This is a very smooth shot and it tastes a lot like a chocholate covered cherry, only better.
drinks.name: American Flag

drinks.comment: My contibution to all those who dislike "Sex on the beach", a very fresh and fruity drink!
drinks.name: Passion Beach

drinks.comment: Good to drink while eating Combos snacks.
drinks.name: Mafia's Kiss

drinks.instructions: Layer Jgermeister on top of the Goldschlager.
drinks.name: Oil Spill

drinks.comment: This stuff will power a small car !!!
drinks.name: Nitro

drinks.comment: This is a great change from the traditional Martini!
drinks.name: French Martini

drinks.comment: Drink this slowly, because it is high octane. Invented the recipe when I was bored relaxing to Jimmy Buffett. It tastes like pinapples and coconuts.
drinks.name: Cuban Crime of Passion (CCP)
ingredients: 1 part Light rum (Captain Morgan's or Bacardi)
1 part Coconut rum (Coco Ribe or Parrot Bay)

drinks.comment: This one tastes like the milk on the bottom of the bowl.
drinks.name: Fruit Loop #2

drinks.comment: The cranberry should fload above the alcohol and sour mix with the orange and pineapple bleeding through. This makes for an attractive drink. Actually looks great in a brandy snifter. (The ladies love it)

drinks.instructions: Simply mix all the ingredients together in a cocktail mixer full of ice cubes. Shake well, strain and serve. Enjoy.

drinks.instructions: Mix the 4 first ingredients with ice. Fill with lemonade. Garnish with carambole and strawberry on the edge of glass.

drinks.instructions: Pour in Vodka first, then mix in the rest. Count to three and drink!
drinks.name: Lime Lizard

drinks.comment: The great Dean Martin was responsible for the creation of this drink. He regularly visited the bar at Chasen's in Beverly Hills and told the bartender - Pepe Ruiz - that he was bored with the same old Martini's. Pepe than spent three weeks experimenting until he came up with this drink. Dean was reportedly floored by this drink and it soon became his favorite Martini. Frank Sinatra immortalized the drink in a 1962 recording entitled "Nothing But the Best (Is Good Enough for Me)". The lines "I like my martini, with burn on the glass" is a veiled tribute to the drink. Hollywood legend has it that Frank ordered 65 of the drinks in one night - for his guests.
drinks.name: Pepe's Flame of Love Martini

drinks.instructions: This is a "built" drink, meaning it gets made directly into the glass, no mixing glass or shaker is needed. Put the cubes in first, then the amaretto, then half fill with OJ and half fill with Cran. juice.
drinks.name: Sweaty Belly

drinks.comment: We were goofing off at a party one night and we started mixing different things and came up with this.. It pack quite a punch. Very smooth and tasty.
drinks.name: Butt Fucks

drinks.instructions: Layer Amaretto above Bailey's Irish Cream, then add various pinches of Cinnamon. Serve once cinnamon clumps begin to settle into the liquor.
drinks.name: Cookie Dough

drinks.comment: The Whitney was constructed by me for the purpose of helping a friend with his girl. She requested to get drunk quickly and so I went to work. A few moments later I dubbed my concoction The Whitney which is her name.
drinks.name: Whitney

drinks.comment: This cocktail won 1st. price in the 1994 Bartender Club of Iceland, cocktail drink competition.
drinks.name: Kermit

drinks.comment: The origal name comes from a childrens radioshow on swedish national radio called Mamma mu.
drinks.name: Mother Moo

drinks.instructions: In a Highball glass, add Midori, fill to 3/4 with sweet and sour, finish by filling to brim with Sprite. Stir.
drinks.name: Midori Sour #2

drinks.instructions: pour soouthern comfort and lime juice over ice, stir, enjoy
drinks.name: Maryville Sweet

drinks.comment: Women love these! Becareful to avoid making these when you are busy. If you make one you will almost certainly make ten.

drinks.comment: The sweet is the first thing you taste, the burning is on the way down and the eruption is how it looks before you down it.

drinks.comment: Treat it like a white russian, but add some rebel attitude!

drinks.comment: Be ready to smile. Tastes like Orange Julius, but with a twist of tomato, and some extra kick. My first party drink.

drinks.comment: Add OJ to taste. The drink can be very sweet if wanted. Peach schnaps, lemonade, and other juices are all optional.

drinks.name: Purple VW

drinks.comment: This drink may not sound all that great, but believe me it is a wonderful ride. It was created at the University of Dayton during a cast party after an original show called Rollercoaster. Enjoy the wild ride!

drinks.comment: It is important to use chilled Vodka and Tomato juice. You need to add the juice carefully by the wall of the glass - it will inject via the Vodka layer. This drink must be two coloured - red at the bottom and transparent at the top.-- Enjoy the Russian drinks!

drinks.name: The Jaw

drinks.instructions: Add all ingredients to shaker. Shake to chill. Strain out ice and pour into glass.

drinks.comment: Invented for Monyca at Ursinus College, PA.

drinks.comment: You can find this recipe in our menue : http://www.abseits.de/ld_alkfrei.htm
drinks.name: Banana Tropical

drinks.comment: This Green cow drink taste a lot better than the original. You may have to try it out some times before you get your own favorite taste, that is one of the great things about this recipe, you can make your own favorite taste. I have not met one person yet that doesn't like this drink. I have tried to use several other ingredients but this is (so far) the best. We have once tried with aquavit instead of vodka, that was the nearest we came to the taste we have today.

drinks.comment: I ordered this drink in a bar in the Village. The bartender asked me for a name, and my friend came up with the name Crooked Monkey.

drinks.instructions: Build in a collins glass over ice.

drinks.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine the vodka, sugar, and lemon juice. Shake well. Pour into a cocktail glass. Top with Champagne and garnish with an organce twist.
