drinks.instructions: First fill glass 4/5 of the way up with orange soda. Then add your grenadine. Finally add the whipped cream to the top.
drinks.name: Orange Flamingo

drinks.instructions: Mix in a tall glass and serve over ice.
drinks.name: The Naked Lady

drinks.comment: You may also put the pitcher in the freezer for a few hours and serve it "up" in a martini glass. Be careful, these have been known to be addictive.
drinks.name: The Irresistible Manhattan

drinks.comment: A very smooth tasting drink and a little on the sweet side. It is a nice change from Long Island Ice Teas! Go Lions!
drinks.name: P.S.U. Victory Dance

drinks.instructions: Pour Raspberry first, Butterscotch next and Irish cream last. Need not be layered but pour in order given. Top 'O the Mornin' to you!
drinks.name: Fuzzy Irishman

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice in a shaker and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Tequila Gimlet

drinks.instructions: Heat and stir until the honey is dissolved.
drinks.name: Franziska

drinks.comment: Drink was originally made to celebrate cinco de maya.
drinks.name: Cranberry Margarita

drinks.comment: Tastes great
drinks.name: Electric Banana

drinks.instructions: Combine ingredients with cracked ice in a cocktail shaker. Shake well, and pour into a chilled old-fashioned glass.
drinks.name: Slime

drinks.comment: Concocted in beautiful downtown San Ramon, CA. *T.G.I.F.*
drinks.name: The Swamp Water

drinks.comment: This is the best watermelon recipe I found after about 9 years of bartending. Try it you will like it the best.
drinks.name: Watermelon Shot

drinks.instructions: Pour both ingredients into a cocktail or rocks glass and stir.
drinks.name: Frenchie

drinks.instructions: Shake  strain into glass or blend.
drinks.name: Mexican Rose

drinks.instructions: Pour the gin, cognac and chocolate liqueur over the ice cubes. Fill with heavy cream. Stir gently.
drinks.name: Belgian Brownie

drinks.instructions: Mix in shot glass
drinks.name: Mint Chocolate

drinks.instructions: Pour Grand Marnier into a Champagne Flute. Fill almost to the top with Champagne and top off with fresh Orange Juice.
drinks.name: Grand Mimosa

drinks.comment: This shot also adapts into one hell of a cocktail. The "'57 Chevy" is currently going fast on Austin's 6th Street.
drinks.name: '57 Chevy #2

drinks.instructions: Add Amaretto first and then layer Butterscotch schnapps on top, don't mix. Add whipped cream if desired.
drinks.name: Butterball

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice, add gin and vodka. Almost fill with pineapple juice, then add SoCo and melon liqueur. The drink can also be made frozen by adding 1 1/2 scoops of ice and blending.
drinks.name: Tropical Lust

drinks.instructions: Pour a double shot glass half full of vodka. Pour the peach schnapps into the next quarter. Pour the triple sec in the reamaining quarter. Stir and shoot.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Screw Shot

drinks.comment: Strong enough for a man, but made for a southerner
drinks.name: Southern Salutation

drinks.comment: Drink these until they taste good, then you'll know your lit.
drinks.name: Frisky

drinks.instructions: shake well, pour into shot glass.
drinks.name: Fig

drinks.instructions: Cut a hole in the top of the watermelon and pour all of the vodka in the watermelon. Put the watermelon (hole upwards) in the fridge for one day before eating.
drinks.name: Drunk Watermelon

drinks.comment: Perfect end to a romantic dinner or for sipping on the beach.
drinks.name: Venus on the Rocks

drinks.comment: This is the creation of the really nice owner of Nina's Restaurant in Ibiza, Spain. Thanks, Nina!!!
drinks.name: Nina's Special

drinks.comment: Drinking to many of these will eventually lead to someone becoming a widow
drinks.name: Widow Maker

drinks.instructions: In a cocktail shaker add ingredients and fill with ice. Shake with gusto for half a minute, and pour/strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon peel, or lime peel if you use fresh lime juice.
drinks.name: Celebration

drinks.instructions: Put vodka in first. then add the Baley's and cream. lightly stir and serve.
drinks.name: Irish Dawg

drinks.comment: Named after a friend of mine, Karen Bregitzer, who helped create the drink.
drinks.name: Special K

drinks.comment: Shouldn't take more than 8 seconds between first to last shot. Shake neighbors head. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Banderas

drinks.instructions: Add into glass over ice and mix well. Garnish with slice of lemon.
drinks.name: Orange Mule

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients into shaker filled with ice, shake, strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: China White

drinks.comment: Not too sweet...not too dry...just Perfect!
drinks.name: Perfect Manhattan

drinks.comment: Surprisingly good taste that will bring back folks for more. A friend and I made this for a convention. If guests ask what it is you are supposed to recite the ingredients at the top of your lungs and finish with, "And what does it taste like?? It tastes like piss!!"
drinks.name: Moose Piss

drinks.instructions: Equal parts Jim Beam and Amaretto over rocks. Stir.
drinks.name: Jim's Nuts

drinks.comment: Dark, rich, and smooth. My personal favorite. I made this myself
drinks.name: Stevie Wonder

drinks.comment: If poured properly, the grenadine will create a red to orange effect from the bottom of the glass to the top
drinks.name: Voodoo Sunrise

drinks.comment: The Hairy Armpit can be surprisingly tasty, but it depends on fresh ingredients. One made with pasteurized grapefruit juice and old, partially-evaporated ouzo has proven to be an unpleasent experience. Sambuca can be used instead of ouzo, especially if the grapefruit juice used is particularly sour. As far as I know, this drink was invented by James Clippinger and named by Matt Calef. If someone has an earlier reference to either the name or receipe, please let me know.
drinks.name: Hairy Armpit

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients into a mixing glass nearly filled with ice. Stir. Strain into an old fassion glass over ice. Garnish with fruit.
drinks.name: Apple Blossom

drinks.instructions: In a tall glass, on the rocks, add Southern Comfort and Amaretto. Fill glass with Pineapple juice. Stir.
drinks.name: Pine Cone

drinks.comment: Another way to drink Galliano! Very easy to make and it tastes great.
drinks.name: Adam's Apple

drinks.comment: Its a great drink to give to a twenty-first birthday girl .
drinks.name: Kiss From Rudy

drinks.instructions: First add ice, then mix in the alcohols, then the juice and grenadine. Shake when all ingredients are mixed. Serve in a 10-12 oz. glass.
drinks.name: Red Devil

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients into a pint glass half-filled with ice cubes. Alternately pour to another glass 3 or 4 times until chilled.
drinks.name: Mutual Orgasm

drinks.comment: Invented by Lanette Dunkeson in Cabo San Lucas. Served at all NHRA drag races in the Phoenix area (DiCarlo Racing Team).
drinks.name: Lanette

drinks.comment: Tastes like a Long Island Ice Tea, but with a Caribbean Sea appearance. Use Malibu Rum and you will think you in the islands. Hey Mon and Wo-Mon, enjoy !!!
drinks.name: Caribbean Ice Tea

drinks.comment: I came up with this drink while bartending in college. It became a favorite of the local crowd and was often also served as a jigger of shots.
drinks.name: Burnso Tropical

drinks.comment: It's Damn Good!!! It's nammed after a Beck song, so it's got to be good!
drinks.name: Thunder Peel

drinks.comment: A beautiful sight that has quite a bite
drinks.name: The Captains Silver Sunrise

drinks.comment: Serves 3-4 (not 1! ...you have been warned). This stuff is fairly volitile so be prepared for the consequences.
drinks.name: Grog #2

drinks.comment: Like the David Bowie alter-ego for whom the drink is named, the Alladin Sane is a superior variation on a timeless classic -- the Cosmopolitan.
drinks.name: Aladdin Sane

drinks.comment: This is generally a dessert drink. I hope you enjoy!
drinks.name: Spanish Coffee #2

drinks.instructions: Shake vigourously with plenty of ice
drinks.name: White Lady 1910

drinks.comment: A very sophisticated, but potent cocktail. Perfect to start off a classy evening on the town.
drinks.name: Seelbach Cocktail

drinks.comment: Invented by the best bartender at "Friends", me! This is the product of a really slow night and I was bored.
drinks.name: Crystal Cranberry

drinks.comment: If don't have a Mariachi Soul, After 3 of These, you'll be singin' "El son de la negra" or "Cielito Lindo"
drinks.name: Charro Negro

drinks.instructions: Mix with ice. Strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Lui Lui

drinks.comment: A perfect after dinner drink.
drinks.name: Espresso Martini

drinks.comment: Should taste like hi-c ecto cooler. Also works great as a shot.
drinks.name: Anton's Ecto Cooler

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients over ice and shake vigorously.
drinks.name: Purple People Eater

drinks.comment: Drank on the first floor of Perry King Guest House on the Campus of Mount Union College. First Floor Guys- Rich, Dan, Dave, Jess, and Jim
drinks.name: Ruby Slipper

drinks.comment: Cannot substitute Chambord for anything. A phrase some of my fellow bartenders say "You can pour Chambord over a terd and it would taste good".
drinks.name: Surfer On Acid #2

drinks.comment: Can also be made into a blended drink by adding all ingredients into a blender and served in a margarita glass. Garnish with only a orange wedge.
drinks.name: Sex on the Brain

drinks.instructions: Combine ingredients in a mixing glass nearly filled with ice. Stir, and strain into a shot glass
drinks.name: Pine-Sol Shooter

drinks.instructions: First put Tequila in shot glass, then add Firewater
drinks.name: Jose Flame-O

drinks.instructions: First put in ButterScotch, then Firewater, and float the Irish Cream
drinks.name: Nipple on Fire

drinks.instructions: Combine alcohol in a rocks glass over ice. Fill with tonic water, then add only a dash of Grenadine. Be sure the drink is served with the tonic still bubbling.
drinks.name: Holy Water

drinks.comment: Artie Jones Theo's Bar  Grill, Camp Hill, PA
drinks.name: Catfish

drinks.comment: The drink ends up layered if you leave it for a minute or so. The Goldschlager will be on top, the milk and Bailey's stay mixed, and there's a sort of Kahlua sludge at the bottom. This is how I prefer to drink it. My roommate, however, likes to continually stir his as he's drinking it. I don't normally measure out the ingredients when I start playing alchemist. I just pour until it looks right. To that end, the measurements here are estimations. You can vary the ingredients to suit your taste. Modifications I've tried include sprinkling cinnamon on the top and adding chocolate syrup. Cheers.
drinks.name: The Gold, The Bad, and The Ugly

drinks.instructions: Just pour it all in a glass. Stir it if you really feel the need to. I usually just pour in the alcohol and let the fruit juice do the mixing for me. For the best results, try and use that Minute Maid Fruit Punch. That stuff works very well. I advise against using any sort of "all-citrus" fruit juice, even OJ.
drinks.name: Southern Blast

drinks.instructions: Fill glass 2/3 with ice, add Sambuca and fill with soda.
drinks.name: Black Hole

drinks.comment: After stirring ingredients,Drink should look just like a rootbeer float and taste even better. Discovered by a bar owners daughter and another bartender.
drinks.name: R-Float

drinks.comment: Perfect for a summer day- or night Or in winter when whishing it was summer!
drinks.name: Summer Dreams
ingredients: 45 ml Lemon juice or lemon sqaush

drinks.comment: Wery coling summerdrink
drinks.name: Norling Special

drinks.comment: This drink is intended as a sipping drink. i.e. mixing with a group of people and casually consuming your drink as the evening goes on. Not intended to be guzzled one after another like you would a beer.
drinks.name: Class Act

drinks.comment: This is really good, it tastes like a little bit of peach and orange.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Faser

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Add rum, triple sec, and sour mix. Fill remainder of glass with grapefruit juice. Stir and garnish with orange and lemon wedges.
drinks.name: Citrus Smack

drinks.comment: Very popular drink in Chico in the 80's
drinks.name: Steamboat

drinks.comment: I'm used to drink it at some golf club, and "Novebuche" (nineholes) was its name.
drinks.name: Novebuche
ingredients: 5 parts Grapefruit juice or orange juice

drinks.instructions: Disolve kool-Aid in rum. Add Mountain Dew.
drinks.name: Angry Chameleon

drinks.instructions: Pour the 3 first ingredients into a shaker with ice, shake, strain into a brandy snifter and add the 2 little dashes of Kahlua.
drinks.name: Misty Loch

drinks.comment: This drink is a favorite of The Royal Chessmen's and most of the performers we know from the renaissance faires.
drinks.name: Mage's Fire

drinks.comment: This drink is best served with a spoon and a straw. An oreo cookie can be added for flavor and appearance. My dad used to make me these when I was a kid, he taught me how to make them, hiccup.
drinks.name: Frozen Grasshopper

drinks.instructions: Fill a highball glass with ice Add rum and dry vermouth Fill with pineapple juice and serve
drinks.name: San Juan Cooler

drinks.comment: Just think of a chocolate milk shake when you try this.
drinks.name: The Texas Mudslide

drinks.comment: The ice is just to get it cold and the shaking is to make it froth. Don't worry if it doesn't stay frothy.
drinks.name: Arkansas Razorback

drinks.comment: Jam will never be the same again
drinks.name: Gooseberry Jam

drinks.instructions: Mix together first three ingredients and then slice fresh limes and place in drink, then allow to sit for at least one hour. This drink is to be made in a large quantity, so the limes may "take effect."
drinks.name: Green Tree Frog

drinks.comment: Feel the delicious flavor and see the beautiful color spectrum from red to blue.
drinks.name: Cristianne

drinks.comment: Acknowledgments to Mr. D. Galipos for the idea
drinks.name: Sunny Mexico

drinks.instructions: Blend, add ice and strain into glass.
drinks.name: Viagra Shot

drinks.comment: Nice pale pink color. A "summertime" drink
drinks.name: Pink Passion

drinks.instructions: Fill half of the glass with ice and stir.
drinks.name: Sweet Passoa

drinks.instructions: pour each of the three ingredients into a shot glass. Stir.
drinks.name: Banshee Berry

drinks.comment: Tastes like a raspberry tootsie pop with a little kick.
drinks.name: Razzleberry

drinks.comment: When straining, fill halfway and begin to strain up and down to provide ample amounts of foam
drinks.name: Southern Comfort Sour

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain the drink into a well chilled margarita glass. Garnish with a red cherry.
drinks.name: Santorini Sundown

drinks.comment: Made at Joni's East, San Diego
drinks.name: Firecracker

drinks.comment: Made in the Daily Planet, San Diego.
drinks.name: San Diego Silver Bullet

drinks.comment: If a big bloke asks you for one, don't shout it out all over the bar like I did in the Blarney Stone Too in San Diego.
drinks.name: Wu Wu

drinks.instructions: Add sugar, vodka, and sour mix over ice and shake. Then fill with sprite/7up. Top with grenadne or cherry juice. Garnish with cherry and lemon wedge.
drinks.name: Jersey Shore Cherry Lemonade
ingredients: Top with Grenadine or cherry juice

drinks.comment: Otherwise called a black and blue screw. It should look a nice sewage green, hence the 'nasty' part. Drink, drink another, drink another and streak your neighbors like I did.
drinks.name: Nasty Pablo

drinks.comment: Good for those cold nights in the Rockies!
drinks.name: Colorado Cider

drinks.comment: A warming drink on cold winter nights.
drinks.name: Blue Blazer #2

drinks.comment: Do not confuse with Gloom Chaser
drinks.name: Gloom Raiser

drinks.instructions: Mix Chartreuse and Sour Mix on top of ice in Collins glass. Fill with coca-cola and, if you like, garnish with lemon or lime slice.
drinks.name: Green Tea

drinks.instructions: In glass filled with ice, mix Chartreuse and Tonic water. Garnish with lime slice.
drinks.name: Chartreuse and Tonic

drinks.comment: This is a popular drink in Taiwan and Southeast Asia. This easy to make drink helps cools and refreshes lost summer appetite. The amount of ingredients can be changed accordingly to taste.
drinks.name: Papaya Milk Splash

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a glass.
drinks.name: Long Slow Comfortable Screw Against the Wall

drinks.instructions: Mix Kahlua and lemon juice, add sugar and enjoy.
drinks.name: Kahlua Sour

drinks.comment: Invented for my girlfriend who dislikes most alcohol and beer but enjoys sweet drinks such as amaretto. She loved it!!
drinks.name: The Kristy

drinks.comment: Second version of drink, modified for "around the world" shot party at university of Kansas.
drinks.name: The Kristy #2

drinks.comment: This drink is meant to sipped and savored.
drinks.name: Full Moon

drinks.comment: The color of 'Drunk on Christmas' makes the title. The drink itself is sweet, light, and powerful! A great holiday whiskey drink for those who can get plowed without embarassing themselves.
drinks.name: Drunk on Christmas

drinks.comment: Refreshing and deliciosa! For people who might not like sweet and sour mix but like tequila.
drinks.name: Piña Rita

drinks.comment: Named after the Anime character Sailor Venus.
drinks.name: Sailor Venus

drinks.comment: Named after the Anime character Sailor Moon.
drinks.name: Sailor Moon

drinks.comment: Named after the Anime character Sailor Mercury.
drinks.name: Sailor Mercury

drinks.instructions: Blend all ingredients except soda and orange slice in a blender until smooth. Pour into a chilled glass and garnish with a slice of orange.
drinks.name: Ramos Fizz #1

drinks.comment: Can also be made using a blender with about 1/4 goblet of fine ice. Then add soda and stir.
drinks.name: Ramos Fizz

drinks.instructions: Put all together in blender, and blend until smooth.
drinks.name: Fruit A la la

drinks.comment: Best to make in a pitcher, and I'm not talking about Kerry Woods! Use large amounts, as this drink is sure to be a hit!
drinks.name: Moose Fart

drinks.comment: For a "Crunchy Nooky", add chocotale chip cookie crumbs (finely chopped) and chill over night in a sealed mason jar.
drinks.name: Milky Nooky

drinks.instructions: Fill rocks glass with ice, add Amaretto and Baileys and serve with a stirrer.
drinks.name: Homecoming

drinks.comment: This drink was invented by two good friends: One a Greek and the other a Swede trading shots at a the Bali Hai in Potsdam, NY.
drinks.name: Greasy Swede

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain in a cooled cocktail glass. Decorate with a maraschino cherry on a stick.
drinks.name: The Classic

drinks.instructions: Pour 1 oz. of Peach Schnapps in the shot glass first. Then pour 1 oz. of Absolut Vodka on top. Last pour Amaretto on top of Vodka until the Vodka changes in to a light brown.
drinks.name: Zool

drinks.comment: This is called a Delta Sunset at Bubba Gump's
drinks.name: Delta Sunset

drinks.comment: Great conversational cocktail! As disgusting as it looks, it tastes pretty good. Regular Curacao or Triple Sec can be used in place of Blue Curacao, but you'll lose the colorful effect.
drinks.name: Swamp Water #2

drinks.comment: Great with Spiced Rum. Great as a NAB drink. Great served over crushed Ice. Great as a Frozen Drink. The drink for every member at the party, including the kids.
drinks.name: Oklahoma Tropical Twister

drinks.instructions: Fill the glass with crushed ice. Fill half the glass with Kahlua. Add a dash of Creme de Noyaux. Top with Cream.
drinks.name: Kahlua Kiss

drinks.comment: This drink comes from The Netherlands and has a surprisingly taste.
drinks.name: White Splash

drinks.instructions: Shake well till it is a cream color and is frothing.
drinks.name: Green Thing

drinks.instructions: pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Chill and strain into glass. Serve immediately.
drinks.name: The Green Wave

drinks.instructions: Shake first 4 ingredients over ice and strain in sugar rimed champagne flute. Fill with champagne.
drinks.name: Liberty Blue Champagne

drinks.instructions: Shake Gin and Pernod with cracked ice. Strain into a red wine glass packed with shaved ice.
drinks.name: London Fog

drinks.instructions: Layer each ingredients onto one another
drinks.name: Quick Fox

drinks.comment: Made as a companion shooter to the Cowboy Cocksucker.
drinks.name: Rugmuncher

drinks.comment: A smooth and buttery cocktail with just enough scotch to bite back.
drinks.name: The Velvet Kilt

drinks.instructions: Chill cocktail glass. Mix Vodka, Godiva, and Vanilla Schnapps. Stir, do not shake. Place single cherry with stem in chilled cocktail glass. Strain over cherry.
drinks.name: Chocalate Covered Martini

drinks.instructions: Pour Rum, Strega, and Grand Marnier into collins glass. Add Pineapple and Sweet and Sour until full. Garnish with a Lemon Cherry Flag.
drinks.name: Quantum Theory

drinks.comment: The Mystery Date comes from a party the first weekend of August 1998 - looking for a slightly sweeter alternative to the martini (and a change of pace from the manhattans served that night) I created this to rave reviews. I feel that it combines the essence of a classic cocktail with some of the sweeter variations of today, providing a refreshing drink for some of the more delicate imbibers at a gathering.
drinks.name: Mystery Date

drinks.instructions: Pour together in shot glass and serve. Very easy to do.
drinks.name: Lewinsky

drinks.instructions: Add vodka, lemon juice, ice, and sugar in a mixing glass and shake. Pour into a cup and add orange soda. Stir.
drinks.name: Tiger Paw

drinks.comment: This is what happens when you have a bunch of whacky ingredients sitting around. Amazingly, it tastes fairly good.
drinks.name: Hawaii Five-O

drinks.comment: Tonic and sugar can be replaced with Sprite.
drinks.name: Blue in the Face

drinks.comment: The drink taste like Pistace-ice. Espacilly women love this drink.
drinks.name: Pisang Pistace

drinks.comment: Great alternative to a Martini
drinks.name: Desiree

drinks.instructions: Shake with 4 oz. 7-Up and a splash of pineapple juice. Pour into tall glass over crushed ice. Color top with a splash of cherry syrup, add cherry for garnish.
drinks.name: Lady L

drinks.instructions: Add all ingredients to glass with ice and stir.
drinks.name: Black Fruit Tree

drinks.comment: Originally invented in a disco called Van Gogh in lstykke in Denmark.
drinks.name: Braindead

drinks.instructions: Pour southern comfort, triple sec, and then cherry brandy
drinks.name: Warm and Fuzzy

drinks.comment: The drink of choice by the New Zealand firefighters when off duty. 1 drink = wow. 2 drinks = jesus christ!! 3 drinks = I'll fight any one. 4 drinks = someone call the paramedics.
drinks.name: Bag of Filth

drinks.comment: Tastes great and is good for large party's.
drinks.name: Bob's Special Punch

drinks.comment: Add a cherry on top for added color. A favorite of hockey fans!
drinks.name: Slapshot

drinks.instructions: Please add in order from light to heavy finishing with coffee. No mixing required.
drinks.name: Flori's Hot Tub Heaven

drinks.instructions: Pour amaretto, irish cream, and Kahlua over ice cubes. Add half-and-half, and stir well.
drinks.name: Buttered Toffee

drinks.comment: When you're done, try some of the syrup at the bottom for a strong surprise.
drinks.name: Porky Bone

drinks.instructions: Layer the Rumple Minze on top of the Firewater (as best as possible)
drinks.name: Fire And Ice

drinks.comment: Drink should taste similar to that of a Capriana and Mojito if made in the proper way.
drinks.name: D-Roy

drinks.comment: This is a very tasty drink formulated by a WVU student who was a little lit and had a few too many ingredients laying on his desk. A favorite of all of the First North boys.
drinks.name: Super Allez

drinks.comment: Especially appropriate for Columbus day celebrations.
drinks.name: Santa Maria

drinks.instructions: This drink is ideally made in a 16 ounce glass, but can also be made in a Collins glass. The drink is served on the rocks. Add the Midori, Malibo, and Schnaps. Add juices. Shake in a tin. Garnish with either two cherries or with a kiwi wheel.
drinks.name: Alien Urine

drinks.instructions: Mix drink with crushed ice or blend with 2 1/2 scoops of ice. For added enjoyment stick a straw in the middle and drink for a slushy rush.
drinks.name: Slushy

drinks.instructions: Shake all ingredients but the soda with ice. Strain into highball glass. Fill the glass to the top with the orange soda.
drinks.name: Log Cabin

drinks.instructions: Mix in order listed. Do not stir. Serve in Brandy Snifter.
drinks.name: Dirty Monkey

drinks.comment: A girlie shot for the ladies, and pink makes it perfect.
drinks.name: Barbie Shot

drinks.instructions: Shake well and use it as a shot
drinks.name: Applecake

drinks.instructions: Fill a tall glass with crushed ice. Pour the Amaretto over the ice then slowly add the orange juice and top with club soda to form layers. Add a dash of grenadine and garnish with a cherry and orange slice.
drinks.name: Italian Sunset

drinks.comment: If done correctly, produces a fruity flavor that's guaranteed to get you where you want to be!
drinks.name: Cherry Spitfire

drinks.comment: This drink is suprisingly smooth tasting. The sweet Midori taste balances out the slight harshness of the Jack Daniels and Jgermeister. Very good and easy to drink.
drinks.name: Curtain Call

drinks.instructions: Put a few ice cubes in a highball glass. Add the Jgermeister and Windsor, stir, then fill the glass with the 7-Up and give it a small stir.
drinks.name: Deerslayer

drinks.instructions: Shake or mix all ingredients, and pour over ice cubes into a collins glass, (or any glass large enough,) Garnish with an orange slice, a lemon slice, and a cherry if so desired.
drinks.name: Mundo Fine

drinks.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a glass and mix well
drinks.name: Black River Boogie

drinks.comment: Add the vodka if you wish to make the drink a little stronger, but you'll never taste the difference either way. Without the vodka, you have a light, refreshing drink with just a slight alcoholic kick. With the vodka, you have just a little more of a kick.
drinks.name: Shattered Dreams

drinks.comment: Very popular drink for the beach in the Puerto Vallarta area. Is refreshing and delicious. An alternative ingredient is called "sal de gusano" (worm salt), made in Oaxaca, Mexico, and is made from toasted agave worms, chili and salt, using it istead of regular salt. Be careful, though, to use only 1/4 of a teaspoon on this one, because it is VERY strong (but tastes really great).
drinks.name: Michelada Regular

drinks.comment: A very popular drink in Gudalajara, Mexico, right in the center of the only region in the world where tequila is produced. Makes a great appetizer and is an all-time favorite.
drinks.name: Tequila Colagallo

drinks.comment: Invented by Sct. Omega Broderhood.
drinks.name: Double Omega

drinks.comment: From Maple Lake, MN - "Home of the Irish".
drinks.name: Maple Lake Irish Shock

drinks.comment: It takes a lot of Black Sambuca to taste real strong. So, the more you add the more punch it packs!!!
drinks.name: Black Christmas

drinks.comment: If you want to make it look really nice, you can garnish it with a thin slice of green apple. Enjoy!!!
drinks.name: Apple Martini

drinks.comment: A nice drink, really. A drink for grampa while he sits on the porch on a midsummer evening, listening to zydeco.
drinks.name: Cajun Comforter

drinks.comment: This is really meant to be a slow-sipping drink.
drinks.name: Hoo Doo

drinks.comment: Oh yes. The best among the never-ending "Rocky Mountain" series.
drinks.name: Rocky Mountain Bumpsucker

drinks.comment: What a slick looking drink! Popular amoung teens trying to look sophisticated. Cheers.
drinks.name: Scarlett Martini

drinks.comment: It's worth the effort. It's rumored Mark Twain enjoyed this special treat, albeit with bourbon rather than vodka. Kids like it too. Note: this is not to be performed during any season other than summer. Cheers.
drinks.name: Summer Sucker

drinks.instructions: Mix vodka, gin, rum, triple sec, pineapple juice and grenadine together in a highball glass over ice. Top it with a splash of Sprite. Garnish with a strawberry and an orange slice.
drinks.name: 77 Sunset Strip

drinks.comment: Best when ice cold.
drinks.name: Godiva Polar Bear

drinks.comment: Great if you like lemons. Name comes from the drink's similarity to yellow snow. Dont eat it, drink it. Cheers.
drinks.name: Snowshot

drinks.instructions: The easy way to make this drink is to add all listed ingredients with ice into shaker and strain into glass. However, the really slick way is much more impressive: Add cranberry juice, lime juice, tripple sec and only one ounce vodka into shaker with ice. Strain into glass. Then, mix 1 once orange juice with one ounce vodka in a seperate glass. Fill a turkey baister with the vodka/OJ mix, and slowly inject it into the cranberry glass on the bottom. This produces a sort of reverse-layering effect, and also ensures both cranberry and OJ will have the same amount of vodka.
drinks.name: Bot

drinks.comment: Very nice, very classy. You probably wouldn't want to use a whiskey other than Gentleman Jack. Cheers.
drinks.name: Bittersweet Jack

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients in a mixing glass with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.
drinks.name: International Jack

drinks.comment: Slow sippin. Very nice. Cheers.
drinks.name: Southern Sparkler

drinks.comment: The grenadine syrup is what gives this drink a unique taste. Cheers.
drinks.name: Southern Suicide

drinks.instructions: Combine in a shot glass, vodka first.
drinks.name: Bad Habit

drinks.comment: Usually drinks with this many ingredients taste like shit, but these go surprisingly well with each other. Also been called, at least at one bar, as "The Unholy Seven." Cheers.
drinks.name: Lucky Seven

drinks.instructions: Pour whiskey and cinnamon schnapps into shot glass. Add dash of tobasco.
drinks.name: Sweaty Irish Whiskey

drinks.comment: Tasty. Another variation is using about three ounces Amaretto rather than 1/2 in an old fashioned glass on the rocks, which is nice if you like almonds. cheers.
drinks.name: Almond Delight

drinks.instructions: Mix over ice and shake. Strain into an old fashioned glass on the rocks.
drinks.name: Bairn

drinks.comment: A drink that's both smooth and flaming, a rare combination. Cheers.
drinks.name: Harbor Lights

drinks.comment: Recipe calls for Lemonade Mix, but I find plain lemonade works just fine. Cheers.
drinks.name: Goldschlager Lemondrop

drinks.comment: A four ounce shot. Look out. I've seen Peach Schnapps substituted by peach juice. cheers.
drinks.name: Mad Hatter

drinks.instructions: Build over ice in a rocks glass. Granish with a cherry.
drinks.name: The Jersey Cherry

drinks.instructions: Stir with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime twist.
drinks.name: Pegu

drinks.instructions: Stir with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
drinks.name: Jasmine

drinks.instructions: Just pour, stir, and enjoy.
drinks.name: Black Orgasm

drinks.comment: This is a good summer drink that was mixed at the Sigma Tau Gamma Fraternity at Michigan Technological University in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan.
drinks.name: SigTau Scorpion

drinks.comment: It tastes like a cherry coke with a kick. It should warm you straight down the middle. If not, drink another. The best we can figure this drink came from a tavern in Carlinville, Illinois called the "Lost Dutchman." (A civilized tavern)
drinks.name: Red Royal Shot

drinks.comment: I was being not very nice and trying to make a shot that would make a friend of mine sick. She drank the shot and said that it was good she then decided that she would get to name and it was dubbed the "Blue Caboose".
drinks.name: Blue Caboose

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with tonic, pour Fernet over spoon at the and add a straw.
drinks.name: Bavorak

drinks.instructions: In a blender mix the Chocolate Milk, Ice, and Maple Syrup for about 5 seconds. Then add the Chocolate liquior and Kahlua and blend for another 2 seconds. Pour and top with whipped cream.
drinks.name: The Fat Albert

drinks.comment: Tastes like Strawberry Cream Coffee.
drinks.name: Strawgasm

drinks.instructions: in a shaker half filled with ice, add first 5 ingredients. shake well. strain into hurricane glass filled with ice. lace with grenadine.
drinks.name: Toocan Sam

drinks.comment: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest during afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was the winner.
drinks.name: Patriotic Blow

drinks.comment: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest in its afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was voted #2.
drinks.name: Stained Blue Dress

drinks.comment: The Professional Bartenders School in Chicago (529 S. Wabash) held a Monica Lewinsky drink contest in its afternoon and evening classes with instructor Kim G. This was #3.
drinks.name: Lewd Lewinsky

drinks.instructions: Pour first 4 ingredients over ice, slowly add grenadine as you stir.
drinks.name: Harvest Moon

drinks.instructions: Mix in cocktail shaker with ice cubes to chill. Strain into glass, adorn with cherries.
drinks.name: Purple Yummy

drinks.instructions: Pour each ingredient into the snifter and serve.
drinks.name: Beautiful

drinks.instructions: Layer creme de cacao on bottom, followed by the Irish Cream. Lastly, sprinkle cinnamon over top.
drinks.name: China White #2

drinks.comment: This is a must at all parties.
drinks.name: Frizzy Punch

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice, strain over ice in a medium sized hurricaneglass.
drinks.name: Soylent Green

drinks.comment: Simple and great in the Blazing summer sun.
drinks.name: Absolut Lemonade

drinks.instructions: Build.
drinks.name: Bloody Passion

drinks.comment: This shot came from Matt Marder and Jon Fugitt. One night we were drinking we decided to make a new shot and there it was. The smoothest shot in the south, Southern Fruity Passion.
drinks.name: Southern Fruity Passion

drinks.comment: This is a lady's drink and my salute to the Indian summer in Toronto
drinks.name: Canada Dream

drinks.comment: This will taste like a shot of scope, but the effects of one drink will make you wish it was just scope. For added effect, make all liquids 1.5oz. This drink was given to me by some Texas Tech frat guys who were working as bartenders at an Outback Steakhouse.
drinks.name: Russian Iceberg

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled shot glass.
drinks.name: Washington Apple

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice. Grenadine first, then Absolute Citron, fill to top with Apple Juice.
drinks.name: Lava Lamp

drinks.instructions: Shake vigorously over ice, pour into cocktail glass and garnish with either lemon or orange peel.
drinks.name: Celebration #2

drinks.comment: This drink was concocted in an American University dorm room. Drink with caution, and always drink responsibly.
drinks.name: The Double Team

drinks.comment: Cheaper way to make a kamikaze.
drinks.name: Generic Kamikaze

drinks.comment: A friend of mine who used to be a bartender introduced me to this drink. It's actually his creation, so many thanks to Clint Galliano!
drinks.name: Three Day Weekend

drinks.comment: If you like red cream soda, you'll love this drink. But warning to the lightweights - you can't taste much alcohol, and they are really sweet. This drink originates from a really bored bartender in Kentucky (who goes by the name of "Eisentrout", pronounced "Eyes n' Trout").
drinks.name: Red Eisentrout

drinks.instructions: Add the vodka, 151, and Midori forming a nice green shooter. Then tilt in some grenadine to give it some red flare at the bottom -- burn it down!
drinks.name: Thumb Press

drinks.comment: I created this drink out of boredom so have fun with it. As the punch bowl gets lower add more vodka!
drinks.name: After Party

drinks.comment: Another Variation of the Woo Woo. We started drinking these at Muddys Too in Watervliet, NY. Our favorite bartender, Margie, got us going. They definitly make you wanna go WooWoo, after you've had a few. :)
drinks.name: Woo Woo #2

drinks.comment: From the Moana Sands Hotel in Waikiki.
drinks.name: Moana Sands

drinks.comment: Also excellent on the rocks in a highball glass.
drinks.name: Electric Margarita

drinks.comment: This can also be made as a cocktail. A very smooth, fruit-punch tasting drink. Be careful, though...these don't hit until about fifteen minutes later!
drinks.name: Royal Flush #2

drinks.comment: Called a Donna Reed for two reasons: (1) it's pink (2) it was originally created in a 1950's-vintage blender. Fairly mild taste, not much alcohol.
drinks.name: Donna Reed

drinks.comment: Great drink for parties. Good drink to make new friends. Drink it just like if it was a tequila shot!
drinks.name: Pamoyo

drinks.comment: This is a VERY sweet drink. I created it one time when my liquor cabinet was rather bare and wanted to try something new. It sounds wierd, but is very good if you like sweet things.
drinks.name: Monk on Coke

drinks.comment: Blue and gold are the colors of the Houston Astros uniforms. This drink was invented during the '98 play-off fiasco vs. the Padres.
drinks.name: Big Unit

drinks.comment: It tastes like milkshake.
drinks.name: Pinglan

drinks.comment: This drink was started and made popular by the legendary, immortal Tupac (2Pac) Shakur. Rest in peace....
drinks.name: Thug Passion #2

drinks.comment: I received this recipe from a bartender friend of mine in Uvalde, TX. Take warning, this drink is potent and you should have at least three people present. Two to drink and one to drive!
drinks.name: Texas Tea

drinks.comment: Absolutely amazing taste, somewhat similar to a B52 but much cheaper to make. Invented by a creative university who got tired of beer.
drinks.name: G4

drinks.instructions: Pour ice into glass, add tequila and kahlua, fill with cream, shake and serve.
drinks.name: White Bull

drinks.comment: This drink originated in early 1996. It was created by the rapper Tupac Shakur at a party in Los Angeles, Ca. He raps about "Thug Passion," claiming that is guaranteed to make the "[girl] wet and the [guy] hard." Drink this as a toast to Tupac!
drinks.name: Thug Passion #1

drinks.instructions: Pour each part into a Old-fashioned glass over ice. Top with a wedge of Lime.
drinks.name: Mexican Mountie

drinks.comment: This shot will make you feel warm inside. It comes from Texas AM University Bonfire as a traditional shot in College Station, Texas.
drinks.name: Bonfire

drinks.comment: Takes away Zima's sweetness and gives it more kick
drinks.name: Zimartini

drinks.comment: A good choice for a pitcher drink!!
drinks.name: 57 T-Bird with Hawaiian License Plates

drinks.comment: Founded in 1897 at the Waldorf Astoria hotel in New York. Acknowledgement given to Paul Harrington and Laura Moorehead's book, Cocktail:The Drinks Bible for the 21st Century.
drinks.name: Astoria

drinks.comment: Sweet and smooth, but watch out (Tuaca is 80 proof)
drinks.name: White Witch

drinks.comment: Naming origin: Sloe = Sloe gin, Comfortable = Southern comfort, Screw = Orange juice (ie, screwdriver), Against the wall = Galliano (ie, Harvey wallbanger), With satin pillows = Frangelico, The hard way = whiskey.
drinks.name: Sloe Comfortable Screw Against The Wall With Satin Pillows The Hard Way

drinks.comment: Created one night because several guys were commenting about a new shot that should be called a two-twenty and it needed to be blue. Add up the proof of alcohols to equal 220.
drinks.name: 220 BTU

drinks.comment: Inspired by a rusty, black '81 camaro that frequents the Montgomery county fair grounds.
drinks.name: 81 Camaro

drinks.comment: This drink is a favorite at family get togethers in Arkansas. Warning have a hose ready in case flames get out of hand. This drink sounds disgusting but it is delicious.
drinks.name: Flaming Blow Job

drinks.comment: Very sweet body warming drink for the holidays. Passed down from My father. Children enjoy the drink too. Of course without the Alcohol
drinks.name: Tom and Jerry

drinks.comment: A very smooth martini, only recently released to the civilian world.
drinks.name: Patton Martini

drinks.instructions: Orange juice last, stir, and enjoy!
drinks.name: Fuzzy Navel #2

drinks.comment: I must have made 500 Golden Dreams' in my 28 yrs. of tending bar. Most people say it taste like a cream sicle. It was very popular back in the late 60's and early 70's. I can't tell you the origin but it was popular on the east coast of US.
drinks.name: Golden Dream

drinks.comment: This drink has a very unique taste and look about it. The orange juice and the cherry juice are not miscable in one another and the cherry juice settles in the bottom. It forms two seperate and distinct layers hence the name The Two.
drinks.name: The Two

drinks.comment: Tastes like a carbonated Pina Colada. Named after the person who discovered it..."The Lesbian Lover" Ralph Herrmann, LA.
drinks.name: Lesbian Lover

drinks.comment: Origin: A cold winter night. A fine festive or cold weather beverage.
drinks.name: Snowplow

drinks.comment: First there was the Snowplow, then there was the Metromelt. Named after the massive snowbank melting machines used in Toronto, it easily packs the same "thawing" qualities! Note: For extra (highly effective) thawing power, use 1 oz. of 151 proof rum......Wooooooeeeee! Yes...we have intensively researched this particular variation.
drinks.name: Metromelt

drinks.comment: Not for the weak or politically correct. Physician approved. Interesting taste. Not horrible. May cause numb lips and dead hands.
drinks.name: Pink Beaner

drinks.instructions: Mix the gim and juice and fill up with russian. The gin and juice may be shaken for better taste.
drinks.name: Gin Balalajka

drinks.comment: To bring out the Jack Daniels flavor, chase with ginger ale.
drinks.name: Black and Blue Shark

drinks.instructions: Cobine ingredients in a shaker 2/3 filled with ice. Shake well, and then strain into a cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Topaz

drinks.instructions: Add Amarretto to Hot Chocolate to your taste.
drinks.name: Dreamy Winter Night

drinks.instructions: Add Irish Cram to the Hot Chocolate and add Amaretto to your taste. Stir.
drinks.name: Dreamy Winter Delight

drinks.instructions: Add Irish Cream to Hot Chocolate to your taste.
drinks.name: Dreamy Winter

drinks.instructions: Add Kahlua and Irish Cream to Hot Chocolate. Then add Amaretto to your taste. Stir.
drinks.name: Dreamy Chocolate Winter

drinks.comment: An exotic, tropical taste.
drinks.name: Orlando Amethyst

drinks.comment: A refreshing fruity drink named after my good friend Kristi's green eyes.
drinks.name: Kristi GreenEye

drinks.comment: Sweet and rich dessert drink.
drinks.name: Tongue Tangler

drinks.comment: From the Island of Guernsey Channel Islands.
drinks.name: Beer Top

drinks.comment: Jack Jack Bravin, La Mirada California.
drinks.name: Girl Scout Thin Mint Cookie

drinks.comment: Created at Giuseppe's in Meredith, NH. A great shot if you run out of Jgermeister.
drinks.name: Flat Tire

drinks.comment: Created by Kam's bartender Jeff Piper in Champaign, IL
drinks.name: Wild Squirrel Sex

drinks.comment: The best shaker at "Shooters Bar" Surfers Paradise, Australia
drinks.name: Fruit Tingles

drinks.comment: It tastes sweet, kinda like Kool-Aid. I was at a party one night, and was messing around, figuring out what I could put together that would taste good. I tried this, and boy, did it taste good.
drinks.name: Blue Meanie

drinks.instructions: Layer: creme de menthe, irish cream and brandy
drinks.name: Irish Flag

drinks.instructions: Keep goldschlager in freezer. Mix in jigger shot glass. Shot it down and enjoy.
drinks.name: Double Gold

drinks.comment: The Advocaat drops pull the Baileys down into the other spirits, creating an effect similar to that of a Lava Lamp, hence the name!
drinks.name: Lava Lamp #2

drinks.comment: Created during Mardi Gras in New Orleans
drinks.name: Foreplay on the Neutral Ground

drinks.comment: From the movie Cocktail. Some friends at a party asked me "Bahtenda, d'you know how to make a redeye?" ala Doug Coglin. This seems to be a morning-after drink... or a dare.
drinks.name: Red Eye a la Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Fill a Collins glass with ice and pour in with all ingredients. Speed shake and serve.
drinks.name: White Jamaican

drinks.comment: A summer drink, popular in the UK. Cheers.
drinks.name: Trojan Horse

drinks.comment: From Guinness.com: "The practice of drinking Guinness with lemonade is rumoured to have started with the New Zealand rugby team, during a British tour. After a game, they ordered Guinness and lemonade (instead of bitter shandy), and found it extremely refreshing.
drinks.name: Guinness Shandy

drinks.comment: This drink will cool you off nicely on a hot summer day.
drinks.name: Mint Tea

drinks.instructions: Layer all three liqours into shot glass.
drinks.name: Astropop

drinks.comment: A friend of mine from Ireland told me this was what he drank at his local pub. It really is a tasty drink.
drinks.name: Southern Ireland

drinks.instructions: Pour the gin and the tonic water into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Top with Campari to add more colour and taste. Garnish with the lime wedge.
drinks.name: Pink Gin Tonic

drinks.comment: Invented on a bus the way home from a student festival. A limited bar and persistent hangover led us to do a refreshing, not too sweet drink.
drinks.name: Passoa Recovery

drinks.comment: The non-alcoholic variation of the Fuzzy Navel.
drinks.name: Fuzzless Navel

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain over ice in an old fashined glass.
drinks.name: Vampire's Kiss

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain over ice in a martini glass.
drinks.name: PMS Special

drinks.comment: For a Blue Fox Trot, use Blue Curacao.
drinks.name: Fox Trot

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Blue Fox Trot

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice and fill with cola. Stir and add honey. Garnish with a slice of lemon.
drinks.name: Cranberry Bomber

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice. Stir and garnish with a lime slice.
drinks.name: Evil Princess

drinks.instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a big old fashion. Stir and serve.
drinks.name: Time of the month

drinks.comment: This drink is made to get a person very drunk very fast. Drink in moderation.
drinks.name: Bomb

drinks.comment: It has a very pleasing taste. It was concocted when my best friend and I raided the refrigerator one night! Enjoy!
drinks.name: Water your melon

drinks.comment: This is a very good drink, believe it or not! This was concocted by my best friend and I while raiding the refrigerator and cupboards. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Jack your melon

drinks.comment: This is something I made up one night it is really cinnamony. Enjoy!
drinks.name: The Cherry Bomb

drinks.comment: Have a designated driver ready before you start shooting this one.
drinks.name: Back Shot

drinks.comment: I was bartending at a party, and we ran low on liquor and mixers. It was right then that a gorgeous woman asked for something fruity, so on the spot this drink was invented.
drinks.name: Fruit Lush

drinks.instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a large container. Shake or Stir Well. Server Chilled or over Ice. This will sneak up on you :)
drinks.name: Transmission Overhaul

drinks.comment: Created at our fourth wedding anniversary.
drinks.name: Wedding Anniversary

drinks.instructions: Pour Midori and Rum over ice, and top off with sweet and sour mix.
drinks.name: Gator Piss

drinks.comment: Served to the hardcore drinkers in bars in Warsaw, Poland. Not meant to be sipped like your everyday cocktail drink, but drank fast like a shot.
drinks.name: King of Poland

drinks.comment: an original drink by Dale Rockhill, Club Oxygen, Huntsville, Alabama
drinks.name: The Bomb

drinks.comment: Found at 3 am at a cocktail party. We had the ingredients. It's a keeper.
drinks.name: Tumbleweed

drinks.comment: I created this drink in August 98 for a new cafe-bar that I am working now. The name of the bar is "DRUM" and when the boss asked me for a special drink I created "Drum Cocktail". It has a light and very pleasant taste that makes it good for everyone, and it is rather a summertime drink. Kisses to everyone on Webtender from Chios Island - Greece
drinks.name: Drum Cocktail

drinks.comment: This is a result of one week of hard partying and the only things left was vodka, tequila, absolut kurant and dark rum. I figured, what the hell... Taste it and tou'll love it!!!
drinks.name: Start Me Up

drinks.comment: Origin: Tipsy Pub in Villalba P.R.
drinks.name: Anestesia

drinks.comment: Down the drink a follow with a hearty Chewbacca roar.
drinks.name: Wookie

drinks.comment: Basicly a Long Island Ice Tea but instead of Triple Sec you add Blue Caracao, and instead of coke you add a splash of 7-Up.
drinks.name: Blue Motorcycle

drinks.comment: The drink should look like grape juice. I invented it for my girlfriend one night when she was relaxing in the tub.
drinks.name: Purple Russian Gonzo

drinks.instructions: Prepare Lemon-Lime mix in a large pitcher or punch bowl and add the other ingredients and pour over ice.
drinks.name: Little Green Frog

drinks.instructions: Mix Lemon-Lime mix in a large pitcher or punch bowl and add the other ingredients and pour over ice, top each drink off with 1/2 oz of Cherry liqueur.
drinks.name: Dead Little Green Frog

drinks.comment: As Tastie as friut beverage, and dangerous when consumed in excess. Founding father: David K. Sheedy. Owner of ESPI Productions.
drinks.name: The Sheedy

drinks.comment: Founded by some lucky college students of SUNY Albany some time ago, and passed on, and on, and on....
drinks.name: Lucky Lemon

drinks.comment: This drink tastes better than it looks (and sounds). An excellent conversation starter! My best friends and I were playing around mixing drinks one night, and this one kinda "pooped" up. It tastes great! Try it...
drinks.name: Raw Sewage

drinks.comment: This drink is best serve with a spicy vodka such as Inferno or Pepper Pot which are available in Canada.
drinks.name: Dirty Bloody Martini

drinks.comment: This drink looks very pretty because the bubbles of carbon dioxide in the 7-up continuously move the gold flakes around.
drinks.name: California Gold Rush

drinks.comment: Developed for the Yukon Sourdough Rendezvous(Winter Carnival) at the Skyjacker Lounge, in Whitehorse, Yukon, Canada. ** For a kicker you can add 1oz of vodka and decrease the 7-Up and Soda water by 1/2 oz.
drinks.name: Blue Bomber

drinks.comment: Taste like a sour apple Jolly Rancher with a kick. Karla Emerling created this drink when running out of liquor at a party. A favorite at the Point After Sports Bar  Grille, Tampa, Fl.
drinks.name: Karla's Creation (KC)

drinks.comment: I lived off this stuff in England. Most pub tenders would only serve 2-3 per customer, so watch-out......This drink has a funny way of sneaking up on you! Taste like Kool-Aid.
drinks.name: Snake Bite Black (UK)

drinks.comment: A local favorite of Fort Smith's finest!
drinks.name: Arkansas Buttermilk

drinks.comment: Male equivalent of the Blow Job...shoot without hands! (Brought to you by the fine folks at Simrell's in Terre Haute, IN)
drinks.name: Muff Diver

drinks.comment: One of my personal favorites
drinks.name: Spice Cake

drinks.comment: Very smooth and refreshing shot. It originated in Big Pine key in the Florida Keys duing Spring Break 1994. The Puss is not a sexual reference but rather a description of the taste and relatively low potency of the shot.
drinks.name: Big Pine Puss

drinks.comment: Should taste exactly like a tootsie pop.
drinks.name: Tootsie Pop

drinks.comment: Thick and freshening, just like every good Irishman.
drinks.name: Irish Pride

drinks.instructions: Simply add in order vodka, ice, orange juice, lemon, and vinegar. Ice can be crushed.
drinks.name: Spear Chugger

drinks.comment: This drink originated with me AJ at my house in Roseville CA one night i took my favorite drink, The Flaming Blue Jesus, and added a beer to it, and then stirred it up, and so was born AJ's Bubbling Brew. ENJOY
drinks.name: AJ's Bubbling Brew

drinks.comment: This is a very tasty drink I made up one night. ENJOY!!
drinks.name: Dragon's Blood

drinks.comment: Close relative of the grasshopper (when you don't have the right color liquers)
drinks.name: Cricket

drinks.instructions: Combine ingredients in highball glass and stir
drinks.name: Yummy Bidnis

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice, add the ingrediants, shake and serve.
drinks.name: Blue Motorcycle #2

drinks.comment: The best drink I have ever tasted!!!
drinks.name: The Perfect Ten

drinks.comment: Another tasty, after-dinner, ice-cream drink.
drinks.name: White Dove

drinks.instructions: Shake well with lot's of ice. Pour into cocktailglass.
drinks.name: Japaneese slipper

drinks.comment: Can also be served as a mixed drink over ice in collins glass.
drinks.name: Purple Lobster

drinks.comment: Official drink of the Belmount Stakes, the third jewel of the Triple Crown. Technically served in a 12oz. souvenier "Belmount Glass". The official drink of the Belmount used to be the Manhattan, but for some reason, it was changed to the White Carnation.
drinks.name: White Carnation

drinks.instructions: Stir or shake well.
drinks.name: Champibble

drinks.comment: This is an old Seattle party drink. It is rumored to have been originaly made with eight(!) different Rums, Amaretto and a Mason Jar by some of this cities best "mixologists". Legend says that it was mixed to appease a large group of people who were tired of drinking "rum and cokes" using only the ingrediants from a bar that was stocked almost entirely with rum. This drink is a great example of how similar ingrediants can be used to create drinks with entirely different tastes. Enjoy.
drinks.name: Jo Jo Original

drinks.comment: Created by Harry Craddock at the Savoy Hotel in London, in the late 1920s. Is said to be so smooth that you are easily lured into having one too many :)
drinks.name: Leap Year

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry and a lemon twist.
drinks.name: Nicky Finn

drinks.comment: For a fizzy lemonade you can substitute club soda for water.
drinks.name: Lemonade

drinks.comment: This is a tribute to the best footballteam (soccer) in Denmark!
drinks.name: Forza FCK

drinks.comment: Be careful not to spill the 151 proof rum, or you will wind up with your hand, the shot glass, and anything else near you on fire.
drinks.name: Liberace

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients swiftly with a spork in either a irish coffee mug, or cappuchino mug. Serve hot/warm.
drinks.name: The Kuoyamuli

drinks.comment: In the UK we use a straight Pint glass, in the US I guess you need a large Pilsner beer glass. Its important to add the orange juice first. *Don't* tilt the glass when you add the cola. A perfect mix is obtained when a noticable head forms on top. It is best mixed *without* ice, but use cold ingredients. -- Also known as a "Muddy Puddle", this drink is dark brown in colour and looks revolting. It is guaranteed to turn heads if not stomachs. Nevertheless, the two ingredients compliment each other as the cola ends up not too gassy and the orange loses it sharpness.
drinks.name: Thames Water

drinks.instructions: Shake and pour over ice-cubes.
drinks.name: Grappa Gimlet

drinks.comment: Perfect drink for hot summer if it is served realy cold. Enjoy it.
drinks.name: Torombolo

drinks.comment: Haywire is the name of my boat. This drink was invented at a boat warming party for my crew.
drinks.name: Haywire

drinks.comment: This drink originated in a bar on Route 61 North of Reading, PA called Nutsy's.
drinks.name: Will Willy Wander

drinks.comment: Tastes great and sells like a charm in bars!

drinks.comment: Great for X-mas cheer. Best when drunk in front of a fire.
drinks.name: Irish Cream #2

drinks.comment: Credit to Tony Abou-Ganim for this wonderful cocktail.
drinks.name: Cable Car

drinks.comment: Thanks to Tony Abou-Ganim for yet another fantastic cocktail!

drinks.comment: Yet another of Tony Abou-Ganim's wonderful creations!
drinks.name: Hard Eight

drinks.comment: Another specialty drink from the Bellagio hotel in Las Vegas. Courtesy of Drink Specialist Tony Abou-Ganim.

drinks.comment: Nice. To be enjoyed in Baja, California. Cheers.
drinks.name: Sex in the Desert
