drinks.instructions: Mix the two ingredients in a shot glass.
drinks.name: Golden Apple

drinks.instructions: Fill cocktail glass with ice and mix the two ingredients.
drinks.name: Thug Heaven

drinks.instructions: Fill blender 1/2 to 3/4 with ice and add strawberries, pieces of watermelon, and slices of star fruit. Last add rum and mix. Blend until smooth and garnish with a slice of star fruit and an umbrella.
drinks.name: Fruit Salad Daiquiri

drinks.instructions: Pour both liquors into glass with ice. Add cream and shake well. Serve with large straw.
drinks.name: Moo Moo

drinks.instructions: Mix alcoholic ingredients one part each - and add 7-up. Eight shots of each requires a 2L bottle of 7-up.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Balls

drinks.comment: Great on a cold day or when you can't decide what you want to drink. Great after dinner drink. I like buttery nipples so tried adding coffee. New drink was born!!!
drinks.name: Nikki Coffee

drinks.comment: Well it all started in a wine bar in London. Myself Josh "The Baptist" Murray and Andy "Hatchett" Hockey (Baptising the stomach in beer, and put it down the hatch). We were after our favourite tipple, A Flaming Arsehole (advocaat and cherry brandy), and disaster struck... no cherry brandy. After much consultation with Pete the barman, it was decided that the only honourable substitute was creme de fraise, and low the dash was born. Enjoy it, its a pleasure.
drinks.name: The Dash

drinks.comment: A tasty variation of the chocolate martini.
drinks.name: Jimtini

drinks.comment: If done right it will be the best drink you ever made
drinks.name: FU2

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice.
drinks.name: Brimstone

drinks.instructions: combine all ingredients in a blender or Island Oasis machine. Blend and serve in a hurricane. Top with whip cream and garnish with a strawberry and orange.
drinks.name: Crazy Monkey

drinks.comment: I made this by accident, and ended up liking it... a lot.
drinks.name: Cokahlualicious

drinks.instructions: Mix equal parts tequila rose and bailey's in shot glass, shoot! Also try chilled.
drinks.name: Pearl Necklace

drinks.comment: Few of us 'tenders at the 'club' decided we needed a namesake drink. Watermelon Schnapps was fairly new in the area and just tossed a few things together...
drinks.name: Sunset (Night Club)

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice, serve in high glass half filled with ice.
drinks.name: Carabinieri

drinks.comment: This is a B-52 clone. You should put the shot on fire before drinking it with or without a straw. Amarula is a South African product. There are Rhinos in South Africa. I do not know if it is a myth but I've heard that when a rhino see a fire it tries to put it out. The same here... Eliminate the fire by drinking it!
drinks.name: Rhino

drinks.comment: Tastes just like those little green granny apples we all had as a child over at grandmas house. Self designed.
drinks.name: Granny Apple Blossom

drinks.comment: My wife and I discovered this in an old hotel bar in Ohio called The Antlers. Excellent.
drinks.name: Toasted Fisherman

drinks.comment: The first entry into our book of 50 drinks named after diseases.
drinks.name: Scurvy #2

drinks.instructions: Pour equal parts of each in the the shot glass
drinks.name: 8 iron

drinks.comment: This bizarre shot originated in a club in Toronto when a friend of mine (after quite a few drinks) said he would drink any shot: namely tequila, wine and amaretto. I didn't think wine would go too well, so I substituted lime, and bought him the shot. He said it tasted good, and the TLA was born. Of course, bartenders still look at us funny whenever we order it...
drinks.name: TLA

drinks.comment: A good taste that will end with a good time!
drinks.name: Mexican Iceberg

drinks.comment: Found at a riverside bar in Seville, Spain.
drinks.name: Cerebellum

drinks.comment: This is an easy drink to make, and it tastes good, too.
drinks.name: Mogadon

drinks.comment: This is a cool, refreshing strawberry flavoured drink. The Brandy serves to reduce the sweetness of the drink and it makes the overall taste less overwhelming.
drinks.name: Strawberry Kiss

drinks.comment: Beleve it or not, this is actually quite smooth, but it will sure sneek up on you fast. More than one and you better call a cab fast.
drinks.name: Just Shoot Me

drinks.comment: Inspired by Harry Turtledove science fiction novel, and made by a bartender somewhere in either Chicago or Milwaukee one very long road trip ago in 1980.
drinks.name: Panther Sweat

drinks.comment: Feliz Natal is Portuguese for Happy Christmas and the cocktail is inspired by the flavours of a rich liqueur chocolate cake eaten at this time of year. The heady flavours of Brandy and Port from the Douro region of Portugal, some dried cherries, wrapped in Marzipan and coated in chocolate. Let christmas last all year! Feliz Natal!
drinks.name: Feliz Natal

drinks.comment: Major sugar and caffeine high. I do not suggest more than 4 tablespoons of tang to 8 ounces of mountain dew. And cheaper brands of tang don't seem to have the same flavor or effect.
drinks.name: Mountain Dang

drinks.comment: Finished drink should look, smell, and taste like Hawaiian Punch, but don't let that fool you. Developed at O'Riley's Bar and Grill in Universal City, TX in 1986
drinks.name: Pink Floyd

drinks.comment: I found this recipe in, of all places, Car and Driver magazine. Supposedly, this is was a favorite drink of Hemmingway's while he lived in Cuba. A very sweet drink.
drinks.name: Papa Doble

drinks.comment: Tastes fruity, looks blue-greenish which is where is got its name (looks like dirty lake water).
drinks.name: Seaweed

drinks.comment: Taste: refreshing ideal summer drink although highly alcoholic. Origin: got the idea while working as a bartender, was asked to create some fresh but nonetheless strong alcoholic mix.
drinks.name: Thal on the rocks

drinks.comment: Tastes better when Hot Damn has been chilled.
drinks.name: Hot Jose

drinks.comment: The taste is original and goes does fairly smooth, but for the weeker stomach a chaser of some sort is usually required.
drinks.name: Rocky Mountain Bear Fucker #3

drinks.comment: Just an ordinary shot of vodka, but spices it up somewhat.
drinks.name: Molotov Cocktail

drinks.comment: The drink is a house signature cocktail for my bar. The name of the bar is Tequila Bay. It was tested on the band we had playing that weekend and after 4 attempts I came up with this one.
drinks.name: Tequila Bay Breeze

drinks.comment: If you like watermelon Jolly Ranchers, you'll love this drink!
drinks.name: Wet Kiss

drinks.instructions: Pour in one shot of Jack Daniel's on ice, more if you like your drinks strong. Then pour about a half of a can of Coca-Cola on top, leaving room for the iced tea. Finally, fill to the top with very strong iced tea (try three times the amount of powder).
drinks.name: Jack-Off

drinks.comment: I got this name from a friend. It's derived from when we found out that a few of these knocked out another friend, so when she woke up, it was Suddenly Daylight
drinks.name: Suddenly Daylight

drinks.comment: Fruity, with nectar like qualities. This is truly one of the great summertime pleasures. Mix a pitcher and watch the sunset. Originated on July 18, 1998 in upstate NY.
drinks.name: Cucci

drinks.comment: A Fuzzy Navel's older brother. This sure tastes like a fuzzy navel but will knock you on your ass a lot quicker. It's also a good party drink if mixed in a large punch bowl.
drinks.name: Extra Fuzzy Navel

drinks.comment: This shot is taken by two people through straws. Created by staff at Cafe' Arone bar in Wilson, NC
drinks.name: Brooklyn Zoo

drinks.comment: We were working on variations of the Slippery Nipple that we could set on fire. We came up with the Branded Nipple and found it delicious! Hope you like it!
drinks.name: Branded Nipple

drinks.instructions: Combine all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake and strain into shot glass. Serve.
drinks.name: PB&J

drinks.comment: Can use low quality Tequila if you're brave!! BE CAREFUL THIS DRINK HAS CAUSED ALCOHOL POISONING!! You have been warned, but trust us it's worth it!! ENJOY
drinks.name: Sigma Nu Ball Buster

drinks.comment: The drink is perfect for a day at the beach and it is from Denmark
drinks.name: Baywatch

drinks.comment: I recommend 99 Bananas, but that's just me! Tastes like a gumball, hence the name.
drinks.name: Gumball Hummer

drinks.comment: Fast shot for a cold night warming sensational feeling! Try it, Love it!
drinks.name: Calypso

drinks.comment: Learned this drink at a small bar in the mountains on a snow mobile trip. Excellent drink...
drinks.name: Tree Smacker

drinks.instructions: Mix in glass over ice.
drinks.name: Dr Jack

drinks.comment: Smoother than a regular tequila. Great start on a Penthouse party. Invented in Lund, Sweden.
drinks.name: Penthouse

drinks.comment: Very Smooth
drinks.name: Kickstand

drinks.comment: Tastes like a root beer float
drinks.name: Baileyfloat

drinks.instructions: Pour Chambord into shot glass. Warm sake on stove then pour into chambord. Drink immediately.
drinks.name: Purple Wind

drinks.comment: Favorite summer shot at Solomon Grundys in Saratoge Springs, NY.
drinks.name: Tropical Passion

drinks.comment: From the Backwoods of Florida.
drinks.name: Slow Comfortable Screw on a Dogbox

drinks.comment: This recipe is from skiing in the Northwest. Be careful it doesn't pull you down..
drinks.name: Snow Snake

drinks.comment: Use Casa Noble Gold for best taste results.
drinks.name: Sweet Casa Noble

drinks.comment: This is a very refreshing drink, especially for the summer. I'm not sure if it's an actual drink or if it has a name already but my friends and I call it a Razberi Kicker because you can't taste the alcohol and it kind of sneaks up and kicks you in the behind! Enjoy!
drinks.name: Razberi Kicker

drinks.comment: Guarranteed to quench your summertime thirst for intoxication.
drinks.name: Peach Tea Cooler

drinks.instructions: mix first two ingredients: fill with pineapple juice.
drinks.name: Geisha

drinks.comment: A Canadian bartender gave me this drink in a bar in Uppsala, Sweden. Expensive, but well worth it. You'll only need one per night.
drinks.name: Canadian Zombie

drinks.comment: Use small amounts lime wedge, pepper, and/or salt if desired. If you like a spicier taste subsitute bloody mary mix for tomato juice.
drinks.name: The BV

drinks.comment: Best with a no-pulp juice. Yet another Carnegie Mellon fave.
drinks.name: Ooo

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice in a highball glass. Stir.
drinks.name: The Wedge

drinks.comment: People have never said anything other than that this drink is amazing the first time they had it, it is very sweet and people have said it tastes like a pixy stick.
drinks.name: The Lynchmob

drinks.comment: This drink was created by the Zeta Beta chapter of Phi Sigma Sigma, located at Rowan University in Glassboro NJ. We enjoyed it at many social functions, hope you like it!
drinks.name: Phi Psycho Psycho

drinks.comment: Very refreshing drink after a hard day of chasing Road Runners!
drinks.name: Wile E Coyote

drinks.comment: This is a late night invention that turned out surprisingly well. It is an intense but not unpleasant drink. The name comes from the fact that none of the flavors mask each other, despite being fairly contradictory in nature.
drinks.name: Oxymoron

drinks.instructions: Makes 1 gallon of punch -- mix all 4 liquers in 1 parts and fill rest with pineapple and cranberry juice
drinks.name: Sex On The Beach - Jersey Style

drinks.instructions: In a blender, combine ingredients with ice and enjoy!
drinks.name: Coo Coo

drinks.instructions: Pour root beer into mug. Add a shot of Blackberry Brandy.
drinks.name: Barbarian

drinks.instructions: Pour blue curacao, gin and 7-Up into a shaker tin filled with ice. Swirl until tin is frosty. Pour into Martini (Cocktail) Glass. Repeat with the cranberry juice and add to glass so that an electric-purple colour is achieved. Garnish with a cherry on a sparkler stick.
drinks.name: Eenytini

drinks.comment: Created at the Hyatt Regency Columbus for a Longaberger Basket convention (and to burn off dead stock!)
drinks.name: Longaberger Lemonade

drinks.comment: This drink is also known as "Four Favorite J's" since it is made with Jose, Jim, Jack and Johnnie.
drinks.name: Four Fine Friends

drinks.comment: We created this by mixing all of the ingredients we had available in Lorraine's kitchen. You may need to adjust to your personal taste but it is quite delicious. The peach schnapps give it a wonderful flavor.
drinks.name: Lorraine's Delight

drinks.instructions: Build on ice.
drinks.name: Georgia Peach

drinks.comment: Tasty. Cheers.
drinks.name: Comfort Dry Manhattan

drinks.comment: The King of Denmark is actually the name of a traditional anise sweet which is very popular in Denmark.
drinks.name: The King Of Denmark

drinks.instructions: Combine all ingredients, pour over ice, and enjoy.
drinks.name: Letitia's Penisbutter Cup

drinks.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a hurricane glass, and shake
drinks.name: Titia's Tushie

drinks.comment: This mudslide approximates the delicious (but expensive) mudslide offered by the restuarant named after everyone's favorite day of the week. It is rich in chocolate taste and packs a hidden punch behind its rich decadent creamy flavor. I got the recipe from the bartender at the restuarant. Be sure to use a high-quality ice cream. For those that dislike the strong slightly bitter coffee flavor imparted by Kahlua, reduce the Kahlua to 1/2 oz and add 1 oz milk.
drinks.name: Fridays Frozen Mudslide

drinks.comment: Tastes exactly like bottlecap candy.
drinks.name: Bottlecap

drinks.instructions: Place all of the ingredients into a blender and blend for about 20 - 30 seconds. Then pour into a hi-ball glass or a Gibralter 14 oz glass.
drinks.name: Phoenix Paradise

drinks.comment: Great tasting drink, perfect to serve cold in the summer.
drinks.name: Eagle Eye

drinks.comment: This drink comes from France. A lot of teens drink it over there, and it's actually quite refreshing. Try one out!
drinks.name: Monaco

drinks.instructions: Use chilled orange juice, but no ice.
drinks.name: Caribbean Bliss

drinks.comment: YUM! Tastes just like real root beer, kids. It's good for what ails ya. Created during Colorado School of Mines Engineers' Days 1993.
drinks.name: Brittle Fracture

drinks.comment: This drink is a direct result of my experiments with the alcohol I drink and common beverages found around my house. It tastes fairly good.. but can taste funny if the milk does not have a strong Chocolate content.
drinks.name: Chocolate Bomb
ingredients: 1 oz Coconut rum (Malibu or Parrot Bay)

drinks.comment: You can add a splash of lemon and garnish with a twist for a classy drink or serve in a mason jar for real down home feel. My personal favorites are a chipped coffee mug and the plastic hotel bathroom cups.
drinks.name: Carolina Iced Tea

drinks.comment: Invented by Brian Padnes and Greg Yurkovic after many episodes of Twin Peaks.
drinks.name: Black Lodge

drinks.comment: A taste born of EXTREMELY hoary nights! Best enjoyed with a friend.
drinks.name: Yukon Dew Me

drinks.comment: I found this one in a german 1970's recipe-book. You can change the amount of campari if you want to. (I prefer 4 cl).
drinks.name: Campari Milkshake

drinks.comment: This drink can also be served without the chill, but cold tastes better.
drinks.name: Disco Ball

drinks.comment: A version of the classic Screwdriver taken from the label of an Irish Mist bottle. Can substitute Cranberry Juice for Orange Juice.
drinks.name: Dublin Driver

drinks.comment: When done properly this drink tastes just like the Allen's lollies of the same name.
drinks.name: Fruit Tingle #2

drinks.instructions: Combine vodka and rum in cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into old-fashioned glass with ice. Top off with grapefruit soda and stir gently.
drinks.name: Centipede

drinks.comment: Created by Maryann, with the help of her customers at the Spar Tree Resturant and Lounge in Stevenson Washington
drinks.name: The Whole Maryann

drinks.comment: I created this margarita variation to utilize the very best top shelf ingredients and impart a smooth citrus-lime-orange taste. All of the liqueurs used are derived from the orange (and most are quite high in alcohol content). This margarita is surprisingly sweet and smooth. Make one of these and you'll probably make another. A variation of this recipe would be to add 1/4 oz. Blue Curacao.
drinks.name: Platinum Grand Margarita

drinks.instructions: Mix with ice and pour into glass.
drinks.name: Sour Death

drinks.comment: When adding soda at the end, the bubbles should rise through the blended juices creating the smoothie effect.
drinks.name: Tinyee's Orange Smoothie

drinks.comment: A sweet cocktail to conquer a sweet lady. Created in Fregene, Italy by Tony
drinks.name: Mirage

drinks.comment: Best if drunk with a lime, lemon, or an orange wedge
drinks.name: Arizona PowWow

drinks.comment: This is my original recipe never before published. It is a three-color drink (yellow, then orange and finally red at the bottom of the glass) and looks like a sunset.
drinks.name: Sunset Sour

drinks.comment: If you drink enough of these, you will know that Arizona truly has beaches.
drinks.name: Sex on an Arizona Beach

drinks.comment: Created by SKYY Vodka in honor of Desmond Dekker's birthday.
drinks.name: Caribbean Breeze

drinks.instructions: Combine alcohol in a coffee mug. Fill with hot chocolate. Garnish with whipped cream.
drinks.name: Apocolypse

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingridients and serve over ice.
drinks.name: Magic Woman

drinks.comment: This is a very potent drink if downed, so take it easy! I have seen a lot of people in very bad states who have dared to down this. Snakebite Black is the same drink as Diesel, and snakebite Jack was dreamed up by me, some friends and a lot of alcohol!
drinks.name: Snakebite Jack

drinks.comment: Its a bit sweet of a vodka drink to be. Super
drinks.name: Kenny

drinks.comment: A nice girlish drink with a good looking appearance. The crushed ice and strawberry makes it look delicious.
drinks.name: Perfect Kiss

drinks.instructions: In a shaker with ice, combine rum and vodka. Shake well and strain into a highball glass filled almost to the top with ice. Top off with ginger ale and stir gently.
drinks.name: Telegraph

drinks.comment: Not too sweet, not too tart.
drinks.name: Amor de Cosmos

drinks.comment: Like a Kamikazee with club soda and a lemon flavor.
drinks.name: Soviet Sunset

drinks.comment: Created by Ruby Tuesday, Ocala, Florida
drinks.name: Absolut Royal Fuck

drinks.comment: Created at Ruby Tuesday, Ocala, Florida
drinks.name: Apple Jolly Rancher

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Barney on Acid

drinks.instructions: Shake, strain into glass
drinks.name: Alligator Piss

drinks.comment: This drink was created as a toast to present and past friends and fellow soldiers. Much like the true Green Beret Special Forces soldiers, this drink sneaks up on you and hits you silently. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Green Beret

drinks.comment: It'll make you tweaked out after a couple.
drinks.name: Tweaked

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Twin Sisters

drinks.instructions: Pour one shot Sambuca, add a splash of Galliano on top. Light on fire and drink it.
drinks.name: Stubborn Italian

drinks.comment: This drink was founded by D.J. van der Beek. I put it on the internet. The drink is called 'Ladder'. Its a dutch word from the expression 'ladder zat'. It means: getting really drunk. Enjoy this cocktail!
drinks.name: Ladder

drinks.comment: Some of my friends and I made up shots for different teams during the 1999 NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs. This shot signifies Dallas' colours - Green and Gold.
drinks.name: Dallas Stars

drinks.comment: Some of my friends and I made up shots for different teams during the 1999 NHL Stanley Cup Playoffs. This shot signifies Toronto's colours - Blue and White.
drinks.name: Toronto Maple Leafs

drinks.instructions: Fill the shot glass about 2/3rd's full of Jager, and then top it off with the Sambuca.
drinks.name: Wayne's World

drinks.comment: A great drink on a warm summer day!
drinks.name: Lager & Lime

drinks.comment: This drink was invented on a very good wendsday night at Middlebury College's summer French school.
drinks.name: Toro

drinks.comment: This drink came about late one night on Smith 2 of Watterson Towers at Illinois State University. (1997-1998) It is dedicated to guys of Suite D, Chris Mansfield from Smith 4, and GoNINzo - The only person who could defeat me (Lucifer) at Quake.
drinks.name: Slaughtering the Slothman

drinks.instructions: Mix together.
drinks.name: Rye & Ginger

drinks.comment: This version of Mai Tai was the most popular drink in the now closed resturant China Village. Though ingredients are there, the actual measurements of ingrediants are estimates due to the fact I was 10 at the time (no i did not tend the bar). Use chrodial grenadine thats alcoholic (12%).
drinks.name: China Village Mai Tai

drinks.comment: This was introduced to me by a friend whos girlfriend came accross it in a London pub. Its great for the beach and a JD Team favourite.
drinks.name: Tiger Jack

drinks.comment: Soak several slices of Habanero pepper in the bottle of vodka for 3 months before using. It will give you that feeling of a summer hot breeze.
drinks.name: Hot Summer Breeze

drinks.comment: One of many successful (or semi-successful) party-time mixing experiments.
drinks.name: Sever St. Special

drinks.comment: A variation on the Sever St. Special (born of the same party). It tastes surprisingly different with just a little Midori added in.
drinks.name: Candied Sever St. Special

drinks.comment: It tastes similar to a Fuzzy Navel but with a banana flavor. I was experimenting one day with different drinks and just tried this and came up with it.
drinks.name: Screwed Banana

drinks.comment: Make sure you take your time with this drink
drinks.name: Spicy Martini

drinks.comment: I was feeling cheap and wanted to make my own Coffee Coolata so I tried things and this is what I came up with and someone sugested the Kahlua.
drinks.name: Coffee Coolata

drinks.comment: I saw it on the side of the melon liquer bottle and it was very good and sweet. Enjoy!!
drinks.name: Penalty Shot

drinks.comment: This drink is a sipper!
drinks.name: Mint Condition

drinks.instructions: Add ice and a shot of pucker to the highball glass. Fill with ginger ale. Squeeze a wedge of lime and toss it in the glass. Stir.
drinks.name: All Puckered Out

drinks.comment: Darryl's Liquor Labs Inc.
drinks.name: Bent Bum

drinks.comment: My local bartender, Rocky, invented this drink when somone spilled on the bar. After that, anytime someone did a party foul they had to take a shot of respect. The amount of tabasco is a direct relation to how bad the foul was.
drinks.name: Shot of Respect

drinks.comment: Use a sweet cream if available.
drinks.name: Coconut Cream Pie

drinks.instructions: Put the liquor in the shot glass equally
drinks.name: Barracuda

drinks.comment: The common Irish Porter drinker came back from France after a long affair with their rich coffee. Unable to decide between his two loves-Guinness or coffee he came up with a delicious compromise
drinks.name: Paddy's Caffeine

drinks.comment: I invented this drink at a bar called ETC. in Memphis, TN in the mid 80's. All you taste is the Grand Marnier. Doesn't take many. Have a nice trip.
drinks.name: Purple Mexican

drinks.comment: Created at the Rebar, when asked to make something nasty but nice
drinks.name: P.D.C.

drinks.comment: This drink really has quite a kick to it, but the alchol used doesn't really leave that alchol taste in your mouth. It is a good stout drink for people who don't care overly for the taste of alchol. I suggest it all the time to my coustomers, and while hesitant at first, they always want another.
drinks.name: Liquid Valium

drinks.instructions: Mix in a beer mug.
drinks.name: Mountain Fuck

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice, strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Pierced Nipple

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain over ice.
drinks.name: Jamaican Ten Speed

drinks.comment: Very tropical, made up this drink at Rick's Cafe in Negril, Jamaica while on our honeymoon.
drinks.name: Jamaican Sunset #2

drinks.comment: Drink was invented at "64" in the West Village, NYC.
drinks.name: Crazy Janie

drinks.comment: Another great creation from Tuaca HQ in the UK.
drinks.name: Tuaca Nutter

drinks.comment: Learned about this is college (where else) back in the day (70's). The drink, according to legend, originated at a Margate, NJ bar of the same name.
drinks.name: Mother

drinks.instructions: Mix Schnapps and juice in glass of ice. Place in blender. Blend until smooth. Serve in chilled glass.
drinks.name: Alternate Root

drinks.comment: Its a drink if ya dont wanna get too wasted
drinks.name: Less Than Jake on The Rocks

drinks.comment: Very good and strong
drinks.name: The Dukes Of Hazzard Tonic

drinks.comment: This drink should be tasted and sipped slowly and luxoriously, as one would partake of its namesake.
drinks.name: Creamy Snatch

drinks.instructions: Add Brandy to glass and fill with Lemonade. Add ice if desired. Stir.
drinks.name: Deidru

drinks.comment: I prefer not to use a sipping straw for the reason that you have more time to enjoy this tasty treat. Brandy is a very tasty liquor. So I added some peach schnapps, grenadine, and orange juice to spruce it up. What I came up with is something that I will drink for the rest of my life!
drinks.name: Satin Sheet

drinks.comment: Have to give some credit here to the man who helped me invent this one: Rad Wintle.
drinks.name: Kokopa

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice, stir and serve.
drinks.name: A Southern Screw

drinks.comment: A unique way to drink this shooter is to ask a man to sit and unzip his fly. The shooter is then placed in his opened zipper. A woman is then asked to kneel in front of him and place her hands behind her back. She must then bend over, take the glass with her mouth and shoot back. Have fun!!
drinks.name: Zipper

drinks.comment: Very good sipping drink. Very smooth and goes down easy. I came up with it one night when that was all that was in the house.
drinks.name: Dr. Raspberry

drinks.comment: The taste is difficult to explain. It is initially tart and dry, then developes a sweetness at the finish. I had never heard of Tequila being used with grapefruit juice, so I thought that I would try it. I think that it tastes very different and very good.
drinks.name: Bittersweet with a twist

drinks.comment: This Cocktails is freely invented by me (Christoph Daugaard) This Cocktail is dedicated to a lovelely girl.
drinks.name: Madeleine

drinks.instructions: Mix alcohols, add coffee, top with whipped cream, Enjoy. Good on a cold winters night!
drinks.name: Keoke Coffee

drinks.comment: Dont be fooled by the taste. This one will knock you on the ass! Before you drink yell "El Tanque"!
drinks.name: The Hurtado

drinks.comment: This drink is known also as the "Dead Hitler": however it has become popular on the west coast as the Dizzy Damage. This drink is in legend to have been Dizzy damage's (Erik Boyles) drink of choice. (From the Glamour Punks).
drinks.name: Dizzy Damage

drinks.comment: Just happened (couldn't find sweet and sour mix, so we used cointreau).
drinks.name: Tropical Kermit Piss
ingredients: Fill with Pineapple soda or lemon soda

drinks.instructions: Add the Whisky and Tequila together, one shot worth combined, then add the same amount of Champagne/Sparkling Wine. Put your hand or a beer mat over the glass, slam it down onto table and then down it in one.
drinks.name: Indiana Jones

drinks.comment: The perfect summer drink. This will even win over people who say they can't stand rum.
drinks.name: Limon and Ginger

drinks.comment: From a galaxy far, far away.
drinks.name: C3PO

drinks.comment: Unusual but good! Ran out of vodka, tried rum instead.
drinks.name: Whippersnapper

drinks.instructions: Mix alcohol first, then add cola.
drinks.name: Beth's Own

drinks.instructions: Mix and Add Ice
drinks.name: Carribean Dream

drinks.comment: It kinda tastes like a Brandy old fashioned, but yet has a distinctive taste to it. I made this drink up at my brother's batchleor's party and was a big hit. So i have to send out thanks to Daver. E-mail comments are happily accepted
drinks.name: Ironman

drinks.comment: I've got this recipe from Raffles Hotel, Singapore, where it was originally invented. Singapore Sling was created at Raffles Hotel at the turn-of-the-century by Hainanese-Chinese bartender Mr Ngiam Tong Boon. Originally, the Singapore Sling was meant as a woman's drink, hence the attractive pink colour.
drinks.name: Genuine Singapore Sling

drinks.comment: Inspired by the ladies at the Starboard Restaurant in Dewey Beach, Del!
drinks.name: Purple Nipple

drinks.comment: 151 Rum is optional.
drinks.name: Californian Hurricane

drinks.comment: Feel free to vary the amount of Aftershock to your taste.
drinks.name: Dr. Shocker

drinks.comment: Created by Tanya of the Criterion Hotel, Rockhampton
drinks.name: Tanyahtoo

drinks.comment: It hits all of your taste buds. Tastes Sweet, sour, salty, and bitter. Very refreshing after a days work.
drinks.name: Pat

drinks.comment: Designed by a clever guy especially for the 1999 Solar Eclipse, this drink becomes darker if given time to settle - but can you resist it that long?!
drinks.name: The Eclipse

drinks.comment: For those who like a Fuzzy Navel but with more of a kick.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Screw

drinks.comment: Drink your Peanut Butter and Jelly Sandwich and get your date drunk at the same time.
drinks.name: PB&J #2

drinks.comment: Smooth, almost like chocolate milk
drinks.name: Carbomb #2

drinks.comment: It's tastes like an Electric Lemonade with Zima instead of lemon-lime soda and more sour mix. Instead of Triple Sec, you can also use Blue Curacao. It makes it a pretty blue-green drink. Also, keep a LOT of extra ice on hand because this drink has so much alcohol it melts the ice immediately, which is why you should not put ice in the shaker, it will dilute the drink.
drinks.name: Zimamazing

drinks.comment: Less sweet and more complex than a straightforward gimlet, it still has the deep green color and sweet acidity that Rose's lime juice lends it. And it tastes better than martinis. I like it with Boodles or Tanqueray gin.
drinks.name: Martinet

drinks.comment: Fell upon it late one night when we had nothing else to drink. Can also be mixed with OJ if desired
drinks.name: Queen Soda

drinks.comment: If mixed correctly there should be almost no alcohol taste. Females enjoy this drink because they can have the hard liquor without tasting it.
drinks.name: Eyes Wide Shut

drinks.comment: A nutty chocolate drink guaranteed to go down smooth..
drinks.name: Candy Bar

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Cherry Lifesaver Shooter

drinks.comment: the Bourbon cuts the edge off the Ouzo nicely
drinks.name: Bouzo

drinks.comment: "Blonde" comes from how it looks, and my hair color is blonde. "Ron" comes from "Ron" Bacardi that is printed on the label and my name happens to be Ron. It is a light sweet drink that I like and so do alot of my customers at the last bar I worked. I never liked rum and coke because of the taste and just drank rum and 7up for along time till I happened to different juices, cranberry, and OJ are the other ones that taste OK.
drinks.name: Blonde Ron

drinks.comment: Tastes like a watermelon and apple jolly rancher sucked on together. I was on the drinking side of bar and was trying the sour apple pucker, then a the watermelon pucker and thought they might be good together (especially since there is only 15% alcohol in them) and low and behold it was GREAT now everyone where I bartend (the locals anyway) like them as well and the rest was history.
drinks.name: Double Pucker

drinks.comment: This is the special drink of Sammy Hagar, whose backup band is called the Waborita's. This receipe (which is similar to a Special Tequini) can be found on his new CD, "Red Voodoo". Mas Tequila!
drinks.name: Waborita

drinks.comment: Great for cold, wintery, lonely nights. But, better for cold, wintery, nights to share with someone.
drinks.name: Irish Monk

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon or orange twist.
drinks.name: Picon Whiskey

drinks.instructions: Shake first six ingredients with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Ass a dash of raspberry syrup. Garnish with a lime squeeze.
drinks.name: Riley

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
drinks.name: XYZ

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
drinks.name: Sir Knight

drinks.comment: The recipe comes from the 'Official Star Trek Cooking Manual' (Bantam Books 1978) by Mary Ann Piccard, but not even Paramount will acknowledge it anymore.
drinks.name: Saurian Brandy

drinks.instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients in a large saucepan and bring almost to simmer over medium heat. Reduce heat and cook for 10 minutes (do not simmer). Add Cointreau and stir until hot. Serve warm in heat proof glasses or mugs, leaving peel and spices in pan.
drinks.name: Mulled Madeira

drinks.instructions: Pour lemon and lime juice into a pitcher and add sugar. Stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add water and ice cubes. Stir.
drinks.name: Lemonade #2

drinks.instructions: Shake vodka, Rock and Rye, and lime juice with ice. Strain into a ice filled collins glass. Top with lemon soda and stir gently. Garnish with a slice of lime.
drinks.name: Rock and Rye Cooler

drinks.comment: Remember that the longer the zest and vodka mix rests, the better the taste will be.
drinks.name: Italian Limoncello

drinks.instructions: Serve chilled straight or on the rocks.
drinks.name: Lemon Lift

drinks.instructions: Pour Limoncello and Grand Marinier into coffee cup or glass. Fill with coffee and top with whipped cream.
drinks.name: Sorrento Café

drinks.instructions: Pour into scotch glass over ice. Stir. Garnish with a twist of lemon peel.
drinks.name: Lemon Highlander

drinks.instructions: Pour into a tall glass over ice. Fill with cranberry juice. Garnish with wedge of lemon.
drinks.name: Pink Cello

drinks.comment: To coat rim of glass, first dip in Limoncello, then in a bowl of sugar.
drinks.name: Lady Cello

drinks.instructions: Pour into tall glass over ice, fill with Coca-Cola and add a wedge of lemon.
drinks.name: Cokello

drinks.comment: This will cure the serious rider of whatever malady the night before has put upon them. Prepare to sweat.
drinks.name: Bloody Biker
ingredients: 5 oz hot and spicy V8 juice

drinks.comment: Originated in a dorm room at a small Kentucky private college. Seems like you're getting relaxed and staying healthy at the same time!
drinks.name: V's With Sauce

drinks.comment: The Mountain Dew's handy when ya wanna stay awake :)
drinks.name: Real Pisser

drinks.comment: A Caucasian/White Russian is the favorite drink of "The Dude" in the movie "The Big Lebowski."
drinks.name: Caucasian

drinks.comment: Drink is awesome and looks great, using sloe gin works also instead of grenadine. It will suspend in the drink, looks like an american flag. My husband and I own a nightclub, and I made this up the third night open, never bartended before, didn't even get to taste it until open for almost two months.
drinks.name: Club Tropix

drinks.instructions: Add together in a glass, and stir. Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge, chunk of cheese and an olive.
drinks.name: Bloody Mary Jolly style
ingredients: 1/2 glass hot and spicy V8 juice

drinks.comment: Serve unstirred with a stir stick for presentation. Then tell drinkers they have the option to stir. Good for close company!
drinks.name: Rainbow Brew

drinks.comment: From a small bar in DC. Random Bartender that a friend knew.
drinks.name: Kentucky Wildcat

drinks.comment: I just made this drink one night with what happened to be in the apartment. These instructions should be close to what I originally made but I was too messed up to remember how many ice cubes I added etc. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!
drinks.name: Neon Voodoo

drinks.comment: Taste is smooth provided you don't skimp on ingredents. El Presidente Imported Brandy and a 100% agave tequila are the key components -- Don't be cheap.
drinks.name: Presidential Margarita

drinks.comment: It's a fun shot that I learned in a bar in Europe. It's a fun one to do with your friends.
drinks.name: Blue Thrill

drinks.comment: An approximation of spiced apples.
drinks.name: Apple Pie Shot #3

drinks.comment: Although this drink has been around for a while, you may not have tried it. It's not your everyday Daiquiri, but it has a refreshing summer flavor. Depending on your avocado and your personal taste, you may want to add a pinch of salt or a pinch of sugar.
drinks.name: Avocado Daiquiri

drinks.comment: A fruity, sweet drink that reminds me of summer walks along Park Avenue in Winter Park, FL. Cherry liqeuer can be used in place of maraschino cherry juice for a variation.
drinks.name: Winter Parker

drinks.instructions: Shake.
drinks.name: Blue Light Special

drinks.comment: I learned it at Empire bar in Walldorf, Germany, as an exchange student in the 9th grade.
drinks.name: Lächler

drinks.comment: Any kind of punch can be substituted for fruit punch.
drinks.name: Bloody Coochie

drinks.comment: Please email me if you find this drink to your liking, please see my other entries for similar interesting concoctions. Check your dictionary for the meaning of choad.
drinks.name: Choad

drinks.comment: I named this because that was what it felt like as it tried to crawl it's way out of my stomach.
drinks.name: Cockroach

drinks.comment: Invented by my buddy Morgan Wesley.
drinks.name: Reality Twist

drinks.comment: Invented this drink to celebrate Bastille Day week at the bar I work at.
drinks.name: Guillotine

drinks.comment: I created this drink to be a replica of the taste of fresh homemade peach ice-cream.
drinks.name: Royal Peaches and Cream

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients thoroughly and pour in glass.
drinks.name: Cioccolato e cocco

drinks.instructions: Fill half a glass with ice cubes, add Passoa, vodka, lime and pear soft drink. Stir and top with cream. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Roffsing

drinks.comment: The taste is sweet yet powerful. It's a great holiday cocktail, and a succulent substitute for eggnog.
drinks.name: Cinnamon Caramel Apple

drinks.instructions: Build in in the glass. Plenty of ice cubes
drinks.name: Taste of Winter

drinks.comment: Sweet but yummy. Good for people who can't drink vodka (like me).
drinks.name: Holy Doodle

drinks.comment: This recipe has been brought to you by Nick at The Basin Martini Bar in Saratoga, Ca. Stop by and try one or three of our specialties!
drinks.name: Creamsicle #3

drinks.comment: Looks sorta like a traffic light. When served, stir in front of customer and it turns lime green.
drinks.name: Kameleon

drinks.comment: I had this in a bar once in Sydney about 5 years ago. I probbably got the glass type wrong but the ingredients are pretty close to correct.
drinks.name: Multi-coloured Smurf

drinks.comment: Very bity short predinner cocktail
drinks.name: Side Kick

drinks.comment: Found in bars in Austria. Makes you happy when your tired after a long day of skiing.
drinks.name: Flügel

drinks.instructions: In a normal glass, add everclear and then vodka. Nearly fill with orange juice, and then add blue curacao until the entire drink turns a nice shade of green.
drinks.name: Swamp Juice

drinks.comment: This refreshing drink has an initial kick but grows on you after the first few sips.
drinks.name: Negroni - Zimbabwe Style

drinks.comment: Solicite as many ingredients as possible from the guests. Feel free to add, subtract, or change any ingredients you like. You might consider using Hawaiian Punch in place of the Fruit Punch to make it sweeter.
drinks.name: Linfield's Spare Part Punch

drinks.comment: This is a fantastic summer drink at the golf course. An Arnold Palmer with a little kick!
drinks.name: John Daly

drinks.instructions: Chilled glass
drinks.name: Y2K shot

drinks.comment: I came up with this because i dont like Triple Sec in Lynchburg Lemonaid
drinks.name: Southern Harmony

drinks.comment: Fruity, with a bit of a kick. Tis is another creation from the Delta chi archives!!!!
drinks.name: Kumoniwannalaya

drinks.comment: This is a proven drink for Caribbean Cocktail Partys and get's going without alcohol. This is a Gambrinus Classic!!!
drinks.name: Maurizio's Dream

drinks.comment: Very mild drink for those who don't like the taste of strong alcohol.
drinks.name: Chambrite

drinks.comment: Very rich flavor without the overpowering taste of alcohol.
drinks.name: Raspberry Truffle

drinks.comment: Spicy and great treat for the grown ups.
drinks.name: Red Eyed Hell
ingredients: 1 oz hot and spicy V8 juice

drinks.comment: Great way to end the evening!
drinks.name: A Goodnight Kiss

drinks.comment: Great for a warm up in the snow or on a rainy afternoon. The best!
drinks.name: Coffee Nudge

drinks.comment: This was made up at the Kokokan Club, Kuta, Bali, Indonesia. It is incredibly sour, and is taken in a small shot glass.
drinks.name: Yellow Bellied Sap Sucker

drinks.comment: An easy drink,that give you the power to go on and face the night. Enjoy "Menphis" the Lowlanders MC Italy bartender.
drinks.name: Jackbull

drinks.comment: It will make you smile :-)
drinks.name: Doucet devil

drinks.comment: Shell as in clams, shock as in large amount of Tabasco sauce. My standard cocktail after an evening of Curling. This is pretty spicy and not for the fainthearted!
drinks.name: Shellshock

drinks.instructions: Shake. Garnish with an orange twist and a cherry.
drinks.name: Blue Bohemian

drinks.comment: This is a John Steve original. He now resides in L.A. serving the stars these for breakfast.
drinks.name: Strawberry Starburst

drinks.instructions: Pour all liquids except dark rum into glass. Fill with ice and stir. Float dark rum on top and stir gently.
drinks.name: Tom's Rum Runner

drinks.instructions: Chill with ice and strain into shot glasses.
drinks.name: Absolut Tooch

drinks.comment: Invented by the famous homebartender, Taffarello
drinks.name: Clousseau

drinks.comment: Born in Gaslamp Billiard Palace, San Diego.
drinks.name: Passionate Kiss

drinks.comment: Based on the drink Abe's Tropical Night while watching the Crocodile Hunter!
drinks.name: Abe's Tropical Night in Hell

drinks.comment: If you get this one right you are in for a good time. it is very hard to get any taste of alcohol form this drink even though it will knock you on your ass in a heart beat. It tastes like a lemony lime type drink. This bevarge was the result of week long drunken escape at the beach with all of my friends. We found that everyone we brought to our place to party loved this drink, guys and girls equally. I promise this is a great party drink and everyone will love it. You can either dip it out of the cooler or drink it right from the drain plug. The latter of the two will more than likely get you a nice bill form local hospital though.
drinks.name: Dudley's Damnation

drinks.comment: Created in honour of a bride-to-be
drinks.name: Unicorn

drinks.comment: Good start on a warm glow during the summer nights! This drink originated from a group of crazies. A group that partakes in the eventfull fun of skinny dipping at Pouce Coupe River. Drink 5 and I promise you'll join us in skinny dipping:) Here's to Northern Lights and *Cheers*
drinks.name: Pouce Coupe Puddle

drinks.instructions: Mix together in glass.
drinks.name: Jealous Queen

drinks.comment: The official drink of Zelda's Kinky Dungeon of Kinkiness
drinks.name: Dungeon Punch

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Add creme de mente.
drinks.name: Green Gulf

drinks.comment: Can substitute 1 oz. root beer for 1/2 oz. root beer schnapps.
drinks.name: Dog Biscuit

drinks.comment: I got this drink from the manager where I work. His last name is Post, hence, the Postman. Definately an enjoyable shot, so, Enjoy!
drinks.name: The Postman

drinks.comment: A mighty tasty drink that goes down smooth. If it's too sweet, try more vodka. If you really want to wow someone, double the recipe, add one egg white and shake for 15 sec instead of 20 sec.
drinks.name: Berry Buster

drinks.comment: Kinda peachy, very sweet...a Simrell's original!
drinks.name: Keith Jackson

drinks.instructions: Pour (over ice is best, but not necessary) spiced rum into glass, fill with apple cider, stir.
drinks.name: Captain's Spiced Cider

drinks.comment: Another hit from Carnegie Mellon. Invented in honor of the new master electrician of the drama department. Whiskey is his drink of choice, the melon helps smooth the edges, and anything with "electric" in the title HAS to be blue of course!
drinks.name: Electric Marcucci

drinks.comment: Made by me one boring Monday afternoon at work at Brannigans Croydon. Remember I've been famous for years just show me the money.
drinks.name: Milk Tooth

drinks.comment: Has a very strong taste, we used it mainly for drinking games when we felt like getting plastered. Origin unknown, one day it just showed up at a party and became a favorite ever since
drinks.name: Soul Taker

drinks.comment: This is a great tasting drink spectacular for those patio days. If all portions are mixed properly, the drink should almost appear to glow..
drinks.name: Croc Punch

drinks.comment: First found in New England.
drinks.name: Liquid Nitrogen

drinks.instructions: Pour licor 43 and Midori in a glass and fill with milk and ice
drinks.name: Pascal

drinks.comment: Tastes like a strawberry milk, with a little kick. Real ladies drink, however i have many men hooked on them also. Vodka can be added also.
drinks.name: Teresa's Dream Shake

drinks.comment: I created this drink while receiving some guests on a Saturday night.
drinks.name: Brain Damage

drinks.comment: A combination of a Salty Dog and a Melon Ball.
drinks.name: Salty Balls

drinks.comment: A wonderful drink after skiing or after a cold day at work.
drinks.name: Cafe' Joy

drinks.comment: Origin: Yannis Villa, Sidari, Corfu, Greece. Taste: Very Warming. History: Just when we thought we couldnt think of any more shooters up poppped this one into our twisted brains. Thanks to Tellis (Holiday From Hell Fame) for lending me his bar. Tubbooki is Greek for blow job.
drinks.name: Tubboocki

drinks.comment: I got drunk one night with Smurfette but she wouldn't put out because she was on the rag.
drinks.name: Smurf on the Rag

drinks.instructions: Pour club soda into a parfait glass with ice. Pour vodka, melon liquer, and peach schnapps into a shaker and shake well. Strain into the club soda and stir. Garnish with cherry/orange/pineapple.
drinks.name: Canteloupe Dizzy

drinks.instructions: Add the whiskey fist, then Kahlua. Finally, add a splash of the mint for flavor. Stir and enjoy.
drinks.name: Pillow Mint

drinks.comment: Optional: Add 1/2 oz triple sec, or 1 teaspoon grenadine.
drinks.name: Apricot Brandy Sour

drinks.instructions: Fill 16oz glass with Ice. Add liquor. Fill with sour.
drinks.name: Blue Ed

drinks.comment: Tastes best when all ingredients are chilled prior to making drink. Tastes like one of those peanut butter kisses.
drinks.name: Alien Nipple

drinks.comment: Drink has a sweet fruity taste.
drinks.name: Italian Nut

drinks.comment: Quite tasty, and fairly potent - the ice cream takes the edge off the vodka. First introduced to us by a bartender at the Grand Floridian in Walt Disney World during our honeymoon - it's been a favorite of my wife's ever since then.
drinks.name: Raspberry Swirl

drinks.instructions: Fill Old-fashioned glass with ice. Add Brandy and Galliano. Stir and garnish with wedge of lime.
drinks.name: Italian Stinger

drinks.comment: A great fall/winter seasonal drink, when Apple Cider is easily obtained.
drinks.name: Mountain Cider High

drinks.comment: Less filling, tastes great, with a sweet twist.
drinks.name: Stinky Weasel

drinks.comment: A drink I made up to replace a B-52, just changed irish creme with Tequila Rose. Tastes like a B-52 but with a Strawberry flavor.
drinks.name: T-52

drinks.instructions: Shake midori, lemon juice and lime juice with ice, pour in a highball glass filled with ice. Fill up with sprite and soda according your taste. Garnish with lime wedge, add straw.
drinks.name: Green Alien

drinks.comment: Also good as a mixed drink, served in a cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Alabama Slammer #2

drinks.instructions: Coat the inside of a chilled cocktail glass with dry vermouth. In a mixing glass filled half way with crushed ice, combine vodka, champagne and maraschino liqueur. Stir and strain into the cocktail glass. Garnish with an olive and a maraschino cherry on a cocktail skewer.
drinks.name: Girlie Martini

drinks.instructions: Pour Amaretto and margarita mix over ice. Stir well and serve.
drinks.name: Amarita

drinks.comment: Bitter taste drink used in old Patagonian country bars. Origin: Argentina.
drinks.name: Patagonian Black Bush

drinks.comment: Created in an outside bar in Thailand following the Gulf War
drinks.name: Gangreen

drinks.comment: Very nice and easy to drink. My personal favorite.
drinks.name: Irish Highball

drinks.instructions: Layer Blue Curacao and Bailey's in a shot glass over crushed ice. Mix to drink.
drinks.name: Summer Fling

drinks.instructions: Combine in shaker with ice and pour over ice.
drinks.name: Green Coconut

drinks.comment: This shot tastes like a dream. It's sweet and creamy, but not so sweet it makes you sick. In a word, smooth. Careful, they may seem tame, but after a few they sneak up on you.
drinks.name: Green Eyed Blonde

drinks.comment: Created on September 24, 1999 in Maryville, Missouri
drinks.name: Beach Bum

drinks.comment: Like Yoda, this drink is green and powerful. If you want a slightly less powerful Yoda, you can leave the Vodka out. If you want a more powerful drink, obviously add more Vodka. This drink is very sour, but if you like Midori sours, or pucker, you should love this.
drinks.name: Yoda

drinks.instructions: Mix the shots of Rum, Vodka, Amaretto over ice, add a dash of Sour Mix, then fill the rest with Cranberry Juice.
drinks.name: Jackson 5

drinks.comment: This drink was concieved at the now defunct Almonte Roadhouse in Almonte, Ontario. It is a very sweet drink with not a lot of bite. Gin can be substituted for the vodka.
drinks.name: Watermelon Crawl #2

drinks.instructions: Put in highball glass with ice and stir.
drinks.name: Kinda Tasty

drinks.comment: Made popular by the US Army Military Police stationed on Johnston Atoll in the Pacific Ocean.
drinks.name: Army Green

drinks.comment: We invented this drink after returning from our honeymoon in the Bahamas. We were trying to reproduce the tropical flavor of the drinks from the Caribbean.
drinks.name: Bye Bye Bahamas

drinks.comment: Goes down very easily, and gets to work immediately. Be careful with this one!
drinks.name: Red Hurricane

drinks.comment: This drink is named Betty Paige after the 50's pin-up model because the drink is as red as her lipstick. You can also experiment by adding more liqueur or by trying the drink sweet or dry.
drinks.name: Betty Paige

drinks.comment: If mixed properly, this drink is extremely smooth, with a hint of Cinnamon flavoring. I invented this drink about a year ago, in my second year of University, and have been making it for worthy recipients ever since.
drinks.name: The Big Robowski

drinks.comment: A sweet taste, but a hint of tart that sets it apart.
drinks.name: Slammin' Sammy

drinks.comment: Tastes great. White Russian used to be my favorite, but this one is so much better.
drinks.name: Pink Russian

drinks.comment: This is a great nightcap drink. It is often referred to as the Sleeping Pill.
drinks.name: Nagel Nectar

drinks.comment: Coffee taste with a smooth kick!
drinks.name: The Colombian

drinks.comment: Tastes like wintergreen. Very yummy.
drinks.name: Alpine Sprite

drinks.comment: Drink originated when a few of my friends through the alcoholic ingredients into my Dew, it was one of the first alcoholic drinks I had.
drinks.name: The Bartman

drinks.comment: Invented (kind of by accident) aboard the Noordaam during the Bad Boys II Cruise. Sure it's sweet but if you like Jack and blackberries you'll love this. Wusses can add 7-up to cut it back a little.
drinks.name: The Jumpin' Black Jack

drinks.comment: This drink was invented at the Atlantis Resort on Paradise Island, Nassau, Bahamas during the Bad Boys I Cruise. It's your basic (but good) Pina Colada but made with Tequila instead of Rum. Why? Because it was Tequila day when it was invented. It's a favorite with the ladies. Enjoy!
drinks.name: The Dangerous Dave

drinks.comment: If you use the clear strawberry schnapps add a dash of Grenadine. Great Drink for the Ladies!
drinks.name: Strawberry Stripper

drinks.comment: It tastes like grape kool-aid but with barely any taste of alcohol in it. I work as a bartender at a brewery and I was just messing around one day with different alcohol.
drinks.name: Grapes of Wrath

drinks.comment: Very smooth, great color (attracts dates!), and delightful orange flavor.
drinks.name: Blue Dragon

drinks.instructions: Pour gin and fill with orange juice, leaving room for the Campari. Stir a little bit. Add a slice of orange, then pour the Campari gently on the slice.
drinks.name: Meiner

drinks.instructions: Pour triple sec, cognac, and lemon juice over ice. Shake and strain. Pour into cocktail glass. Enjoy.
drinks.name: Voodoo Lady

drinks.comment: This drink dates back to the old party days after baseball practice. The traditional Rum and Coke became too boring and weak, so ordinary rum gave way to 151 rum. Then one night there was no more Coke, so we settled for Rock  Rye. We never bought Coke again. As you'll see, the taste is far superior and the product packs a punch.
drinks.name: Slugger's Delight

drinks.instructions: Pour vodka over ice in a collins glass. Add Sprite and top with lemon juice. Garnish with a lemon slice.
drinks.name: Gailwarning

drinks.comment: This drink is an adaptation that I learned from a friend in Tacoma, WA. This drink is superior to anything like it because of the fact that using the Absolut Kurant, which is a berry flavored vodka, doesn't kill the flavor of the raspberry taste like a straight vodka does. Also, even though you use Roses lime juice, do not omit the fresh lime. You will definately notice a difference in the taste because the lime juice has sugar in it and it mellows out the sour taste. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Chambord Kamikaze

drinks.comment: This James Bond's martini found in Ian Fleming's first 007 novel, "Casino Royale".
drinks.name: Vesper #2

drinks.instructions: Fill highball glass with ice, add Absolut Mandarin, then fill with Orange Crush or some other orange soda.
drinks.name: Mandarin Crush

drinks.comment: I named this shooter "Sabra" after the Israeli chocolate and orange flavored liqueur Sabra.
drinks.name: Sabra

drinks.comment: Perfect winter drink. The headmaster of a private school from the west Hollywood, California area taught me this drink at a christmas beach party in 1973. This one will warm you clear to your toes!
drinks.name: Scotch Toddy

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients in a blender until well stirred. Great in your favorite drink recipes or straight as a dessert. Drink contents within two weeks. Some ingredients are perishable. Store in an airtight container so you can shake it before each use. The chocolate settles at the bottom.
drinks.name: Irish Cream, Home Made #2

drinks.comment: Sweet, citrus taste remnisicent of eating a tangerine.
drinks.name: Crushed Orange

drinks.comment: This drink was created during a Monday Night Football game. It is named after one of my fraternity brothers, Squirrel.
drinks.name: Flying Squirrel

drinks.comment: Created at a Christmas party, this drink was named by Jeff "Hershey" Wright. The name was supposed to be a joke, but I decided to make a drink after it. It became a huge success at the party.
drinks.name: Flying Teetsie Fly

drinks.comment: An English-free version of the Black  Tan. Good for any true Irish boy or girl!
drinks.name: Half & Half

drinks.comment: Yummy stuff: basically just a slippery nipple with eggnog. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Slippery Eggs

drinks.comment: Approximation of a Rocher chocolate.
drinks.name: Liquid Rocher

drinks.instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender. Blend for 1 minute or until drink is smooth. Pour into glass and serve immediately.
drinks.name: Strawberry Dream

drinks.comment: A typical pina colada with the addition of orange juice for a fresh taste variation.
drinks.name: Florida Pina Colada

drinks.instructions: Pour liquor over ice, fill with eggnog, and stir.
drinks.name: Trogg's Nog

drinks.comment: Inveted Out Of Nescesity By The 3 J's In Rochester NY
drinks.name: Mojambo Punch

drinks.instructions: Add ingredients to shaker with cubed ice, stir till shaker frosts, strain into rocks glass.
drinks.name: B-69

drinks.comment: I was first introduced to this drink in its "unleaded" form while attending some 1997 holiday festivities. Brian Sinnott is an ex-fiance of Kristine Hunter, middle sister of Beth Hunter, who is my ex-wife. Anyway, his family created this tremendously wonderful "kool-aid" punch, and used it for all of their family occasions. Through careful scientific experimentation, I have created a wonderful and magnificent champagne-kool-aid punch to use for parties, New Year, Christmas, birthday celebrations, etc. Printed above are instructions for the "leaded" version of the drink. Be careful, it can pack quite a blow, especially if you add more vodka, as suggested. This is a sweet drink, so cheep Andre "pink" champagne or any other sparkling wine will do. I would recommend using a good brand of vodka, then potency adjustments are less noticeable. This is a wonderful tasting champagne punch, despite its Kool-Aid roots. One batch is probably good for a party of 5-10 people. Make two batches for medium parties of 10-20 people. (This also maximizes the fact that frozen juice usually comes in 12oz sizes anyway.)
drinks.name: Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Leaded

drinks.comment: I was first introduced to this drink in its "unleaded" form while attending some 1997 holiday festivities. Brian Sinnott is an ex-fiance of Kristine Hunter, middle sister of Beth Hunter, who is my ex-wife. Anyway, his family created this tremendously wonderful "kool-aid" punch, and used it for all of their family occasions. Through careful scientific experimentation, I have created a wonderful and magnificent champagne-kool-aid punch to use for parties, New Year, Christmas, birthday celebrations, etc. Printed above are instructions for the original "unleaded" version of the drink. I posted a "leaded" version of this drink on the Webtender that uses sparkling wine, vodka, and rum to make a champagne-cool-aid punch. This is a wonderful tasting punch, despite its Kool-Aid roots. I prefer its nice sweet, tangy, and bubbly taste to the more popular sherbet punches you find at parties. One batch is probably good for a party of 5-10 people. Make two batches for medium parties of 10-20 people. (This also maximizes the fact that frozen juice usually comes in 12oz sizes anyway.)
drinks.name: Brian Sinnott Family Punch - Unleaded

drinks.comment: This drink was created on New Years Eve of 2000, at the mixology department of the Vaughn Bay Bar and Grill. The Creators names are Ryan and Travis.. (Two students from Central Washington University..) Enjoy!!!
drinks.name: Vaughn Purple Haze

drinks.comment: This drink was created in the little town of Chelan, Washington. It is derived from a porn star because you will be ready for some action! Have fun!
drinks.name: Dirk Diggler

drinks.comment: Origin: Musikerlfte' p Studentersamfundet i Trondheim
drinks.name: Hakkespett

drinks.comment: Created by Jose Ruiseco. First place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
drinks.name: Conga Line

drinks.comment: Created by Jack Willard. Second place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
drinks.name: Orange Bomb

drinks.comment: Created by Virgil Tropea. Third place in the 1998 United States Bartender's Guild Cocktail Competition.
drinks.name: La Cafe

drinks.comment: Nazdravie! (cheers!)
drinks.name: Czech Collaborator

drinks.instructions: Stir gently with a swizzle stick before serving.
drinks.name: Strawberry Blonde

drinks.comment: This drink was introduced in Israel about a year and a 1/2 ago by the importer of the "Buttershots" caramel schnapps as a promotion measure. To me personal opinion the drink is excellent and all the people I made it for agreed.
drinks.name: Chill Out Shock (C.O.S)

drinks.instructions: Ppour vodka, melon and peach schnapps over ice. Top with the sprite, stir well, add 1 dash of the grenadine and serve. Garnish with a slice of lemon (or lime), or a piece of melon.
drinks.name: Red Melon

drinks.comment: I made this up one day at my brother's house when I was very drunk and I had tequila and juice. And now it is my drink of choice, probably one of the best drinks I have ever had. And my friend Anna helped me make up the name when I could'nt think of anything cool. So give it a try, I promise you will not be disappointed.

drinks.instructions: Put ice in glass, add peppermint schapps, fill with orange juice, stir, add cherry.

drinks.comment: Goes down smooth with a great aftertaste.

drinks.comment: The name comes from a once great Milwaukee Brewer baseball player (Jack Voigt). This is in honor of his wonderful one year spent in Milwaukee.

drinks.comment: Adjust the amount of tequila for your own tastes.

drinks.comment: I was trying to make a variant of the Mai Tai with orange juice, since no orgeat was at hand I decided to try with amaretto.

drinks.instructions: Add ice cubes, stir, and garnish with cheery.

drinks.comment: I love making this drink in the barn after a winter's horseback ride!
drinks.name: Irish Cup O' Joe
ingredients: 1 oz Chocolate syrup or to taste

drinks.comment: Made by myself and the lead singer of the band Dukes Nightmare on Sept. 15 1999.

drinks.comment: Nice and smooth, but not as smooth as Brad Sandidge, who came up with the drink!

drinks.comment: Tastes surprisingly sweet for a Tequila drink. Invented by Rob at my Cinco de Mayo party.

drinks.comment: Created by Mauricio. A very tropical drink for the ladies.

drinks.comment: Very hot and spicy. Will wake up your taste buds.
This drink is smooth, creamy and a great dessert drink.

drinks.instructions: Mix together over ice.

drinks.instructions: Pour Midori, rum, and pineapple juice into shaker with ice. Shake well. Strain into glass over ice. Pour in Sprite and stir lightly.

drinks.comment: Tastes alot better than it sounds. I came up with this out of nessesity. The wife likes Irish cream and brandy and I like Tequila so I put the Tequila in her Irish Cream to try it out,Yumm. While traveling I asked a Bartender for Irish Cream and Tequila on the rocks and he said,"you whant what!? what do you call that"? I said, "I don't know what do you think it should be called"? The Bartender replied "Irish Cactus" and thats what I have called this drink ever since.

drinks.comment: This shot can be made into a drink as well.
drinks.name: Hawaiian Volcano

drinks.instructions: Mix Absolut Mandrin with Passoa in a highball glass. Put ice in the glass and fill it up with orange juice
drinks.name: Nicolalas

drinks.instructions: Pour into a shot glass.

drinks.comment: It tastes kind of like a chocolate milk with a kick. It makes a good bedtime drink.
drinks.name: Winter Breeze

drinks.comment: This is for the May 1999 class of Texas Tech University. Don't use too much Amaretto- makes it taste pretty funky.

drinks.instructions: Shake lillet and cointreau with ice. Strain into cocktail glass. Add splash of vermouth for color.

drinks.comment: Created at the Westin Hotel, Providence RI, on Dec. 17, 1999
drinks.name: Nolan

drinks.comment: The Santa Fe is a variation on the Margarita for those who like a more bubbly and less sour taste. Cactus Juice is an even better substitute for the Tequila.

drinks.comment: This very tasty, and warms-you-from-the-inside-out adult beverage started with a request for Spiced Apple Rum at a holiday party. The bartender's interpretation of Captain Morgan's was Captain Morgan's 'Parrot Bay' vs. the spiced rum our favorite pirate is known for. We added the remaining ingredients anyway, and voila--a star is born.

drinks.comment: The appearance of the drink resembles that of when a child mixes watercolor paints in a glass. A couple of us were bored one night and just started mixing things together and this came into being.
drinks.name: Watercolour
ingredients: Fill with to taste Pineapple juice

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice and strain into glass.

drinks.instructions: Mix in a shaker with ice. Strain into a salt rimmed cocktail glass. Garnish: lime or lemon slice

drinks.instructions: Stir.

drinks.comment: Creme de menthe and Creme de cacao amounts may be vaired depending on taste.

drinks.instructions: Mix in a shot glass.

Not meant for the weak at heart. Enjoy. -- Credit for the drink belongs to a good friend of mine, and a fine bartender. Thanks Fabian.

drinks.comment: Great summer drink, very refreshing. It may be helpful to note that it tastes terrible with salt on the rim.

When properly made, it becomes a tall semi-layered drink that can be produced with minimal effort. I came up with this drink after a request the bar owner had to make a pretty drink that was simple and all our own.

drinks.comment: Very popular with the ladies. You let them have the cherry after your done. Maybe you might get a kiss for your efforts!!!

drinks.comment: Made by Ryan O'Reilly at his bar "Foggy Notion's" in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, Canada

Use hurricane or highball glasses. -- This drink was created on a hot night when a cool drink was needed. It really worked great. ThanX to An! (she bought the fruit).

drinks.comment: Born at UCSD (University of California in San Diego).
