drinks.comment: This drink is usually best with Bud Light. I created this drink because beer was just filling me up and wasn't getting me drunk.
drinks.name: Stiff Pounder

drinks.comment: All the way from Limerick Ireland. A cool drink!!!
drinks.name: Green Ferrit

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lime slice.
drinks.name: El Floridita

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Hemingway Daiquiri

drinks.instructions: Serve over ice cubes.
drinks.name: White Russian #2

drinks.instructions: Blend with crushed ice.
drinks.name: Blueberry Daiquiri

drinks.comment: Serves 2. May be served at tea time or at the end of a meal.
drinks.name: Masala Chai #2

drinks.comment: Makes 30 servings.
drinks.name: Fish House Punch

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon slice.
drinks.name: Frisco

drinks.instructions: Shake with crushed ice and strain into a chilled wine or cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist.
drinks.name: Maiden's Prayer #2

drinks.instructions: Shake liquor and milk with cracked ice and strain into a chilled highball glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top
drinks.name: Milk Punch

drinks.instructions: Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry or a slice of orange.
drinks.name: Petit Zinc

drinks.instructions: Stir Amer Picon, creme de cassis and lime juice with cracked ice and strain into a large chilled wine glass (should hold 16 ounces). Fill with soda water and garnish with a twist of lemon.
drinks.name: Picon Limon

drinks.comment: A new cocktail. One of my experiments.
drinks.name: Far East

drinks.comment: This is a drink in the same category as a 'Singapore Sling'. It's meant to be consumed quickly, preferably at home. I concocted the original Skinhead Paramedic of leftover ingredients from a party. It has a strong, charismatic taste and a profound kick. I drink it at room temperature but you may choose to add a little ice if you want.
drinks.name: Skinhead Paramedic

drinks.instructions: Stir with cracked ice ans strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a twist of orange.
drinks.name: The Drink Without a Name

drinks.comment: This drink was named after the Highlander tv show character. It has both major aspects of his origin (Scotland and Japan), and his way with women. It's delicious, and has a slight taste of iced tea.
drinks.name: Duncan MacLeod

drinks.comment: This drink is dedicated to Boku, the host of Tropic de Maitai, on 88.3 WAIF, in Cincinnati Ohio.
drinks.name: Boku's Blend

drinks.comment: Blavod is the new Black Vodka. Longbranch mix is a spicy Bloody mix and it makes a smooth dark Bloody on a Sunday morning.
drinks.name: Blackula

drinks.comment: The taste of this drink is sweet, very sweet, yet quite enjoyable. The color on the other hand is brown, somewhat the color of a rootbeer liquer. The history is all in the name, created by me and served on New Year's Eve 1999, also to toast in the New Year.
drinks.name: Y2K Shot #2

drinks.comment: My friend Amanda and I invented this one! It should be done as a body shot. One person lays on the ground/bed/table/etc. with the shot glass held in his/her mouth. The drinker "mounts" the holder and must take the shot without using her/his hands! It's a lot of fun, and a great icebreaker!
drinks.name: Lusty Lisa

drinks.comment: New Year's Eve milineum a group of us were up at Hunter Montain, New York. Remembering back to college days we wanted to make Russian Qualudes, only we did not have any Kaluha. We adjusted the proportions of the rest of the ingredients and came up with this delicious drink, the "Hunter Mountain". (Can also be used for shots.)
drinks.name: Hunter Mountain

drinks.comment: This drink should be served in three layers, Orange at the bottom, Red in the middle, and Black at the top. It was created in the memory of El Don, the best Bartender ever to grace the bar at Via Vita Didsbury.
drinks.name: Shag by the shore

drinks.instructions: Layer carefully using the back of a spoon. Grenadine first, then Kahlua and then Bailey's.
drinks.name: Chocolate Covered Cherries

drinks.comment: Either light or medium rum works well.
drinks.name: Pink n' Tart

drinks.comment: It was reported as being the drink favoured by the man who crashed Berings bank. According to the story he went to a bar at Clifford Pier in Singapore and drink it.
drinks.name: Bankers Doom

drinks.instructions: Stir the Amaretto with the Dr. Pepper. Pour over Ice cubes and add two Cherries. Enjoy.
drinks.name: The Spiff

drinks.comment: This is a very sweet but very good drink!
drinks.name: Seduction on the Rocks

drinks.comment: Probably the most popular mixed drink in Japan. The name "Chu-hai" comes from "sho-CHU" and "HIGH-ball glass"
drinks.name: Lime Chu-Hai

drinks.comment: Made up one night with Squid (Cory Thornton), Ossifer Chris Thorn and my brother Jamie Dixon in Peterborough, Ontario Canada.
drinks.name: A Dixon Thing

drinks.comment: I discovered this drink (and Blackhaus) on a recent trip to the east coast. Thank you, New York.
drinks.name: Crackhouse

drinks.comment: Credit to Jimmer. You won't even know what hit you.
drinks.name: Chambord Royale

drinks.instructions: Fill hurricane glass with ice. Add Vodka and apricot nectar to glass then fill with tonic. Stir.
drinks.name: Apricot Breeze

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients together in mixer, chill, then serve in shot glass
drinks.name: Schwimmer

drinks.comment: The lemon juice cancels out the taste of the vodka creating a citrusy taste sensation!
drinks.name: Splurge

drinks.instructions: Blend.
drinks.name: Big Booty Shake

drinks.comment: Sweet and best served chilled. Made at Quarters Club located in Huntsville, TX. By a Sam Houston State student.
drinks.name: Green Voodoo

drinks.comment: I've been spending a lot of time over the last month learning how and practicing at the art of Bartending. Last night while at a local bar I was looking over what they had on the back shelf and asked the Bartender to whip this up for me. It tastes a lot like a banana milkshake. I suggest heavy cream to help give it that milkshake feel, but half  half will work. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Banana Russian
ingredients: Fill with Half-and-half or heavy cream

drinks.comment: Named after the flower, "Bird of Paradise", because of its color.
drinks.name: Bird of Paradise

drinks.comment: Another U of Illinois original. Created by Kris and Nick. Should taste like a coconut-cream pie.
drinks.name: Coconut Pie

drinks.comment: Created in the winter of 1998. Co-created by Kevin, Kris, and Cody. Another Chambana classic.
drinks.name: Haus Special

drinks.comment: This does not work with any other combination brands of Vodka or Vermouth in my experience, but try your favorite brands if you like. Dreamed up by Jon E. C-Note., and kindly in served up as "the usual" by the friendly folks at Jillian's. A UofI Champaign staple.
drinks.name: The Usual

drinks.comment: Taste great. Made at the Chief Pettyofficers Club at Lemoore, Ca. and named after my friend Carlos Ortiz (GUAPO).
drinks.name: Guapo

drinks.comment: Variations: add 2 cinnamon sticks and 4 whole cloves.
drinks.name: Homemade Southern Comfort

drinks.instructions: Pour Mandarine Napoleon and gin. Fill with orange juice and add a touch of grenadine. Add ice cubes and garnish with a slice of lemon.
drinks.name: Mandarine Summertime

drinks.instructions: Pour Mandarine Napoleon and gin. Fill with passion fruit juice. Add ice cubes and garnish with a slice of lemon.
drinks.name: Mandarine Passion

drinks.instructions: Pour Mandarine Napoleon and fill with tonic. Add some ice cubes and garnish with orange peels.
drinks.name: Napotonic

drinks.instructions: Stir.
drinks.name: Mandarine Bourbon

drinks.instructions: Shake
drinks.name: Imperial Moka

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice.
drinks.name: Midori Green Russian

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain. Garnish with a slice of orange. Ice is optional.
drinks.name: Midori Sour

drinks.instructions: Pour Midori and sweetsour. Add champagne.
drinks.name: Midori Mimosa

drinks.instructions: Mix blue curacao with rum and ice. pour it into a glass and add the rest of the ingredients slowly. Granish with a pice of peach, a cherry and a piece of celery.
drinks.name: Delicias de la Habana

drinks.comment: Winner of the "Cheers International Food  Beverage Recipe Competition" in USA, 1993.
drinks.name: Crocodile Cooler

drinks.instructions: Mix vodka and Orancio, add Sprite and garnish with a slice of orange.
drinks.name: Orange Kiss

drinks.instructions: Mix with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a orange spiral.
drinks.name: Tropical Heat

drinks.instructions: Pour Orancio into a champagne flute and fill with Brut Champagne. Garnish with a slice of orange.
drinks.name: Orancio Royal

drinks.instructions: Layer in order.
drinks.name: Black and Blue

drinks.instructions: Mix and shoot straight away.
drinks.name: Asphalt Road

drinks.instructions: Build over ice in glass. Garnish with 3 cherries.
drinks.name: Ario Bomb

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice.
drinks.name: Dirty Mop

drinks.comment: In the original recipe, created around 1940 in Harry's Bar in Venice, white peaches and Italian sparkling wine, Prosecco, should be used. If you can find them use them, if not, regular peaches and champagne will do.
drinks.name: Bellini
ingredients: 1 medium ripe Peach, peeled and pureed
4-6 oz Italian dry Sparkling white wine or Champagne

drinks.instructions: Pour mango puree into glass and slowly add champagne. Stir gently. Garnish with a mango slice.
drinks.name: Bombay Bellini

drinks.comment: Found all over Negril Jamaica
drinks.name: Hummingbird #2

drinks.comment: I would like to thank Karen (you're the best) for the idea, and her knee for the name of the drink!
drinks.name: RumBubble

drinks.instructions: Fill highball glass with ice. Add liquor, juice, and then Sprite.
drinks.name: Tahitian Treat

drinks.comment: This drink comes from the bars of Tennessee St. at Florida State University. The way to slam it is easy. Everyone has seen the tomahawk chop, so you slam the shot and then you have to do the tomahawk chop right afterward. Use beer as a chaser, or water if you are from the University of Florida. GO NOLES!!!
drinks.name: The Seminole

drinks.comment: Since I don't like sour things - this is my version of it - only the sweet way. I drink this almost every night using Blanks non-alcoholic amaretto. It is very addicting!
drinks.name: Amaretto Stone Sweet

drinks.comment: Like a Tom Collins with Absolut Kurant instead of Gin. Very nice.
drinks.name: Kurant Collins

drinks.comment: Has a fairly bitter aftertaste (a la campari and tonic water), but very good. The kind of feeling you get when you have the bitter part of a citrus fruit .. I find it rather enjoyable.
drinks.name: Tampico

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients in shaker, chill, then serve in shot glass
drinks.name: Pink Ranger

drinks.comment: Tastes just like the After Eight shot, only weaker.
drinks.name: After Eighteen

drinks.comment: The taste is very tropical tasting and be careful you do not taste the alcohol but it's deffinatly there! A top shelf vodka is used so its a good drink to have without a bad hangover. (with a certain amount of moderation that is) A friend and myself accidentally made the drink and loved it. We are both from Maryland(I am a bartender)and we are bringing this to you where ever you may be! Enjoy!
drinks.name: Absolute Heaven

drinks.comment: Originated in Dave and Busters of Philadelphia.
drinks.name: Swervin Mervin

drinks.comment: This is a variant on the Flaming Soda, since we had no soda. It is probably sweeter than the Flaming Soda, but is still very good.
drinks.name: Flaming Ale

drinks.comment: Sweet drink -- ladies love it. Party Punch Originated in Corvallis, Oregon at the Royal Pacific Lounge. Has swept the state and is a popular drink at virtually every bar. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Wonder Woman

drinks.comment: The taste is very strong. It pretty much makes you shudder in your boots. My fellow drinkers and I thought of this drink one New Year's Eve, and have drank it ever since.
drinks.name: Montana Tornado

drinks.instructions: Layer ingredients in the exact order. Grenadine should sit on top for a little bit before sliding down the inside of the shot glass.
drinks.name: The Equator

drinks.comment: A very sweet drink with a funky colour.
drinks.name: Fluorescent Dream

drinks.comment: I made this for my friend, John. He's a hardcore kind of guy, so we call him Army John. He's the one who thought this up - he loves Southern Comfort. Its a strong drink, esp when you use 100 proof So Co. Enjoy
drinks.name: The Army John

drinks.comment: My best friend Sarah and I were bored one night and made this drink up, now we want everyone to enjoy it!
drinks.name: Tropical Lullaby

drinks.comment: A surprisingly good shooter. Sweet and smooth at first taste with a spicy finish. Give it a try.
drinks.name: Kentucky Hot Tub

drinks.comment: Taste: A great hot aftertaste. Origin:Universal Girls "Brisbane, Australia"
drinks.name: Hot Scott

drinks.comment: It is just like a watermelon Jolly Rancher. Kind of a girlie drink. But I admire the men who drink it. *wink, wink*
drinks.name: Pink Fizzy

drinks.comment: I found this recipe in a magazine - Cosmo, I think. I've ordered it at bars a few times and noone had ever heard of it. If mixed properly, (sometimes you have to play with the mix depending on the amaretto you use) you get a smooth textured coco/pinapple thing happening that's very tropoical, and not overly sweet.
drinks.name: Italian Surfer

drinks.comment: The drink was originally mixed at Club Dacke (Uppsala, Sweden) in the summer of -99, for a guest named Sara Karlhed. She asked for something refreshing, not too sweet, and this is what I came up with. She and her friends came back several times that night, always asking for the same drink.
drinks.name: Hybris

drinks.comment: Very sweet, good for after dinner as a dessert.
drinks.name: Nutty Belgian

drinks.comment: Godet is very sweet, so if you want it sweeter, use more Godet and less Creme de Cacao. If want it less sweet, use less Godet and more Creme de Cacao.
drinks.name: Double Chocolate

drinks.comment: It's a great date drink!
drinks.name: Arctic Kiss

drinks.comment: Becarefull, and have fun
drinks.name: Long Beach

drinks.comment: I experimented with traditional Cosmopolitans and Kamakazes and came up with this combo by accident, since then it's caught on like fire at the Westin Seattle Lobby Bar ! :)
drinks.name: French Cosmopolitan

drinks.comment: It looks like shit in a glass, but you won't care once you drink it!
drinks.name: Jager Vacation

drinks.comment: I would also suggest that you use the cheap white wine- the boxed stuff. This makes it a bit more authentic and keeps it in the College Student style. If done correctly, one should not taste the vodka and it should be quite smooth. This drink was originated at Maine Martime Academy and is a favorite of the school's sailing team.
drinks.name: Four Twenty

drinks.instructions: Pour gin and ginger ale over ice in a collins glass. Add chocolate syrup and let settle in the bottom. Stir very lightly. Drink should appear dark brown on the bottom and gradate to clear on top.
drinks.name: Mudskipper

drinks.comment: This drink has a slight bubble gum flavor, yet has a little kick. I discovered this drink just by playing with some leftover alcohol I had in my bar.
drinks.name: Liquid Bubble Gum

drinks.comment: A favorite at The Tavern in Albany, NY.
drinks.name: Pumpkin pie (tavern style)

drinks.comment: Variation: "Irish Seaman" - substitute Bailey's Irish Cream for Irish Mist. -- Origin: Plymouth State College, Plymouth, NH
drinks.name: Irish Pirate

drinks.instructions: Use a large shot glass. Remove stem from cherry and drop in glass. Pour in Southern Comfort and Goldschlager. Carefully float in a splash of 151 Rum. With a cigarette lighter ignite 151 Rum on fire and serve. Put out fire before drinking.
drinks.name: Southern Bound Meteor

drinks.comment: Great drink for Saint Patrick's Day. You can find Mint Green Maraschino Cherries at most supermarkets in the canned fruit section.
drinks.name: A Little Green Man From Mars
ingredients: 1 mint green Maraschino cherry without stem

drinks.comment: Note: When you pour in the Ouzo on top of the ice cube it will turn white.
drinks.name: Buried Under An Avalanche

drinks.comment: This drink was invented by four law students at the University of New Brunswick. The name 'Equity's Darling' is a term used in Property Law. The drink is very, very smooth and goes down far too easily! You can hardly taste the Creme de Banane but it provides a nice subtle background.
drinks.name: Equity's Darling

drinks.comment: It tastes exactly like a candy apple, don't ask me how...but you have to try this.
drinks.name: Sweet Candy Apple

drinks.comment: I was bored serving Passoa always the same way  started experimenting on new ways to serve it. Dedicated to Koen.
drinks.name: The Admiral's Passion

drinks.instructions: Gently shake ingredients with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Black and Blue #2

drinks.comment: It started as a drunken joke, then it spread like drunken wildfire.
drinks.name: Warsaw Waffle

drinks.comment: E-mail and let me know what you think.
drinks.name: Liquid Snickers

drinks.comment: Created under stressful working conditions in a bar frequented by students.
drinks.name: Straight Jacket

drinks.instructions: Pour Red Bull into a Collins Glass. Pour a shot of Jgermeister into a shot glass. When ready to drink, drop the shot into the collins glass and drink.
drinks.name: Up all night

drinks.instructions: In a shaker mix all ingredients. Pour over ice.
drinks.name: Devil's Advocate

drinks.comment: This is a great alternative to the regular Long Island Ice Tea. The first time I tried the drink was in the Century Club in Los Angeles, Ca. I hope you find it as delightful as my friends and I do.
drinks.name: Raspberry Long Island Ice Tea

drinks.instructions: Pour all and mix well.
drinks.name: Sneaky Wesley

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients into an old-fashioned glass over ice and serve.
drinks.name: Butter Nut Scotch

drinks.instructions: In a shaker half-filled with ice cubes, combine all of the ingredients except the Grenadine. Shake well. Strain into an old-fashioned glass. Add ice if you like. Drop the Grenadine into the center and serve.
drinks.name: Scottalian

drinks.instructions: Takes a 2 oz shot glass. First put in the triple sec, then tequila, last the spiced rum.
drinks.name: Tirade

drinks.comment: A wonderful mild cocktail!
drinks.name: Pineapple Cocktail

drinks.comment: This one's been around for ages, very popular with girls' nights out. -- VARIATIONS: add 1 shot of vodka (Leg opening fluffy duck) Some bars use icecream also (I've never tried it) (I've seen this drink served in a giant glass with a rubber duck floating on top!)
drinks.name: Fluffy Duck

drinks.comment: Better with dark Creme de Cacao, but you can use the light stuff, too. Very sweet, good for after dinner.
drinks.name: Monk's Butt

drinks.instructions: Mix over ice. garnish with a slice of orange.
drinks.name: Johnny on the beach

drinks.comment: This drink originates from Anthony's Key Resort on Roatan, Honduras, C.A. I went there on my vacation in the spring of 1999 and lived on these.
drinks.name: Monkey La La

drinks.instructions: Mix vodka, triple sec, and sour mix in shaker with ice. Strain into chilled glass. Add a dash of grenadine to the top and swirl slightly. Optional garnish of cherry and orange slice.
drinks.name: Russian Sunset

drinks.instructions: Place all ingredients, except grated chocolate, in a blender and blend until smooth. Pour into glass and sprinkle with grated chocolate
drinks.name: Ultimate Mudslide

drinks.instructions: Pour the vodka and grapefruit juice into a glass with ice. Add grenadine and stir.
drinks.name: Fire Fly

drinks.comment: A really tropical taste created by the bartender at The Fontana Elks Lodge, Rialto, CA. Come join us! Tell him you saw it on Webtender and the first one is free!!!
drinks.name: Monkey in a tree

drinks.comment: Called "Event Horizon" because all the chocolate sinks to the bottom of the glass.
drinks.name: The Event Horizon

drinks.comment: Best to tell a woman, when she says "what" say "okay it's really 8." The best response I've heard from women is "what does it taste like?"
drinks.name: My Johnson is Ten Inches Long

drinks.comment: This drink looks like sewage(especially with the peel floating on top) but tastes like a normal screwdriver. We discovered it on new years.
drinks.name: Sloughdriver

drinks.instructions: Pour vodka, tequila and orange juioce. Finally, add a dash of grenadine.
drinks.name: Whiting Sunset

drinks.comment: Sip and breathe deeply. Created by Joe Baur for KYL.
drinks.name: Breath Stealer

drinks.comment: To create a drink that smacked of skinny, strung-out Britpunks, we came up with this. The poppy seeds are tribute to his heroin habit (poppy seeds cause blood tests for heroin and opium to be positive).
drinks.name: Sid Vicious

drinks.instructions: Give one good shake, add lemon slice and cherry, and serve over ice.
drinks.name: Roxy Special

drinks.comment: Created at Miami University Ohio
drinks.name: Orange Crisis

drinks.instructions: Make hot chocolate, add Bailey's and ground cinnimon. Float whipped cream on top.
drinks.name: White Ape

drinks.comment: A "loose" Nordic interpretation of the "Screaming Viking" from 'Cheers'. The rather potent ingredients tend to cancel each other out, making for an easy to drink concoction that packs quite a punch. (Kind of tastes like Minty Scope) Born in a small pub in New Jersey.
drinks.name: Screaming Blue Viking

drinks.instructions: Drink this just like a shot of tequila. Mix the cognac and cointreau together in the shot glass. Lick between your thumb and forefinger and sprinkle sugar on it. Then lick the sugar, drink the shot, and suck on the lemon wedge when you're done.
drinks.name: S.O.B.

drinks.comment: Color should be a nice turquoise or very light green, taste should be smooth, a bit fruity, yet not harsh. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Blister

drinks.comment: I was bored at work one night behind the bar and some friends and I made it up, it tastes kinda fruity really sweet. We created it about four years ago and it is very popular in Richmond, VA.
drinks.name: Under Current

drinks.comment: Smooth, sweet, and springtime. Developed on the first day of spring.
drinks.name: Vernal Equinox

drinks.comment: Developed at the end of summer to be enjoyed as the days grow shorter.
drinks.name: Autumnal Equinox

drinks.comment: I like to shake it to get that right Green color. The fresher the O.J. the better. -- First had this at the Irish Pub in Frankfurt, Germany. They were served in excess on Saint Patty's day.
drinks.name: Shamrock Juice

drinks.comment: Let it slip down and wait for the world to go fuzzy. Best served on a balmy night with lots of ice.
drinks.name: The Emily Weir

drinks.comment: The name of this drink is dedicated to my girlfriend Johanna. It was to her I made this drink the first time.
drinks.name: Johanna

drinks.comment: This drink originated at the Crystal Cocktail Lounge in Montreal courtesy of its star bartender Sabino and thanks to the help of an inside source... Thanks again Amy.
drinks.name: The Sabino Special

drinks.comment: This drink was pulled out of my ass when I didn't have anything to do.
drinks.name: Gingervitas

drinks.instructions: Pour Barenjaeger in a shot glass and top with Godiva.
drinks.name: Chocolate Honeybee

drinks.comment: WARNING: This drink goes down really easy and leaves you wanting for more - just remember that it is potent (because you can't tell by the taste!) ENJOY!
drinks.name: Vanilla Creamsicle

drinks.comment: Smooth, charming taste! Especially for the ladies.
drinks.name: Simple Charm

drinks.comment: This drink is very tropical. It comes from the TGIfridays franchise.
drinks.name: Island Jack

drinks.comment: Tastes like Kindergarten Kool Aid with a little kick, but be careful. -- Created by Mr. Day-Man at my bar in El Paso, Texas.
drinks.name: Green Creeper

drinks.comment: This is a very easy drink to make, just like the normal screwdriver, except with Tequila. Enjoy.
drinks.name: Tequila Screwdriver

drinks.comment: Created by bar staff at Houlighan's, Troy, MI.
drinks.name: A Little Dinghy

drinks.comment: A beautiful cocktail to drink during the summer vacancions.
drinks.name: Alex Chi-Chi

drinks.comment: It is a sweet drink that is originally from Acapulco, actually from a club with that name. I recomend it frozzen. Caution: As you drink and enjoy the mix, you would probably start thinking in how this thing would get me drunk, but trust me, be carefull cause suddenly you are going to start asking wath hit you. If you would like more receipes from acapulco clubs, just ask me, and I would gladly send them to you.
drinks.name: Alebrije

drinks.comment: This drink was created by my friends after the movie Twister, it has great and fresh taste speacially for the summer at the beach were we actually created. This drink was made proudly at Acapulco and has got more that a drunk out of it.
drinks.name: Acapulco Twister

drinks.comment: This mix was created by me in Acapulco.
drinks.name: Acapulcos malibu

drinks.comment: This is also excellent mixed in blender with ice and served frozen. Very smooth and very potent. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Cheshire Cat

drinks.comment: Best drink of the upcoming millenium. Will be featured at Clint n' Josh's at Grand Opening. Originated with the GLP of Lake George!
drinks.name: Lake George Iced Tea

drinks.comment: If ice flecks are desired, add ice and use fresh, not frozen, bananas. -- For best handling and taste, first peel and slice the bananas. Put them in an uncovered plastic bowl to freeze. Allow frost to form on them. -- I use vanilla ice cream for this drink. But I think it would also be good with almond ice cream. -- This is a great drink for banana lovers. The butterscotch gives it a nice sweet flavoring without overpowering the bananas. As far as I know, this is an original drink. I got the idea one day because I was making a banana shake and trying to get rid of some left over butterscotch instant pudding. So, I added the pudding to the shake, and it was wonderful. Then, I started experimenting and came up with this. I was not sure what to name the drink. I decided on Aggie Banana because I'm a student at Texas AM University, and if it weren't for me being an Aggie, I would have never thought of this. WHOOP!
drinks.name: Aggie Banana

drinks.comment: Drink the fuck up, get fucked up, and break the ball of Fun. (BSU)
drinks.name: Ball Of Fun

drinks.instructions: Shake all on Ice and strain into a Highballs Glass.
drinks.name: Yuppidoo

drinks.instructions: Shake all on Ice and strain into a Cocktail Glass. Serve on the rocks
drinks.name: Dea Lea

drinks.comment: A Jamaican drink. Cheers.
drinks.name: Hummingbird

drinks.instructions: Layer in a shot glass. First Kahlua, then white creme de cacao, and finally Baja Rosa Tequila.
drinks.name: Freddie's Naughty Neopolitan
ingredients: 1/3 oz Tequila Rose (or Baja Rosa Tequila)

drinks.instructions: Pour George Dickel over ice into a tall glass. Add Ginger Ale, and stir.
drinks.name: George & Ginger

drinks.instructions: Take a Highball glass, pour in the Poire au Cognac. Add Sprite. Put in some ice if you want.
drinks.name: Poire Fantastic

drinks.comment: Whipped cream can also be used, but won't give the great sensation of drinking hot coffee through the cold layer of cream.
drinks.name: Irish Coffee

drinks.comment: The perfect beddy-bye time drink!
drinks.name: Sweet Dreams

drinks.comment: Made by a former bartender at a place called Landstrykeren in Bod. -- ("Nord-Norsk Depresjon" = "North-Norwegian Depression")
drinks.name: Nord-Norsk Depresjon

drinks.comment: I prefer a dry or extra dry type of champagne to add a bit of sweetness to this fine after diner treat.
drinks.name: Royal Bill

drinks.comment: As strange as it sounds, it's good. Invented by a group of us partiers in the mountians in colorado. Summit County suicide was invented to get you really drunk, without making you sick, or making you gag.
drinks.name: Summit County Suicide

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with crushed ice. Add batida de coco and then slowly add the Passoa. Now add the grenadine slowly, so is goes under the batida. You should get three layers: red, white, red. ok? Serve orange juice, but let the customer mix it, because the colors will mix.
drinks.name: Love Game

drinks.comment: This drink is best done to taste. If you prefer cranberry juice go heavier on that, and the same with the pineapple juice. The liqueur should be approximately half the amount of the smallest quantity of juice you put in.
drinks.name: Southwest Cooler

drinks.comment: Makes one huge shot or several smaller ones.
drinks.name: Romulan Ale #3

drinks.comment: After dinner cocktail.
drinks.name: Pink Pitch

drinks.comment: You can skipp the licor 43 if you like. Take some vanilla-licor insted. Drink invented by a nurse.
drinks.name: Nurse

drinks.comment: Tastes best when mixed/shot with ZZ Top's Pearl Necklace played at full volume. Swallow, don't spit.
drinks.name: Pearl Necklace #2

drinks.instructions: RedRum can either be mixed with the cider, or floated on top. Serve cold.
drinks.name: Red Horn

drinks.instructions: fill glass with ice add ingredients then shake
drinks.name: Magic Punch

drinks.instructions: Pour the vodka into the glass first, then pour the Red Bull slowly into it. Add ice.
drinks.name: Flageln

drinks.comment: Not many liqueur based drinks out there that use pear or banana liqueur. This one is fun, light, and quite refreshing!

drinks.comment: You can use Mountain Dew if you want.
drinks.name: The Lindy

drinks.comment: From Nicks Bar  Grill in Greenville, PA
drinks.name: Cherry Bomber

drinks.comment: This is a very popular drink and people always want more.
drinks.name: Chocolate Orgasm

drinks.instructions: Mix in order listed. The blue splash at the end makes the drink aquamarine colored, which is lovely.
drinks.name: Glitch

drinks.instructions: Mix in highball glass. Ice is optional.
drinks.name: Jaguar

drinks.comment: This is a drink for those who like it strong.
drinks.name: Suburban Warhead

drinks.comment: Vanilla vodka is my personal favorite, but any flavored vodka will work.
drinks.name: Italian Soda

drinks.comment: Taught to me by my Mexican ex-roommate,during siesta one lazy summer morning.Best cure for a hangover
drinks.name: Tijuana Carbomb

drinks.comment: Credit to us bartenders at "Goocci's" in SC!
drinks.name: Screaming Chocolate Monkey

drinks.comment: This is only for tequila lovers! Though it sounds ok, it is really strong. Not a personal favorite, but must give credit to the flag BEARer at Cal for this one.
drinks.name: Cloudy Day

drinks.instructions: Put all ingredients into blender, blend until smooth.
drinks.name: Sexy Blue Eyed Boy

drinks.instructions: Mix all. Serve cold.
drinks.name: Batman

drinks.comment: Swing it Brother!
drinks.name: Big Bad Voodoo Kooler

drinks.comment: This a light cocktail with a smooth orange taste and an eye-catching blue hue.
drinks.name: Blue Whip

drinks.comment: One night a friend tray to teach to the bartender a new shot, the bartender pick up the drink and remaker. The story don't finish, because of that o must came to Amnsia Cfe in Vila Franca de Xira, Portugal
drinks.name: Oasis

drinks.comment: Far too drinkable. Originally from a party at ChezBOFH in Cambridge (UK).
drinks.name: Cranberry Tart

drinks.comment: Don't be afriad to let it linger in your mouth before you swallow, especially if you have used quality ingredients. It sounds like a brutally simple shot, but can really have an eloquent flavor if done properly. Also, as you might have guessed, this drink is *very* strong, so be careful!
drinks.name: Double Brit

drinks.comment: Less bitter that Kansas City Ice Water with lime juice. Best made with Stoli raspberry flavored vodka. Once again, a true Penn State original.
drinks.name: Kansas City Ice Water #2

drinks.comment: A unique tasting drink, that traditionally men have enjoyed more then the women.
drinks.name: Dr. Dye's Revenge

drinks.instructions: Take a large glass and fill with ice. Add 1 part George Dickel Tennessee Whiskey to 2 parts of Mountain Dew.
drinks.name: Dickel & Dew

drinks.comment: Recipe borrowed from "Ocean Boulevard" restaurant in Kitty Hawk, NC.
drinks.name: South Beach Martini

drinks.comment: It has a nice taste - In New Orleans, it was primarily a Bartender's drink - Not too sweet, not too tart, and the effects of Tequila!
drinks.name: Prickly Pear

drinks.comment: Very potent! Learned the recipe at a Polynesian place in Chicago. Drink the Headhunter thru a straw, and soon you will be speaking Pidgin English like a native of Samoa.
drinks.name: Headhunter

drinks.instructions: Stir gently. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
drinks.name: Madonna

drinks.comment: Finalist in the 1992 Mandarine Napolean Cocktail Competition.
drinks.name: Tangerine Dream

drinks.comment: Invented in Alaska on a small wallet and a cold winter night.
drinks.name: Evil Corona

drinks.comment: Tastes great, and it will mess you up.
drinks.name: From Russia with Love

drinks.comment: This drink was created by James Bond in the 1953 book "Casino Royale" by Ian Fleming. It is named for his femme fatale - Vesper Lynd - and Bond remarked: "I never have more than one drink before dinner. But I do like that one to be large and very strong and very cold and very well-made. I hate small portions of anything, particularly when they taste bad."
drinks.name: Vesper

drinks.comment: Sweet but light summer drink for a day at the beach
drinks.name: Beach Sunday

drinks.comment: I just bought the Malibu and I wanted to make something interesting with it so I did. I came out a KILLER drink, everyone that tried it said it's amazing, and one of the best drinks he every tasted. Just try it and you'll fall in love with it!
drinks.name: Caribbean Milk

drinks.instructions: Pour 43 in shot glass. Layer cream slowly on top so that it resembles the 'head' on a beer.
drinks.name: Little Beer

drinks.comment: Similar to an Absolut Sex, though a friend of mine heavily into martial arts is only allwed clear liquors. This is different because of the raspberry flavor and not too sweet, not too sour, very palitable mix.
drinks.name: Raspberry Sex

drinks.comment: Strawberry vodka can also be used.
drinks.name: Sweet Summer

drinks.comment: Usally two of these will get you pretty fuzzy so Be Careful! I got the name idea from my ex-husband who is pagan, when he first tried it he said "Oh Godess thats Good!" so the name goddess stuck and I hope there are one's that will agree.
drinks.name: Ginny's Slammin' Goddess
ingredients: And 1 part Ruby red Grapefruit juice

drinks.comment: Be Really Carefull with this one!
drinks.name: Ginny's Slammin' Goddess #2
ingredients: And 1 part ruby red Grapefruit juice

drinks.comment: This drinks name can change determined on what the country of orgin your beer is from (i.e. Jamaican Hillbilly if you use Red Strip or German Hillbilly if you use Becks). I know this sounds exactly like a Boilermaker but look how much more fun it can be if you make it a global drinking game. The first time I did this was in 1991, Holland Hillbilly (Heinekin and Jack Daniels), at a bar in Naples, Italy.
drinks.name: Mexican Hillbilly

drinks.comment: I made this drink up myself after hearing about chocolate Martini's and trying the new stoli razberi.
drinks.name: Chocolate Raspberry Martini

drinks.comment: Only place I've had this is South Shore Yacht Club in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
drinks.name: Hairy Jerry

drinks.comment: Redrum works the best in this drink, but for those who don't like it's tropical taste, regular light rum such as Bacardi may be used.
drinks.name: Blue Marlin
ingredients: Fill with 1 part Sweet and sour

drinks.comment: Sounds bad, taste great
drinks.name: Pimp

drinks.comment: Has an incredibly smooth "smoky" taste, hence the name. Substitutes for single malt and Absolut not recommended (I've tried)
drinks.name: Smoked Martini

drinks.comment: This drink's home is at Jillians Entertainment Complex in Albany New York and was invented by Richard Gerard. It has been published in bartender magazine. We serve on the average 50-60 of these on a friday night.
drinks.name: The Vibrator

drinks.comment: I am always looking for a new drink. I tried a vodka tonic for the first time last week and wondered what it would be like with a little more flavor. I experimented with different types of flavored vodka and liked this one the best!
drinks.name: Mandarin Delight

drinks.comment: We were looking to make something out of raspberry vodka, and this was our creation. Real smooth but watch out!
drinks.name: Becky's Bomber

drinks.instructions: Shake alcohol, then add sprite on top. Served on the rocks.
drinks.name: Adios Motherfucker #3

drinks.comment: Origin: The Green Parrot, Casselberry, FL
drinks.name: Jungle Juice #3

drinks.comment: From a Detroit-area restaurant/bar no longer in business (burned down).
drinks.name: Papaya Driver

drinks.instructions: Start with the ice cubes. Pour rum and orange juice. Carefully add blue curacao, making sure it falls to the bottom. Layer pineapple vodka on top.
drinks.name: Jamaican Green Sunrise

drinks.instructions: Poor liqour equally into a shot glass. Give it a quick swirl and top with a cherry.
drinks.name: On My Ass

drinks.comment: This is a very tasty drink invented by the crew at Maloney's Tavern in Tucson, AZ.
drinks.name: Stoli Around the World

drinks.comment: Tired of the same old white Russian? Give his wife a try. This is definitely a "girly" drink.
drinks.name: Raspberry Russian

drinks.comment: Danish-American, from immigrants in Nebraska
drinks.name: Liquid Sex

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain.
drinks.name: Nightboat to Brasil

drinks.comment: A friend named Raine thought me how to make this, Once I tasted it I got stuck and now I allways drink it.
drinks.name: Jens Special

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and pour into tumbler with crushed ice.
drinks.name: Nightboat to Recife

drinks.instructions: Pour rum over ice. Fill with 7-Up. Stir. Garnish with cherries.
drinks.name: Walk the Plank

drinks.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Orange Lion

drinks.comment: This is a favorite in Key West.
drinks.name: Key Lime Shooter
ingredients: 1/4 oz Rose's sweetened lime juice (or Nellie  Joe's)

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain, or or build over ice in a pint glass.
drinks.name: Otter Pop #2

drinks.comment: People who don't like vodka love this drink because the white grape juice covers the unpleasantness of Vodka. -- Origin: As you may know, The Mormon religion forbids consumption of alcohol (along with many other things). So, in order to compensate for this fact, my Mormom friends serve the best punch anybody at their parties has ever tasted. I once asked for the ingredients to this nectar and they gladly gave them to me. A year and a half later lapsed in which time I completely forgot about the punch. However, I instantly recalled the mix at college when I saw the ingredients in my fridge. I made some of the punch right away and, remembering that alcohol makes anything better, added various liquors and spirits to the punch until I found the perfect compliment to surprise Mormons worldwide: vodka.
drinks.name: The Mormon Surprise

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients in a shaker with 1 skoop of ice then pour into highball glass
drinks.name: Colorado Coolaid

drinks.comment: Godet is a really rich and sweet liqueur so you probably won't want to drink more than one of these. Try Godet on ice instead of dessert!
drinks.name: Cherry Godet

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients except the 7-Up into a chilled glass filled with ice cubes. Top with 7-Up and stir gently.
drinks.name: Adios Motherfucker (A.M.F.)

drinks.comment: Smooth strawberry and nutty flavors, made first in November 1999, Coco's in Covington Kentucky
drinks.name: Strawberry Dream #2

drinks.comment: This is an Norwegian recipe, so you are free to increase the amount of vodka. The name came from a girl that ment my blue eyes matched the drink. Hehe.. - Typical female drink -
drinks.name: Blue Eye

drinks.comment: Its a sweet, but yet refreshing taste. This drink was invented by April O'Connor, Ryan Cassidy and Brad Blosat at a Country Club in CT.
drinks.name: S2C3

drinks.comment: Fresh taste. Summer drink.
drinks.name: Stoned
ingredients: 2 cl Pear liqueur (Xant Poire au Cognac)

drinks.comment: You may think it looks great without the grenadine, but that gives it the great color. If you can't handle the color leave out the grenadine. Tastes great and is less filling :-) Foo Foo drink to the hilt. Enjoy!!
drinks.name: Raw Sewage #2

drinks.comment: This was named after my friend Lyndy because as far as I can tell she invented it!
drinks.name: Lyndy

drinks.comment: This drink is the new sensation here, like Ricky Martin, it's spicy and a little fruity.
drinks.name: The Ricky Martini

drinks.comment: Back in the day, two bartenders at Philthy McNasty's in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada were sitting around the bar trying different alcohols, trying to find the best tasting shot with a real smooth taste and a great aftertaste that you can still taste after a few more drinks. After trying about 15 shots each they started getting sloppy and careless. One of them grabbed the three bottles and mixed them up. He shot it back and the look of pure joy appeared on his face. The other one tried it and this was the beginning of the tastiest shot I've ever had. They came up with this shot and I wanted to share this great shot with all of you.
drinks.name: BMW #2

drinks.comment: This wonderful drink was created by Angela the bartendar at the World Famous Townhouse in Los Angeles.
drinks.name: Tap that Ass

drinks.comment: Inspired by my favorite painting, Girafe En Feu by Salvadore Dali
drinks.name: Flaming Giraffe

drinks.comment: Amaretto will sink to the bottom to make an attractive drink. Do not garnish with a cherry, it will ruin the flavor.

drinks.comment: My invention of this smooth tasting drink originated at Vitoz Nightclub and Sports Bar in Rutland, VT.
drinks.name: Octapussy

drinks.instructions: Mix together in shaker, pour into glass over ice. Lime juice can be added to taste. Makes 2 drinks.

drinks.comment: Kind of like a Screwdriver

drinks.instructions: Mix ingredients in a shaker with ice. Pour into chilled cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Razzberi Kazi

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients together in ice filled glass. Shake and pour back into glass.
drinks.name: Stoli Fruit Cocktail

drinks.comment: Works great if you don't have any lime for your Corona.
drinks.name: Green Weenie

drinks.comment: This drink was created by my friends after the movie Twister, it has great and fresh taste speacially for the summer at the beach were we actually created. This drink was made proudly at Acapulco and has got more that a drunk out of it.
drinks.name: The Twister

drinks.comment: Started in 227 Kennedy.
drinks.name: James D

drinks.instructions: Mix Creme de Cacoa, Creme de Menthe, Midori, Kahlua and Ice into a shaker. Give a small shake, then add milk and shake well to foam up milk.

ingredients: 150 ml Milk or more to taste

drinks.instructions: Pour into shot glass. Stir.
drinks.name: Amenie Mama

drinks.comment: Mexican Clit brought to you by: Bill Drew Jeremy Tommy

drinks.instructions: Shake or mix the vodka, gin, and orange juice. Pour over ice. Add tonic water and lime juice, stir slightly.

ingredients: 1 oz Tonic water or club soda

drinks.instructions: Pour the Melon liqueur and the Blue curacao into a highball glass. Then add Sprite, and finally the ice cubes
drinks.name: Tropical Waters

drinks.comment: Conceived at Lake Manyara, Kenya. Named after a dorm room at the University of Washington, USA.
drinks.name: 915 Special

drinks.comment: This is a drink I was introduced to while I was in Japan on the island of Okinawa, in a bar called the Kiya Hut.
drinks.name: Midnight Oil

drinks.comment: A really good friuty rum drink that was made by accident, by my best friend and I.
drinks.name: Malibu Snapper

drinks.comment: Delicious and orange. The drink of the astronaut!
drinks.name: Poontang

drinks.comment: Will knock you on your ass! And can also be set on fire and sucked through a straw.
drinks.name: Kryptonite

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Add Limon. Fill with Iced tea. Add lemon wedge.
drinks.name: BLT

drinks.comment: Tried this drink at Mardi Gras and it is one of the best drinks I've ever had.
drinks.name: Blue Monkey

drinks.comment: The most popular drink on Franklin Street! (Go Heels!)
drinks.name: Carolina Kamikaze

drinks.comment: You will taste a hint of peppermint at first, and then the peach kicks in. It's really smooth.

drinks.instructions: Shake one part o.j. and one part vodka together. Pour over ice and add one part Mountain Dew, then stir slightly.
drinks.name: Slap Your Mama

drinks.comment: I liked Grasshoppers and I also enjoy Aftershock so I mixed them to make a "Dead Grasshopper"
drinks.name: Dead Grasshopper

drinks.comment: Maybe this drink has another name to you, but if you ask for a melonball in Spain this is what you get.
drinks.name: Melonball (Spanish Style)

drinks.instructions: Combine ingredients into a snifter and serve neat, or add a small amount of ice if desired.
drinks.name: French Connection #2

drinks.comment: An excellent alternative to a mimosa!
drinks.name: Fizzy Fuzzy Navel

drinks.instructions: Pour grenadine into snifter and swirl around so it coats most of the glass surface. Dump out. Add gin.

drinks.instructions: Pour chambord into bottom of glass. Top with soda water. Do not stir. Serve with straw.
drinks.name: Italian Soda #2

drinks.instructions: Shake alcohols and juices. Add to glass with ice. Pour grenadine and ginger ale on top. Garnish with cherry and orange wheel.

drinks.instructions: Blend with crushed ice.
drinks.name: Cabana Club

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into shot glass.
drinks.name: Irish Hammer

drinks.comment: Came from a special history of Bourbon distilleries. -- Note: Use quality bourbon.
drinks.name: Fontainebleau Sidecar

drinks.comment: Excellant if you like Creamy drinks. Discovered it vacationing in Barbados (Caribbean)
drinks.name: Almond Cooler

drinks.comment: Developed at Pumpcon 99, in Philadelphia.
drinks.name: Blue Kamikaze

drinks.comment: First served in Dartmouth College.
drinks.name: Astroturf

drinks.comment: My friends and I came up with this drink on my birthday with the ingredients I already had in my house. This drink is very sweet and the vodka is virtually undetectable if mixed in the right proportions. So beware this one sneeks up on you hence the name. Best if consumed through a straw with lots of ice, or well chilled.
drinks.name: Sneeky Sucker

drinks.comment: When imbibing, drink shot, then chew on the mandarin oranges to act as a chaser.
drinks.name: Goldfish

drinks.comment: I discovered this cocktail in Belfast. The cranberry juice really sets off the tequila.
drinks.name: Mexican's Revenge

drinks.comment: Originally called Oriental Rug, but renamed because it tastes like gingerbread.
drinks.name: Gingersnap

drinks.instructions: Blend ingredients by shaking well.
drinks.name: Sex on Daytona Beach

drinks.comment: This drink is one created in the Royal Norwegian Cavalry and drunk mostly by officers at Setermoen in Troms. It's taste is quite good and the leaf adds a nice touch.
drinks.name: Fjellfinn

drinks.comment: Tastes Great! Was discovered at a party by accident.
drinks.name: Placenta

drinks.comment: Delightful cocktail at Pier 14 in Myrtle Beach, SC
drinks.name: Mandarin Dream

drinks.comment: Very interesting taste once you get past the color. Fans of fruity drinks will probably enjoy this one.
drinks.name: Sour Kiss

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice in a cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Afterburner #3

drinks.instructions: Shake, then add Orangina and ice cubes.
drinks.name: The Brett Schroeder

drinks.comment: I used to have a baby pet goat (her name was Daisy), and when I had to let her go I held a going away party and put a punch together. Goats milk was born.
drinks.name: Goats Milk

drinks.comment: The history and origin of this drink is from a group of creative UC Berkeley students trying to celebrate Marianne's birthday. We have dedicated this drink to her! It is both a refreshing and juicy uplifter, definitely an elegant party drink. Add cake and good music! The amount of champagne and fruit mix can be varied accordingly to personal taste.
drinks.name: Marianne

drinks.comment: I messed up trying to make another drink for my girlfriend, but she liked this one even better.
drinks.name: Matt's Tropical Punch

drinks.comment: The color of this drink reminds me of time spent on the coast of the Yucatan Peninsula. Add more sour mix if desired to offset the strong tequila taste if desired.
drinks.name: Coral Reef

drinks.comment: I was bored in english class so I invented this shot after trying it I had to add it.
drinks.name: Tampon String

drinks.comment: Named after my english teacher, who is responsible fo all of my contributions.
drinks.name: The Kruzewski

drinks.comment: Caution: This is a strong drink, believe your first sips. After the first few sips the cherry flavor will dominate and the taste of alcohol will essentially dissappear, hence the name.
drinks.name: The Cherry Magician

drinks.comment: This is a Jamaican drink that may also be found in some Jamaican restaurants in the US and UK. It tastes a lot like Chai Tea, but not as sweet. The malty bitterness of the Guinness is there, especially in the aftertaste, but it's softer than straight Guinness. If Sam Adams Cream Stout is used, there is almost no bitterness at all, and the drink seems sweeter.
drinks.name: Guinness Punch
ingredients: 1/2 cup sweetened Condensed milk (regular or skim)

drinks.comment: So named for it's appearance. Looks like White Zinfandel, but it's made of hard liquor.
drinks.name: Working Man's Zinfandel

drinks.comment: Newly-created in New York and appearing in Los Angeles hotspots
drinks.name: Caribbean Martini

drinks.comment: Favorite punch of Trinity College in Hartford, Connecticut. The name originates from the fact that when drunken everybody becomes stupider than a jackass!
drinks.name: Donkey Punch

drinks.instructions: Add ingredients in order. Pour the cream soda to make the whipped cream spurt.
drinks.name: Sweedish Blow Job

drinks.comment: This drink supposedly originated at The Daily Planet restaurant in Fresno , CA.
drinks.name: Waverunner

drinks.comment: Women enjoy the flavor of this drink. It does not have a strong alcohol taste. So Kick back, Relax and Enjoy!
drinks.name: Hawaiian Volcano #2

drinks.comment: The sweet of the Irish Cream mellows out the bite of the tequila. Or if you prefer, the bite of the tequila tones down the sweetness of the Irish cream. Either way, this definitely will wake up your mouth and make you feel warm inside. -- An alternate way of mixing this drink comes from its origin. One person has 1 oz of tequila in her/his mouth. The other person holds 1 oz of Irish Cream in her/his mouth mouth. Kiss and let the alcohols mix. Warning: this alternate way will produce more warm feelings than the method outlined above (and possibly a few regrets, lol).
drinks.name: No Regrets

drinks.comment: Similar to Sex on the beach, but should be a nice grassy green color, hence the name. You can adjust the curacao to get the right color. Nice summertime drink!
drinks.name: Sex on the Grass

drinks.comment: A College Adventure that ended in the creation of a drink being drank at UMBC.
drinks.name: Hurricane Laura

drinks.comment: This is submitted by Trisha Cornell.
drinks.name: The Cornell

drinks.comment: Invented in Canada.
drinks.name: Verno

drinks.comment: This cocktail was created in Buenos Aires, Argentina. My inspiration was listen the music of Erykah Badu her song Appletree.
drinks.name: Baduizm

drinks.comment: Created when a friend of mine poured some of his black russian into my glass of southern comfort. To our surprise, it was good.
drinks.name: Louie Louie

drinks.instructions: Mix half a beer with half of a cream soda.
drinks.name: Creme de Spooge

drinks.instructions: Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add liquor and pineapple juice. Shake and serve in glass. Top with champagne.

drinks.comment: Excellent for brunch!

drinks.comment: I did not invent this. A local restaurant created martinis named after the movie nominated for Academy Awards. It is very good.

drinks.comment: Originated at a Rocky Horror convention!
drinks.name: Cossak

drinks.instructions: Pour Absolut Kurant and fill with orange juice.
drinks.name: Peekaboo

drinks.instructions: Pour in glass and stir. Serve cold.
drinks.name: Spanish Fly

drinks.comment: Tastes good and is highly effective!
drinks.name: Under Kurant

drinks.instructions: Just mix over ice in the glass.
drinks.name: Mindfuck

drinks.comment: Add vodka for a Cranberry Toad, rum for a Cranberry Newt.
drinks.name: Cranberry Frog

drinks.instructions: Shake vigourously. Serve.
drinks.name: Cranberry Toad

drinks.instructions: Shake vigourously. Serve.
drinks.name: Cranberry Newt

drinks.comment: Fresh squeezed juice is far superior. This is like a greyhound made with tequila.
drinks.name: Chihuahua

drinks.comment: Also works great in large batches.
drinks.name: Red Death #3

drinks.instructions: In a whiskey glass with ice, add equal parts vodka and spiced rum, a splash of sour mix, then top off with orange juice.
drinks.name: Fury

drinks.instructions: Mix over ice.
drinks.name: Sour Pussy

drinks.instructions: Shake in shaker with ice. Pour the shots.
drinks.name: Blueberry Kami

drinks.comment: Invented on a whim, one of my many concotions. It was so good I had to name it after myself -- one little vanity.
drinks.name: Enchantress

drinks.comment: Another of my infamous concoctions.
drinks.name: Peach Harpoon

drinks.instructions: Shake well and pour over ice or "up" in a martini glass. Garnish with cherry.
drinks.name: Canadian Manhattan

drinks.comment: Has the taste of Nestles Strawberry milk. I've had many blurry nights drinking them! *laughing*
drinks.name: Pink Flamingo #2
ingredients: A few splashes Orange juice (to taste)

drinks.comment: Looks very interesting.
drinks.name: Formula 420

drinks.comment: A bit tart.
drinks.name: Seven Veils

drinks.comment: Enjoy your search for the Seven Cities of Gold!
drinks.name: Cibola

drinks.instructions: Pour in kahlua, then butterscotch schnapps. Layer Irish cream on top.

drinks.comment: Smooth, yummy, and sweet.
