drinks.instructions: Pour into chilled shot glass.
drinks.name: Cockteaser

drinks.comment: EKG? Erinn's Kahlua and Godiva. Enjoy!
drinks.name: EKG

drinks.comment: A drink for two people. Tastes like a chocolate milkshake. This particular Mind Eraser originated (as far as I can tell) in The Mansion, a nightclub in West Texas, and was served almost exclusively behind the bar. It was too good to share with the patrons.
drinks.name: Mansion Mind Eraser

drinks.comment: A drink I found in Spokane, WA. I have yet to find a bartender that has made one before, or a customer that didn't find them delicious.
drinks.name: Bat Bite

drinks.instructions: Stir. Garnish with a cherry.
drinks.name: Cherry Screwdriver

drinks.comment: A wondering mind created a delicious drink.
drinks.name: Sweet Pea

drinks.comment: This is a classic Mexican recipe for drinking Tequila. I don't remember where I learned it. I think it was a precursor to the modern Margarita. I didn't think Tequila  Grenadine would be a good combination, but the ingredients blend beautifully  this drink is outstanding!
drinks.name: Cinco de Mayo

drinks.comment: This drink is great for people who say, "I don't know what I want. Give me something sweet, but not TOO sweet. And strong. But not TOO strong." This drink is also deceptively strong.
drinks.name: Golden Cadillac with White-Walled Tires

drinks.comment: I discovered it in 1999 in Ljubljana, Slovenija.
drinks.name: Olive in an Olive

drinks.comment: This shot began as a Lotto 649 that turned out to taste great, who knew?
drinks.name: Kalabreeze

drinks.comment: This is the drink of a University of Virginia Cavalier.
drinks.name: Wa-Hoo-Wa

drinks.comment: I accidentally "discovered" this drink one summer when we were mixing Mint Juleps and we had a whole bunch of sugar syrup and bourbon, but ran out of mint. It's tangy and sweet, but you can modify the sweetnes by substituting club soda for ginger ale. Both add a nice bubbly character.
drinks.name: Glicktail
ingredients: 1 splash Ginger ale or club soda

drinks.comment: Pour out a mug and go park yourself in a snow bank in the north country. Developed by the cold souls of Clarkson University for those weeks where it never gets above -50. For the true effect add an umbrella.
drinks.name: Tropical Clarkson

drinks.comment: A drink from the Royal Swedish Mechanized Forces.
drinks.name: Grovspol

drinks.comment: Speaks for itself. Feels just like a cuddling with a warm woolly sheep by the fire. Thanks to Chris and Jared for helping with this one.
drinks.name: Warm Woolly Sheep

drinks.comment: Quite good. Originally found at Kierans Irish Pub in Minneapolis (http ://www.kierans.com/). Ingredient amounts are estimates.
drinks.name: An Irish Kiss

drinks.comment: Also makes a great frozen drink if ingredients are blended with ice. This drink is well worth the effort!
drinks.name: Fruit Basket

drinks.comment: You can also do The Hollywood as a shot for a real Hollywood Expierence.
drinks.name: The Hollywood

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain into ice filled highball glass. Garnish with a slice of lime.
drinks.name: Gold Record

drinks.comment: It doesn't taste alcoholic, just sweet and smooth.
drinks.name: Dixieland Tea

drinks.comment: You can add as much Hot Damn as you can stand. This is not a really strong shot but it is fun and unique. I was on a creative kick with Hot Damn 100 and this is the only one I could remember.
drinks.name: T-Bone's Cough Syrup

drinks.instructions: Measure Irish cream and Vodka into coffee mug. Add Hershey's chocolate syrup. Fill will coffee and top with Whipping cream.
drinks.name: Cafe Seattle

drinks.comment: This great shot was invented when we felt there were too many shots with uncommon ingredients. This has common ingredients and goes down smooth and quiet but when it hits your stomach a warm sensation may be felt.
drinks.name: F-69

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice.
drinks.name: Mr G

drinks.comment: This drink is reminiscent of a Chocolate Orange, with a nice smooth flavor to it. White Creme de Cacao makes for the best looking version of this drink.
drinks.name: Chocolate Orange

drinks.comment: It tastes just like chocolate cake -- soon you'll be telling all your friends about this amazing drink.
drinks.name: Chocolate Cake Shooter

drinks.comment: Invented by Charlie the Clam Bartender at Lobster Bob's "Clam Zone", 1000 North Collier blvd, Marco Island, FL 34145. 941-642-0777.
drinks.name: Long Kiss Goodnight Martini

drinks.comment: The best Bermuda Triangles are served up by Cheeks and Idamae at the Harmony Club in Paget, Bermuda.
drinks.name: Bermuda Triangle

drinks.comment: This is not too strong, and very fruity, women seem to love it for some reason. :) Good luck, and cheers!
drinks.name: Island Tide

drinks.comment: Tastes just like the cereal.
drinks.name: Fruity Pebble

drinks.comment: It might look like hell, but it tastes pretty good. This drink is a variation on a theme of a "Pain Killer" which comes from the British Virgin Islands.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Pusser

drinks.comment: Tastes like dreamy chocolate milk. Enjoy, pure heaven.
drinks.name: Godiva Chocolate Martini

drinks.comment: Very good, fruity drink. Never a complaint with this drink.
drinks.name: Georgia Pie

drinks.instructions: Combine vodka and hot damn in shot glass, stir and shoot.
drinks.name: Red Mosquito

drinks.comment: Origin: RU Moose Club
drinks.name: Flying Moose

drinks.instructions: Blend until slushy, pour  enjoy!
drinks.name: Italian Sunrise #2

drinks.instructions: Put ingredients in shaker, shake, pour over ice.
drinks.name: Mean Green Love Making Machine

drinks.comment: Complements of Kyle Brooks and Victor Lange. May 12, 2000 a reunion of lost buds.
drinks.name: Mountain Sunrise

drinks.comment: Variant on Vodka Sunrise
drinks.name: Cranberry Sunrise

drinks.comment: Variants: Cranberry Sunrise, Screwdriver
drinks.name: Vodka Sunrise

drinks.comment: It looks like the backwater in a dirty river, but it tastes great. Use high quality lemonade or fresh lemonade if available.
drinks.name: Bayou Backwater

drinks.comment: You may need more or less of the Rose's lime juice. I find it kind of bitter, and use less when I am making this drink.
drinks.name: Mandarin Metropolitan

drinks.comment: Created at "Bensons" a night club In Fort Wayne, Indiana
drinks.name: Mandarin Split

drinks.comment: In the never ending quest to find new ways to drink rum, this is one of my favorites to start hte night. Of course I always end up with the rum and coke in hand, this is too much work to make when you are drunk!
drinks.name: Deep South

drinks.comment: Created at "Country Connectin" in Fort Wayne, Indiana
drinks.name: Bull Rider

drinks.comment: I got this from Midori's Melon Liqueur Homepage... it is a good tasting, good looking drink. Women that I have served it to love it! (Ok, guys like it too!)
drinks.name: Midori 2000

drinks.comment: Great drink from Helsinki City nightlife!
drinks.name: Heartbreaker's Special

drinks.comment: Aaron attempted to make a White Russian one night, but in his drunken stupor he was unable to find any milk. Therefore he added ingredients haphazardly. Although he was unable to taste his creation due to his impaired senses, one Christopher Schrader was amazed by the sweet, smooth texture. Variants: Frozen Groader
drinks.name: Groader

drinks.instructions: Stir with a straw.
drinks.name: Wynonna's Strawberry Delight

drinks.instructions: Pour liquors over ice. Fill with pineapple. Add grenadine to color. Shake. Garnish with pineapple flag.
drinks.name: Almond Joy Dark

drinks.comment: Serve with a Southern Accent.
drinks.name: Knoxville Lemonade

drinks.comment: For a stronger drink, can replace the apple juice with 1 oz of apple liqueur and add 1 oz of white rhum.
drinks.name: Peach May Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice and stir.
drinks.name: Pink Cotton Candy

drinks.instructions: Shake or roll. Garnish with an orange slice.
drinks.name: California Iced Tea

drinks.comment: The cointreau and ice should create a cloudy effect (precipitates) with the bubbles in the lemonade and rise to the top of the glass... blue skies!!
drinks.name: Blue Skies

drinks.comment: Swish around in mouth several times before swallowing.
drinks.name: Mexican stand-off

drinks.comment: This is a very sweet drink that goes down easy. Be careful or your flight may just crash!
drinks.name: Midnight Flight to Malibu

drinks.instructions: Fill highball glass with ice and combine ingredients, stir and enjoy.
drinks.name: Sweet Satisfaction

drinks.instructions: Starting by the gin and the blue curacao and finishing by the soda, mix directly into a collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a long lemon twist, a cherry and mint leaves.
drinks.name: Deep Valley

drinks.comment: For a "Strange game" add 1 oz vodka.
drinks.name: The Game

drinks.comment: Something for all those who live in the small town of Shrewsbury, Pa.
drinks.name: Shrewsbury Slammer

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with crushed ice. Add gin and triple sec, and fill with pineapple juice. Add a splash of grenadine on top.
drinks.name: Summer Sky

drinks.comment: Created for St Patrick's Day - A real killer!
drinks.name: Green Poison

drinks.comment: A variation of a drink created for the change of the millenium.
drinks.name: Pink Millenium

drinks.comment: Created especially for the Consul General of Sweden who lives on 600 Park Avenue in New York.
drinks.name: Absolut 600

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients in snifter and stir.
drinks.name: Raspberry Release

drinks.instructions: Pour shots and soda over ice in mason jar or antique glass and experience a taste of the old west.
drinks.name: Kick yer Ass Sas

drinks.instructions: Half fill martini glass with crushed ice, pour in alcohol and stir.
drinks.name: Blue Lady

drinks.comment: This was from a book I read somewhere. This drink hides the alcohol taste well. Dangerous! -- Substituting cranberry juice for grapefruit juice also creates an awesome drink.
drinks.name: Hurricane #2

drinks.comment: This comes from the shooter city Calgary, Canada. Tastes great and the girls love it.
drinks.name: White Tornado

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Add liquors. Fill with Pineapple juice. Shake. Garnish with Orange slice. Serve.
drinks.name: Bootzilla

drinks.comment: This is something that I saw someplace one time and I thought that I would try it at home. It turned out to be pretty easy and can be made a very decorative drink with practice. Have fun. And drink responsibly.
drinks.name: Dressed Up Pina Colada

drinks.comment: You can try to replace the peach schnapps with vodka or experiment with other kinds of alcohol.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Watermelon

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice.
drinks.name: My Wasted Generation

drinks.comment: My finest drink. While it may seem overpowering, the taste is divine. Have two in half and hour and your in the zone.
drinks.name: Buzzby

drinks.comment: Originated at club Zadar by bartender Ken Miller.
drinks.name: Zadarade

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice. Shake.
drinks.name: Red Rattlesnake

drinks.comment: It took me many years to locate a good source for passion fruit syrup. If you have a real interest in tasting this drink, and need the passion syrup, e-mail me.
drinks.name: Vodka Passion

drinks.comment: If passion fruit syrup is a hard item for you to find, e-mail me.
drinks.name: Tropic Heat

drinks.instructions: Combine Scotch and Grand Marnier in snifter. Twist lemon peel into mixture. Sip and enjoy.
drinks.name: Rusty Screw

drinks.comment: Watch Out! This one can hurt. It is best used for friend's birthdays or other special events.
drinks.name: Crowbar

drinks.instructions: Put all ingredients in together, and shake. Serve in a glass filled up to 2/3 with ice.
drinks.name: Greek Sex On The Beach

drinks.instructions: Pour Southern Comfort into a shot glass, then add the amaretto. Stir.
drinks.name: ATP

drinks.instructions: Pour into glass. Stir. Add ice cubes.
drinks.name: Italian Margarita

drinks.comment: Nice combination of sour and sweet.
drinks.name: Cubano

drinks.comment: The combination of the the caffine, the alcohol, and the sugar will have you buzzing like your on cloud 9! Enjoy!
drinks.name: Cloud 9

drinks.comment: The flavor comes from the banana liquer, coconut rum, and pinapple juice. Cranberry juice is used to break the acidity of the pinapple juice, while the soda water breaks up the sweetness. The flavored vodka adds a twist and some kick. Knowing this you can vary the recipe to your liking. Can be made stronger by adding more flavored vodka. Also great if mixed in a blender. -- Created in a night club in Courtenay, BC in May 2000.
drinks.name: Tropical Titty Twister

drinks.comment: Derived after Kahlua ran out while making B-52's. Jgermeister was used as a substitute. Was named after the the movie Reservoir Dogs. Tastes like cold chocolate milk.
drinks.name: The Reservoir Dog

drinks.comment: From Sweden, made it my self. It's very easy to vary the drink from sweet to more sour. Just change the amount of lime mix or more pj to get it sweeter for example.
drinks.name: Midori Sun

drinks.comment: Great for big parties! If you want to do it for a big party, blend all ingredients in a big bowl. Fill a mixer and mix thoroughly. Pour into glasses and then take another round and mix, until you have filled all your glasses. The origin is a Donna Reed, but this variation improved it, to my opinion!
drinks.name: Swedish pinkie

drinks.comment: This drink tastes like milkshake, and should be drunk several in line.
drinks.name: Chiquita

drinks.comment: This is absolutely delicious! The color is almost like Mountain Dew. It is very pretty and very strong! It is not too sweet as it may seem just by reading the ingredients. -- It is called the Rising Skirt because it was deemed a girl drink by a golfer at Lafayette Golf and Country Club (where it was created). After each drink, the girl's skirt may get shorter and shorter.
drinks.name: The Rising Skirt

drinks.comment: This drink is very smooth and easy to drink, the ladies love it. Plus it packs a pretty good kick. For a special occasions top with grain alcohol and light before serving.
drinks.name: Mandarin Sunrise

drinks.comment: Origin: An off-campus dorm room at Slippery Rock University, one January weekend. Was named after one of the girl's because she was known as Jeannie on the internet and she was the one just mixing things that tasted good.
drinks.name: Jeannie's Dream

drinks.comment: This is a French inspired cocktail, using specifically French ingredients (except for the bitters). The Cointreau should not be too strong in this drink, it should just add a background note. When in doubt, increase the brandy, and decrease the Cointreau. If you are lucky enough to have Abbott's Bitters, that is what this drink was originally designed to use.
drinks.name: Black Feather

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice in a chilled glass and stir. Garnish with a cherry.
drinks.name: Safe Sex on the Beach

drinks.instructions: Pour over ice and stir to mix.
drinks.name: Orange 43

drinks.comment: Variant: Do not whip the cream and just layer the cold cream (or half-and-half) on top.
drinks.name: Spanish Coffee

drinks.instructions: Pour whiskey over ice in a chilled glass. Top with tonic water and stir gently. Drop in lemon twist.
drinks.name: Leprechaun

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into glass with ice cubes. Add a twist of lemon.
drinks.name: Dancing Leprechaun

drinks.comment: Origin: Akis Hotel in Kamari on the Greek island Santorini, one of the Webtender's favourite holiday spots.
drinks.name: Akis Special

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice cubes. Strain into ice filled highball glass. Garnish with a cherry and a pineapple piece.
drinks.name: Coco Cabana

drinks.instructions: Blend well and add crushed ice.
drinks.name: Batida de Coco

drinks.comment: Created by Jahn Nesset, Norway. Winner of the 1993 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Red Hope

drinks.comment: Created by D. Waidmann, Germany. Winner of the 1959 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Petite Fleur

drinks.comment: Created by Roar Hildonen for the Norwegian newspaper Dagbladet's summer drink column the summer of 2000 (http://www.dagbladet.no/kontekst/21440.html).
drinks.name: Whisky Melba

drinks.comment: Thanks to Juri Ahokas for translating this one from Finnish for me.
drinks.name: Call of the Snowfields (Lumikenttien Kutsu)

drinks.instructions: Pour vodka and Lapponia Lakka into an irish coffee cup. Fill with hot coffee and float fresh cream or whipped cream on top.
drinks.name: Finlandia Coffee

drinks.comment: Created by George Liddle, Great Britain. Winner of the 1993 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Royal Temptation

drinks.comment: Created by Matti Harju, Finland. Winner of the 1987 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Violetta

drinks.comment: Created by Bjarne Eriksen, Norway. Winner of the 1973 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Festrus

drinks.comment: Created by Sven Aage Joansbrten, Norway. Winner of the 1979 I.B.A. international cocktail competition. Slightly modified from the original recipe.
drinks.name: Green Hope

drinks.comment: Created by Jos Abreu, Portugal. Winner of the 1987 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Magic Star

drinks.comment: Created by Fred Falkenberg, Canada. Winner of the 1976 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Ramcooler

drinks.comment: Created by Rocco Di Franco, Italy. Winner of the 1984 I.B.A. international cocktail competition.
drinks.name: Rheingold

drinks.comment: A brilliantly fantastic concoction developed in Chamberlain Hall bar over the term of 98/99. Has to be poured correctly to taste nice otherwise the Premier takes the taste away. It does taste of shit to start with but it does get better as you reach the half pint mark. Also makes your mouth very blue... Rakish!!! Pilgrim says it's the way forward.
drinks.name: Juicy Guiness Premier

drinks.comment: The word "buttsex" is an inside joke with a select few friends. This was created for New Year's Eve 1999, and drunk as the ball dropped. It's really an acquired taste, and if you have a weak stomach I suggest leaving out the triple sec and lemon. Be sure to get some whipped cream with every drink or this will kick your butt.
drinks.name: Buttsex
ingredients: 2 oz strong and black Coffee or espresso

drinks.comment: If you have ever had a lemon drop candy as a child this drink will surely bring back memories! This drink proves what one can invent when totally bored and full access to a stocked bar!
drinks.name: Flaming Lemon Drop

drinks.comment: It tastes better if you can find plain grapefruit soda (not mixed with lemon or lime). We do have in Mxico that sort of soda. It goes easily to the head, refreshing for hot days.
drinks.name: Grüngeist

drinks.comment: Origin: From Fuego Salsa Bar in Malta. Created by one of the owners, Mr. Mark Grima.
drinks.name: Jumanji

drinks.comment: Must be tequila "Agavero" 'cause it's mixed with Damiana liquor (suposed to be aphrodisiac). Strega means witch in italian. Bruja is witch in Spanish.
drinks.name: Bruja Mexicana

drinks.instructions: First, pour all 3 vodkas over ice in highball glass. Fill with lemonade, top with grenadine, shake  serve.
drinks.name: Sir Francis

drinks.comment: For a color variation, float each ingredient on top of the previous with a spoon. -- Good shot for girls. Not too harsh, with plenty of kick.
drinks.name: Emerald Eye

drinks.comment: 1/2 shot of Bacardi limon or Absolut citron may be added to create a "Wild sex with the bartender"
drinks.name: Sex with the bartender

drinks.comment: Excellent balance of sour and sweet.
drinks.name: Undertow

drinks.comment: Makes a crazy turquoise color and tastes wonderful. Vote for this drink if you like it!
drinks.name: Curious Comfort

drinks.comment: This drink was originated by my boss Jake. The owner of a small town bar who wanted something refreshing to drink but still wanted the booze. This drink has become one of our biggest sellers at Uncle Levi's Bar in Grill.
drinks.name: Iced Velvet

drinks.instructions: Mix and serve.
drinks.name: Champagne Martini

drinks.comment: Drink should taste like ruby red grapefruit juice.
drinks.name: Blindside

drinks.comment: I had this drink in Jamaica, where I guess it was originated. It forms the colors of the Jamaican Flag, red on the bottom, yellow in the middle, and green on the top.
drinks.name: Raggae Sunsplash

drinks.instructions: Place the vodka, rum and watermelon liqueur with ice in a shaker. Add the pineapple and orange juice and shake. Pour in a hurricane glass with ice in it. Garnish with an orange slice and cherry.
drinks.name: Resaca Water

drinks.instructions: Mix all together in glass with ice.
drinks.name: The Crown Cherry

drinks.comment: Can also be served blended.
drinks.name: CA area 151

drinks.instructions: In shot glass, mix 1 part Gold with 1 part Rump, add a splash of Jager over the top. Manly shot with a tasty surprise.
drinks.name: Ball and Chain

drinks.comment: This is a smooth shot and easy to drink, the ladies love it, but be careful, the vodka you forgot was in it will come back to bite.
drinks.name: Ski Shooter

drinks.instructions: Add rum, whiskey, and grenadine to glass. Fill the rest of the way with Coke. Stir once to mix.
drinks.name: Skipper's Ripper

drinks.instructions: Pour shots into glass over ice, fill with 7-up, add cream and stir. Garnish with any fruit or cherry.
drinks.name: Jamaican Bum

drinks.comment: This drink originated in Berkeley as I was speaking to the new barkeep who had Irish heritage. I myself am of Mexican heritage so together we created the San Patricio (said in Spanish). It is named after the Irish-American troop that sided with the Mexican's during the Mexican-American War. Optional variations include a 1 oz. shot of Bushmills or a 1 oz. shot of Aejo Tequila.
drinks.name: San Patricio

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients in tin with crushed ice. Shake, strain, and serve.
drinks.name: Breast Milk

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into an over-sized martini glass. There should be a slight amount of foam from the 7-up.
drinks.name: Tie Me To The Bedpost (Hawaiian)

drinks.comment: After one of these special pina coladas, you'll be asking for another Cina Polada. One per person.
drinks.name: Cina Polada

drinks.comment: Use less OJ and make a Martini out of this drink. Another drink invented from Yucatan Liquor Stand of Columbus.
drinks.name: Blue Screw

drinks.instructions: Add ice, then whisky, fill with soda. Stir and enjoy.
drinks.name: Spritsor

drinks.comment: This drink, if made correctly, has little to no strong alcohol taste. -- To make it a Florida Rattle Snake, substitute Orange Juice for the Sour mix.
drinks.name: California Rattle Snake

drinks.comment: Petey's Summertime on Rye Beach in NH
drinks.name: Gorilla Milk #2

drinks.comment: Made famous by Michael Gaines at the B-Street Bar in San Mateo.
drinks.name: C*m Shot (B-Street Bar)

drinks.instructions: Toss some ice cubes into a glass. Pour in a shot of grenadine and a shot of vodka. Fill with gingerale or Sprite and enjoy.
drinks.name: Temptress

drinks.comment: I prefer the double shot of jack, but the single will do.
drinks.name: Jack & Ginger

drinks.comment: If you want to decorate, Use a red cherry on the bottom of the Glass. Be careful, it goes straight into your blood.
drinks.name: Bullvodka

drinks.comment: Named for the Blue Diamond squadron at NAS Lemoore
drinks.name: Blue Diamond

drinks.instructions: Mix vodka, Jgermeister and Red Bull in a glass. Add ice and a slice of kiwi.
drinks.name: Jacobs Haze

drinks.instructions: In a 10 oz highball filled with ice, add Southern Comfort, peach schnapps and fill with orange juice. Mix. Top with a dash of grenadine. Garnish with cherry and serve.
drinks.name: Georgia Peach #2

drinks.comment: My own creation inspired by the Cosmopolitan Martini. Other orange/mandrin lovers will enjoy this variation.
drinks.name: Martina Mandarina

drinks.comment: This doesn't come out in the order of a stoplight, because of the weight of the ingredients, but that is what we originally called it. This is rather sweet, but good! An old bartender friend, made it for me, because I don't care for drinks that taste like alcohol. Thank you, Chris!
drinks.name: Cinn's Stop Light

drinks.instructions: Add freezer chilled vodka to frosted glass, add tabasco and celery salt, top up with very cold very strong lager.
drinks.name: Beer Breezer

drinks.instructions: Build over 2 cubes of ice. Stir.
drinks.name: Nappy Dugout

drinks.instructions: Put ice cubes in glass. Pour rum, vodka, and citron vodka into glass. Fill with 7-up. Mix.
drinks.name: Murray's Cocktail

drinks.comment: Battery is an energy drink that's become a very popular in drinks in Europe the past year or two. It contains, like the similar Red Bull, a vast amount of caffeine, making it a hit for late night partying.
drinks.name: Battering Ram

drinks.comment: Garnishes may include whipped cream on top, Nutmeg, cinnamon, or chocolate shavings.
drinks.name: Mocha Frappe

drinks.instructions: Put liquor, juice, and syrup in blender. Add the sliced banana and ice. Blend for 45 seconds or until smooth.
drinks.name: Parrot Perch

drinks.comment: This drink was made for countries that doesn't have Battery used in the original Battering Ram.
drinks.name: Raging Bull #2

drinks.instructions: Blend on medium for 3 to 5 minutes.
drinks.name: Avocado Milkshake
ingredients: 1/2 cup Sugar or honey to taste

drinks.instructions: Pour over lots of ice.
drinks.name: Golden Sip

drinks.instructions: Stir with ice and strain to cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Forgive Me

drinks.comment: This stuff is *potent*, even if you reduce the rum by half. Brandy, dark rum or bourbon may be substituted for the light rum. If you prefer a nonalcoholic eggnog, leave out the booze altogether. With or without booze, this eggnog is very rich and very good.
drinks.name: Grandma's Swingin' Eggnog

drinks.comment: White and creamy (angelic) with a little punch (naughtiness) to it.
drinks.name: Naughty Angel

drinks.instructions: Pour chilled Tequila in shot glass and put to the side. Pour Tomato Juice in a second shot glass and dash pepper and Tabasco in the Tomato Juice. Shoot Tequila and chase with tomato juice shot.
drinks.name: Colorado Rattlesnake

drinks.instructions: pour vermouth and brandy into glass, add lime and fill with orange juice, and stir. Splash brandy on top, and serve with straw.
drinks.name: Fall of Rome

drinks.comment: Nice alternative at the irish coffee with a superbe taste of caraibe land. I have prepared it the first time about in 1989 for a customer that she did'nt like irish whiskey, she enjoyed it so much that I introduced it in the list wherever I use to work with a lot of success.
drinks.name: Cubano Coffee

drinks.instructions: Pour rum over ice, fill with Jolt, and stir.
drinks.name: Jumper Cable

drinks.instructions: Pour into an ice filled hurricane glass.
drinks.name: Emerald City

drinks.comment: The Origin: This drink came about while a few friends were at the lake throwing a few back. It began as an experiment of trying to make new and interesting drinks. This was just a fluke that ended up tasting like coconuts, but making someone feel very good all through the night.
drinks.name: Banana JABS

drinks.comment: Keeps no more than 7 to 12 days in the refridgerator. Known as both "Sour mix" and "Sweet and sour".
drinks.name: Sour Mix

drinks.comment: Look for the star shaped film on the surface of the drink!
drinks.name: Aztec Gold

drinks.instructions: Moisten the rim of the Collins glass with a lime wedge and coat the rim with granulated sugar. Ice the glass and build the vodka and peach schnapps. Top with grapefruit juice.
drinks.name: Forest Funk

drinks.comment: Excessive consumption recommended.
drinks.name: Creamy Comfort

drinks.comment: I love to take tequila shots, but i also like sweet drinks. Thorny Mexican is the best of both worlds!
drinks.name: Thorny Mexican

drinks.comment: People will suck this drink down, there is no hint of alcohol when mixed properly. Just watch out when the drinkers try to walk after having a few, that's 2 shots of Vodka per serving. A big glass will have many ounces of vodka and you can't taste it at all. Drink responsibly, this one can get you and you won't know it till you try to stand up!! Thanks to April in Key West for this one, it's been a long time favorite for me. Wish I could remember the bar name, some place by Mallory Square across from the Pirates Den. Figures I remember that place.
drinks.name: Key West Lemonade

drinks.comment: If desired, customer can mix the soda in to create a mildly diluted and carbonated drink. If left in a float style, the soda acts as a refreshing cleanse of the palate at the end of the drink.
drinks.name: Charlie's Angel
ingredients: Float 1 part Soda water on top

drinks.instructions: Shake gin, chartreuse, and vermouth in cocktail shaker filled with ice. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Twist orange peel and drop into cocktail.
drinks.name: Cat's Eye

drinks.comment: Originated from the song by the band, from which the name of this drink originated.
drinks.name: Chumbawumba

drinks.comment: Do not stir or shake, drink with straw all at once. Drink should be layered. Substitute tonic water for sprite for different taste. Large diameter straws work best, never use very thin ones.
drinks.name: Mind Eraser #2

drinks.instructions: Pour 3/4 oz of vodka and 1/4 oz frangelico into a shot glass. Cover the slice of lime with powdered sugar. Bite on the lime with powdered sugar on it and hold the juice in your mouth. Then take the shot while the lime juice is still in your mouth. You now have a chocolate cake shot.
drinks.name: Chocolate Cake #2

drinks.comment: Preferably drink fast and in public. The comercial bottle allows you to take it anywhere, hence "party to go" baby!
drinks.name: Shakes "Party To Go"

drinks.comment: Can be done with or without hot sauce.
drinks.name: Lumberjack

drinks.instructions: Shake all ingrediants with ice and strain.
drinks.name: Cosmoquila
ingredients: 2 oz Casa Noble Gold tequila (or Crystal)

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingrediants over ice and stir.
drinks.name: Casa Noble Margarita

drinks.comment: This is the recipe Jack Daniel's gives for this drink.
drinks.name: Applejack (Jack Daniel's original recipe)

drinks.comment: Drink created by Joshua D., Timothy J, and Misty L. at HOPS of Chattanooga, Tennessee.
drinks.name: The Fuzzy Magnum

drinks.comment: Created by Timothy J. at HOPS of Chattanooga, Tennessee.
drinks.name: J's Tropical Orgasm (JTO)

drinks.instructions: Fill the glass with crushed ice. Stir and garnish with cranberries.
drinks.name: Cloudberry Dream

drinks.comment: You wouldn't think Kahlua and cola would go together in a drink, but this is good.
drinks.name: Black Cow #2

drinks.comment: Looks and tastes like the non-alcoholic well known brand named juice "Hawaiian Punch".
drinks.name: Hawaiian Punch

drinks.comment: The perfect morning after drink.
drinks.name: Bloody Shame

drinks.instructions: Frost the rim of a chilled cocktail glass with sugar. Stir absolut citron, blue curacao, grapefruit juice, and sugar syrup in a mixing glass with ice to prevent cloudiness. Strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with a maraschino cherry.
drinks.name: Blue Cosmopolitan

drinks.instructions: In a mixing glass with ice, pour stoli vanil, stoli oranj, grand marnier, parfait d'amour and lime juice. Stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with orange peel
drinks.name: Neopolitan martini

drinks.instructions: Add 1/2 oz dry vermouth in a chilled cocktail glass, and roll the vermouth around the glass and throw away the excess. In a mixing glass with ice, pour crown royal, amaretto, and orange bitters and stir. Strain into cocktail glass, and garnish with orange peel and maraschino cherry.
drinks.name: Stiletto Manhattan

drinks.comment: You can also use your favorite vodka or other clear dry spirit to substitute for gin.
drinks.name: Absinthe Minded Martini

drinks.instructions: Shake ingredients with ice strain into cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Tequilini
ingredients: 2 1/2 oz Casa Noble Gold tequila (or Crystal)

drinks.instructions: Put ice in glass, pour Casa Noble Reposado Tequila, Creme de cassis, fresh lime juice and fill with ginger ale, stir. Pud wedge of lime on top.
drinks.name: Diablo

drinks.comment: The taste of the Snapple masks the alcohol so well, you can hardly taste it! The perfect drink for those who have the tastebuds of a five-year-old girl, like me.
drinks.name: Acid Rain

drinks.instructions: Pour Coke into glass of milk
drinks.name: Black Cow #3

drinks.comment: Made with limited ingredients at a fraternity. Strawberry syrup can be replaced with cranberry juice, (just add a little bit more cranberry juice).
drinks.name: Jon Lee Hooker

drinks.instructions: In a large blender cup, add ice, sugar cubes, creme de cacao, vanilla extract (optional), and the cream or Half  Half. Mix for no more than 5-10 seconds. Then add the alcoholic beverages in no particular order, then hit the "frappe" or "whip" button on the blender for 15-20 seconds, or until you can see that all the ingredients are well-blended, but before you over-blend and start the ice melting too fast. Serve in a tall pre-chilled Tom Collins or similar tall iced-tea glass. No garnish required, serve with a large-diameter straw.
drinks.name: Long Island Milkshake

drinks.comment: You may convert this into a frozen drink by mixing it in a blender. You may also substitute cointreau for triple sec or your favorite color of curacao.
drinks.name: Mamacita

drinks.comment: Its a flavorful drink with plenty of alcohol that you cant taste. It also looks ood for the customer, when its layered.
drinks.name: Grinch #2
ingredients: Fill half with Sweet and sour

drinks.instructions: Fill snifter with ice, add rums and vanilla. Then splash with cola and then fill rest of glass with orange juice. Pour mixture in blender and half blend so it isn't too thick. Pour back into brandy snifter and serve.
drinks.name: Monet Carribean Frost
ingredients: 1 1/2 shot Coconut rum (Captain Morgan Parrot Bay)

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass and garnish with a maraschino cherry.
drinks.name: Cocoa Chanel

drinks.comment: You will love this drink. It will bring out the creative native in you.
drinks.name: Creative Native

drinks.comment: Created in a basement bar in Rockville, MD. The chicks will dig it. Can also be served up in a martini glass.
drinks.name: Chicks Dig It

drinks.comment: Invented in a coffee shop in Salisbury, Md.
drinks.name: Gorilla Smile

drinks.instructions: Chill and pour in shot glass. Serve.
drinks.name: Hot Georgia Peach

drinks.comment: It comes out purple like a kings robe.
drinks.name: Royal Laundry

drinks.comment: A house speciality at the Old West Steakhouse in Salisbury, Maryland.
drinks.name: Chuck Wagon

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice. Add vodka then all other ingredients. Stir.
drinks.name: Chocolate Cake

drinks.comment: Origin: Unknown
drinks.name: Viking Blood

drinks.comment: Flavour is very, very similar to a popular chocolate bar in Canada called, of course, a Coffee Crisp. The rich, if slightly thick drink is optimal for the winter months.
drinks.name: Coffee Crisp

drinks.comment: A Panama City Beach, Fl., Sweet Dreams Original created by Dave Tyring and Jo Meints.
drinks.name: Grinch

drinks.comment: The only reason this drink was created was to be a play on words of screwdriver. It also tastes good and I like rugby so it works out.
drinks.name: Scrumdriver

drinks.comment: Although it doesn't taste like candy or corn, it looks like a candy corn. Origin unknown.
drinks.name: Candy Corn

drinks.comment: The drink should look like a liquid candy corn, hence the name.
drinks.name: Candy Corn #2

drinks.comment: Has a cool body with a fierry head. Originated in a military boarding school in Kent.
drinks.name: Charlie's Angel #2

drinks.comment: It was made to be like the White Rabbit from Alice in Wonderland, cute little creature that leads you into the unknown. It looks like a harmless glass of milk and taste kind of like vanilla ice cream but, have a few and get ready to loose your head.
drinks.name: White Rabbit

drinks.comment: This is a sweet and deceptivley strong pint. It is the drink of Loughborough University in England.
drinks.name: Purple Nasty

drinks.comment: Cocktail created and distributed nationally for a 1935 Four Roses Whiskey ad campaign. Any straight whiskey may be used.
drinks.name: Four Roses Cocktail

drinks.comment: Comes from the rhyme - oranges and lemons say the bells of St Clement's
drinks.name: St. Clement's

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients over ice into a glass, sit back and enjoy.
drinks.name: Ahhhhhh....

drinks.comment: To much mixing after the whipping cream has been added will make the cream froth, leaving a head on the mixture. Keep the Irish Cream in a good sealed container, give it a little shake after it has been sitting. "Better Than Baileys."
drinks.name: Irish Cream BTB

drinks.comment: Suck the whole thing down.
drinks.name: Mind Eraser #3

drinks.comment: Origin: Mutsu Officers Club, Misawa Air Base, Japan.
drinks.name: Jack Rogers

drinks.instructions: Pour pour vanilla vodka and kalhua over ice. Top off with light cream and enjoy.
drinks.name: White Russian #3

drinks.instructions: Pour first three in order, layer Bailey's on top.
drinks.name: Coffee Crisp Shot

drinks.instructions: Fill the glass with ice. Add the rum and lime juice. Fill with ginger ale.
drinks.name: Fidel Castro

drinks.comment: Tastes like hawaiian punch with a kick
drinks.name: Ski Slope

drinks.comment: Beware. You can't taste the alcohol, so drink it and drop.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Logic

drinks.comment: I came up with this after being griped at for not having any dessert for a dinner date. So, I whipped out what I could on the fly and 'voila...instant dessert that'll lead to a gooood date later. Tastes just like a hot, cinnamon-filled, hot apple pie. Enjoy!
drinks.name: K-Dawg's Apple Pie

drinks.comment: A shot I came up with after finding myself at a party with an original "Southern Belle" that was crazy over So-Co and Peach Schnapps. Little bit of a kick with taste-bud smacking flavor. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Southern Pride

drinks.comment: A stout yet tasty pick-me-up.
drinks.name: Silverado

drinks.comment: I personally cannot drink too many milk related alcoholic drinks...they don't settle well with me. But, if you can handle the milk, this is a very fine drink, indeed. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Tiger's Milk

drinks.comment: Killer drink at parties. Very tasty and the aftertaste is slim to none, yet the buzz factor comes pretty quickly for a mixed drink. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Massacre

drinks.comment: Tasty for a shot, and the shaking with ice calms the overwhelming stun of room temperature peppermint schnapps with anything lol. Bottoms up, and enjoy!
drinks.name: Buzzard's Breath

drinks.comment: This is a simple but a very smooth and refreshing drink. I came up with it while working as a banquet bartender at a hotel near the beach in Southern California. In the summer some functions were held outside where it was very beautiful overlooking the ocean but could be quite warm. On hosted bars some guests (especially women) who were not big drinkers but wanted to join in the festivities would ask for a drink which was not very strong in alcohol or liquor taste. So I came up with this recipe which I received many compliments on. If you want to add more of a jolt to it, just bump up the amounts of vodka and triple sec.
drinks.name: D.P.R.

drinks.comment: My memorial drink to General Robert E. Lee. A damned fine drink that is present at our "Southern Bliss" parties. So, make everyone a drink, raise it high, toast to the South, and drink it on down...God bless the South! Enjoy!
drinks.name: General Lee

drinks.comment: A delicious drink with a wild flavor. Party favorite. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Aqueduct

drinks.comment: Smooth citrus taste without as much pucker as what you might think. Quite tasty, indeed. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Citronella Cooler

drinks.instructions: Mix equal parts orange juice and cranberry juice. Mix in the nectar, and pour over ice. Pour in the grenadine last so it will sink. Garnish with pineapple.
drinks.name: Virgin Sex On The Beach

drinks.comment: Learned it at work one night, and it really does taste like yellow cake. Very good for those "Fun Shots".
drinks.name: Yellow Cake

drinks.instructions: Just pour the glass 9/10's Coca-Cola, and add 1/10 Jolt Cola, and guzzle.
drinks.name: St. Squiggle's Divorce

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients in a glass with ice. Mix and enjoy
drinks.name: Dirty Bong Water

drinks.comment: I'm sure this is about the 100th version of this drink, but this one is not as potent and usually goes down a little smoother. Try it and see.
drinks.name: Liquid Cocaine #6

drinks.comment: Refreshing red colored drink
drinks.name: Loose Caboose

drinks.comment: A sweet summer drink... Thanks to Pangy at The Purple Emerald for the Recipe
drinks.name: Liquid Ecstasy

drinks.comment: This smooth drink is the brainchild of my sexy girlfriend Brenda.
drinks.name: Cherry Popper

drinks.comment: This drink was created by a group of friends at the Silverado Bar in Tomahawk, WI. Share with your closest friends as a tradition.
drinks.name: Alaskan Pipeline

drinks.instructions: mix the kahlua, brandy, and irish creme and garnish with whipped creme. chill
drinks.name: Cliffhanger

drinks.instructions: Pour vodka and curacao in a glass filled with ice. Fill it up with Battery.
drinks.name: Kursk

drinks.comment: Tasty camping drink. Good in da canteen with a thousage thandwith.
drinks.name: Texas T

drinks.instructions: Frappe in a highball glass.
drinks.name: London Fog #2

drinks.instructions: Shake ingredients well with ice. Strain into a prechilled Delmonico glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top.
drinks.name: Absinthe Flip

drinks.instructions: Stir ingredients and pour over crushed ice in a deep-saucer champagne glass. Add orange slice.
drinks.name: Absinthe Curacao Frappe

drinks.instructions: Stir well with ice. Strain into a prechilled cocktail glass. Very pleasant with an onion stuffed olive. Some bartenders pour a soucon of Absinthe into the glass, swirl it around and then add the martini.
drinks.name: Absinthe Martini

drinks.instructions: Stir well with ice. Strain into glass. Serve with piece of pineapple on top.
drinks.name: Ladies Cocktail #2

drinks.instructions: Shake well with cracked ice. Strain into cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Absinthe Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.
drinks.name: Absinthe Suissesse

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a Collins glass.
drinks.name: Earthquake Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Chill an Old Fashioned glass by filling with crushed ice. In another glass mix the sugar with the bitters dissolving the sugar. Add some ice, stirring to chill. In the Old Fashioned glass remove the ice and pour in the absinthe coating the entire glass. Remove the excess absinthe. Add the Rye Whiskey and bitters/sugar mixture. Add the Lemon Twist.
drinks.name: Sazerac Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Stir with ice and strain into a cocktail glass.
drinks.name: T N T Cocktail

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a highball glass and fill with seltzer.
drinks.name: Sea Fizz

drinks.instructions: Mix it all together in a champagne flute and drink away!!
drinks.name: Liquid Cocaine #7

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients together and mix vigorously. Pour into glass and enjoy!
drinks.name: Fuzzy Logic #2

drinks.instructions: Shake all ingredients (except lime wedge) with ice and strain into an old-fashioned glass over ice cubes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the wedge of lime and serve.
drinks.name: Virgin Mary

drinks.comment: 1st prize at the "Bartime" 1999 Monastier (TV) Italy.
drinks.name: Lara Croft

drinks.comment: If you want to spice it up add 1/2 oz orange liquer
drinks.name: Fuzzy Nipple

drinks.comment: This is a big hit in nightclubs in Honolulu.
drinks.name: Hawaiian Punch #2

drinks.instructions: Mix equal parts in a mixing glass half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a cherry.
drinks.name: Tokyo Rose

drinks.comment: Good for the college crowd. definately a group shot. Was created in a mini-bottle state so recepie was slightly modified.
drinks.name: Dirty Bong Water #2

drinks.comment: Make sure the glass is full of ice. Orange and pineapple juice amounts may be varied according to individual preferences.
drinks.name: Screaming Banana

drinks.comment: Also good without cranberry.
drinks.name: Screwed Driver

drinks.comment: Kind of like a Shirley Temple with 7-up/Sprite.
drinks.name: Kiddie Cocktail

drinks.comment: If the lemons are yellow the drink will be yellow, if they are green it will be green. Also try it with peaches
drinks.name: Limoncello

drinks.comment: High-octane variant on Rum and Coke. "Discovered" around 1985 in Mount Vernon, Iowa. Can be served over ice, but after one or two, this matters less....
drinks.name: Jamaican Ass-Kicker

drinks.instructions: Shake ingredients in mixing glass with ice, except almond, then strain into a cocktail glass. Drop lime in glass.
drinks.name: Almond Casa Noble

drinks.instructions: Shake ingredients in mixing glass with ice, except lime twist, then strain into a cocktail glass. Add a lime twist.
drinks.name: Green Casa Noble

drinks.comment: Origin, University of Wisconsin-Stout, Courtesy of Jon Prest
drinks.name: Presticles Spectacles Wallet and Watch

drinks.comment: Can also be made with other carbonated soft drinks.
drinks.name: Black Cow

drinks.instructions: Squeeze in the lemon slice and shoot it!
drinks.name: Dr. Debbie

drinks.comment: An extremely good shake on a hot summer day.
drinks.name: Frozen Vanilla Honey Bee

drinks.comment: Taste like honey-nut cherrio's
drinks.name: Nut and Honey

drinks.comment: Recipe from Dr. Feelgood's, Conneaut, Ohio.
drinks.name: Carrot Cake #3

drinks.comment: Taste like Bailey's with more of a kick.
drinks.name: Paralyzer #3

drinks.comment: This drink has a very potent taste of aniseed from the galliano but mixes well with the orange juice. It is very strong and I would not recommend drinking more than two. It is a self invented drink that I tried out on the family for the Millennium. It will knock your socks off!
drinks.name: Millennium Knockout

drinks.comment: This is basically an alcoholic milksake. Very tasty!
drinks.name: Texas Tumbleweed

drinks.comment: A fruity carribean drink. Originated at O'Charley's in Lafayette, IN by Chris Verville.
drinks.name: Dirty Ocean

drinks.instructions: Put the ice cubes in the glass, pour the Anisette in, fill with Schweppes Russchian
drinks.name: French Russchian

drinks.comment: This is the official shot of Alpha Tau Omega Fraternity.
drinks.name: Chocolate Otis

drinks.comment: Ideally this should be served in highball glasses that taper to a point on the inside, so it looks a bit like zoom ice lollys shoot it
drinks.name: Zooom!

drinks.instructions: Blend Ice until throughly crushed. Add Rum, Peach Nectar, and Schapps. Lightly blend until mixed well. Add Frozen Peaches. Blend until slushy. Enjoy
drinks.name: Peach Daiquiri

drinks.comment: It has a suprising taste. Not what you would expect
drinks.name: Tropical Tease

drinks.comment: Fairly strong drink but tastes great.
drinks.name: Sicilian Cocktail

drinks.comment: This is a permutation of the classic 'Brass Monkey', adapted to a more ghetto lifestyle.
drinks.name: Brass Funky

drinks.instructions: Fill the glass with ice, add 2 shots Irish Cream and fill with cola. Mix gently, it will be very foamy!
drinks.name: Pam's Root Beer Float

drinks.comment: A Spanish favorite!
drinks.name: Slim Shady

drinks.comment: A buddy of mine and another goalie came up with this after being demoted to back-ups.
drinks.name: Back-up Goalie

drinks.comment: This is the recipe from the annual Jubilee's Bushwacker Festival in Pensacola Beach, FL.
drinks.name: Bushwacker #5

drinks.instructions: Shake all four ingredients and strain into cocktail glass. Dash of lime is optional. Recipe can be doubled if needed.
drinks.name: Aussie Riviter

drinks.comment: Founded in a bar in San Francisco by 3 Irish emigrants: Peter Phelan - Kildare. Tony Collins - Clare. Mairead Forristal - Kilkenny.
drinks.name: Irish Twist

drinks.comment: One of those little umbrellas for decoration is optional. I'ts better do do about five or six at the same time..
drinks.name: Pineapple Cocktail #2

drinks.instructions: Fill shot glass of Hennessey and then drop it into a pint of malt liquor.
drinks.name: Carjacker

drinks.comment: This drink is an excellent choice for the "financially challenged." As unemployed college graduates, we enjoy this fine cocktail on a regular basis.
drinks.name: Ghetto Hell

drinks.comment: A variation of the Holy Water. Using gin instead of Vodka out of preference, and Blue Curacao instead of Grenadine because the tastes mixes better with the Triple Sec.
drinks.name: Holy Blue

drinks.comment: This is a "shooter" drink that I came up with myself. It is a favorite with younger "college" customers. The name is a "take-off" of the licorice flavor of the drink. -- So far, I have come up with 2 varriants: #1. Same as original but cut the vodka to 1/2 oz. then add 1/2 oz. sloe gin. The name of the drink than becomes "lick-her-itch sloely" -- #2. Same as the original, just add 1/2 oz. cream and serve as a cream style (I.E. Pink squirrel) drink. The name of the drink then becomes "lick-her-creamy-itch". -- A third possible varriant that a few customers have requested (which actually tastes rather nasty) is the same as #2 with the 1/2 oz. cream addition. (Sloely lick her creamy itch)
drinks.name: Lick-Her-Itch

drinks.comment: I invented this one myself, as a "spooky" or Halloween drink. The color should be a gray-black, but don't be fooled: it tastes great. -- Also known as Santeria Margarita or Margarita With A Curse.
drinks.name: Black Margarita

drinks.comment: Sip. Let the aroma help you along.
drinks.name: Long Sigh

drinks.comment: Smooth, fruity taste! Great for social drinking. Tastes great and shouldn't give you a hangover (unless your drink a hell of alot). Made the first one for my girlfriend the day we first met :)
drinks.name: Berry Patch

drinks.comment: Created by the insane people from the Louisville Australian Rules Football Club.
drinks.name: Sour Cow

drinks.comment: Created by Melitta Ciunis in the Meyer Lansky's Bar in Hamburg (Fischmarkt) in 1991. The name derives from the pop star then called 'Prince' whom Melitta was a great fan of.
drinks.name: Prince

drinks.instructions: Start with dash of grenadine. Layer godiva Liqueur, then float 151 proof rum. Light rum on fire. Blow out shot, then drink.
drinks.name: Flaming Confederate

drinks.comment: If done correctly, you will have a shot that has three distinct layers: blue, clear, and brown.
drinks.name: Chewybubu

drinks.instructions: Mix all ingredients with cracked ice in a shaker and serve in a chilled martini glass.
drinks.name: JEE Sweet

drinks.comment: This drink was made during a girls' night and the name fits it because you will surely take a nosedive after you finish off the pitcher by yourself!
drinks.name: Natalie Nosedive

drinks.instructions: Fill highball glass with ice. Add 1 oz. each of Chambord, Kahlua, and Baileys. Top with cream. Short Shake.
drinks.name: Berry Breeze

drinks.comment: This is some high class sh*t!
drinks.name: Dillinger

drinks.instructions: Fill highball glass with ice. Add creme de banane, followed by peppermint schnapps and vodka. Fill with cream. Short shake.
drinks.name: Blonde on Ice

drinks.comment: As you drink rock the glass in your hand between sips to get the full flavour. Enjoy.
drinks.name: A Smile

drinks.comment: This cocktail was designed by LoneStar steakhouse and saloon in Brighton, Victoria, Australia!
drinks.name: Star Burst

drinks.instructions: Combine ingredients with ice, shake and pour into a shot glass.
drinks.name: Peach Kazi

drinks.comment: Drink comes from the back of Creamy Head Sloe Gin bottle.
drinks.name: Sloe Gin Fizz

drinks.comment: Measures are approximate. I made this on a 110 degree day. Didn't matter how hot it was after that...
drinks.name: Another Hot Day in Fresno

drinks.instructions: Shake tequila and vermouth with ice. Strain into a cocktail glass, add pepper slice.
drinks.name: Mexican Martini

drinks.comment: This drink is a very refreshing summer alternative to a standard Martini.
drinks.name: Limon Skyy

drinks.comment: Get the Mandrin and Sprite as cold as U can get it. I mean COLD. ITs GREAT  smooth. Tracy loves it late at night.
drinks.name: Mandrin Sprite

drinks.comment: This is popular with the yachting crowd early or late in the season when it can get chilly on the water in the evening.
drinks.name: Fragile Baby

drinks.comment: Best if cherry juice is not pre-sweetened.
drinks.name: Gold Coast

drinks.instructions: Pour all ingredients into a shaker half filled with ice, shake and then strain into shotglass
drinks.name: Cream in da Panties

drinks.comment: Great summer drink.
drinks.name: Terri's Tropical Passion

drinks.comment: The strawberries shall be very sweet, if they aren't use som sweetened orange juice
drinks.name: Monique

drinks.instructions: Layer white chocolate liqueur over coffee liqueur. Enjoy.
drinks.name: Yin-Yang

drinks.comment: Origin: Chattanooga, TN
drinks.name: Orange Drop

drinks.comment: Coors Light or other American light beers are preferrable for their non-imposing flavor. Lime-flavored gin will enhance the drink's alcoholic properties in a psycho-somatic manner. Add a garnish of maraschino cherry with tsp. of it's syrup if the drink is too tart.
drinks.name: Get Jenny

drinks.instructions: In a shaker, combine Vodka and blue curacao. Chill until cloudy. Pour into martini glass. Tilt glass and pour in raspberry schnapps (will sink to the bottom). Float cranberry vodka on top. This will give you levels of color: red - blue - purple.
drinks.name: Metropolis

drinks.comment: Adjust measure of one ingredient if you find it too sweet. Hope you like it!!
drinks.name: Sweet Treat

drinks.comment: This was invented due to lack of ingredients at a friends' house.
drinks.name: Spiked Cherry

drinks.instructions: Shake tequila, triple sec, sour mix, and lime juice with ice. Pour over ice in salt-rimmed margarita glass. Float Grand Marnier on top. Garnish with slice of lime if desired.
drinks.name: Cadillac Margarita

drinks.comment: I prefer to use Skyy vodka and Florida's Natural Orange Juice.
drinks.name: Auger

drinks.comment: Created at the Fireside Tavern in the poconos, PA, as yet another collaborative effort by Fireside's resident Barkeep, and Mitch, of the Moose Head Lounge in West Nyack, NY. After mixing many experimental shots, only a few made the grade. This was probably the tastiest of all of them. After trying the shot, Mitch did not even hesitate on the name. Immediately, he blurted, "Taste's just like a chocolate donut." The other patrons there at the time tried it, and all agreed... The confectioner's sugar came later, but it truly is the crowning touch to the flavor. This shot is a must, for those partygoers with a sweet tooth...
drinks.name: Powdered Chocolate Donut

drinks.instructions: Shake hard and fast, strain over ice.
drinks.name: Crase

drinks.instructions: Pour vodka and midori over ice in a highball glass. Add pineapple juice. Top off with a splash of 7-up.
drinks.name: The Incredible Hulk #2

drinks.instructions: Fill high ball glass with ice. Pour vodka and amaretto into glass in equal parts. Then add two parts sour and pineapple juice.
drinks.name: Liquid Love

drinks.comment: Can be made into a shot by eliminating the Sprite. Best if Absolut Citron is used, but regular Absolut/vodka can be used.
drinks.name: Geeba

drinks.comment: Created by some of the staff at O'learys restaurant in stersund, Sweden.
drinks.name: Sunding Over the top

drinks.comment: The addition of lemonade to the Pimm's Cup is a practice founded by the Napoleon House in New Orleans. It simply adds another level of flavor to this classic English drink.
drinks.name: Pimm's Cup New Orleans Style

drinks.comment: This was invented my me and my cousin one during a night of debauchery. Very tasty (if you like bailey's and cointreau) sweetness and yumminess of Bailey's with a soft bite of cointreau hiden in there.
drinks.name: Cointreauceptive

drinks.comment: It was invented in Corfu, Greece by me Erik Larsson and my best friends, Fredde, Huvve, Johny and The crow.
drinks.name: Corfu Lule

drinks.comment: Designed and served often at Club Liquid in St. Louis Mo. Come Check it out!
drinks.name: Rudy

drinks.comment: Great Party Drink!
drinks.name: Puff's Magick Dragon

drinks.comment: I prefer mixing 750ml of Chianti with 250ml of Boujeaulais for the wine.
drinks.name: Fruit Sangria

drinks.comment: Instead of using chilled hot chocolate, cola can be used it then becomes a Black Mistress.
drinks.name: White Mistress

drinks.instructions: Pour Malibu, gin, and lime juice over ice. Stir in club soda.
drinks.name: Lost Cause

drinks.comment: No ice in the glass, no decoration. it's a very light, smooth and well balanced cocktail - just the perfect after-dinner-drink, not only for sisters. - dedicatet to s.
drinks.name: Sister S.

drinks.comment: This drink was made up while experimenting on my time off
drinks.name: Blue Bahama

drinks.comment: I am a bartender and was asked to make a "sex on the beach" for a customer. My bar was out of the raspberry ingrediant so i improvised a bit. I told the man that if you had sex on the beach, you would have "sand in your crack!"
drinks.name: Sand In Your Crack

drinks.instructions: Blend ingredients in blender until thoroughly mixed. Add more ice cream if too thin. Garnish with blueberries and strawberry.
drinks.name: Bluuzberry Shake

drinks.comment: It tastes like chocolate milk with a bite. Discovered on 7/1-00.
drinks.name: Scottish Jersey

drinks.instructions: Pour in amaretto and southern comfort. Add 7-up and ice as desired.
drinks.name: Turbulence

drinks.instructions: Layer. Blue curacao first, then pina colada and last grenadine on top.
drinks.name: Dutch Flag

drinks.comment: Mount Gay Rum can be substituted for Captain Morgan's which was the original drink. Also yummy!
drinks.name: The Dire

drinks.comment: Be careful with this one... it's stronger than it tastes!
drinks.name: Hawaiian Redneck

drinks.instructions: Shake rum, chartreuse, campari, and bitters in ice filled cocktail shaker. Strain into chilled cocktail glass. Sqeeze lime and drop into drink.
drinks.name: Copper Cocktail

drinks.comment: The colder the better. It makes a good first drink of the night.
drinks.name: Bearsicle

drinks.comment: The drink will taste just as good with fat free half  half if you prefer fewer calories. You may also substitute the sugar with one packet of Nutrasweet or leave it out all together. I prefer Captain Morgan's Parrot Bay because it is a sweeter and richer tasting coconut rum.
drinks.name: White Parrot

drinks.comment: After the drink is mixed, you can either add the ice, and blend again, or simply pour the drink over the ice. Then you can either add the ice, and blend again, or simply pour the drink over the ice. This drink should be put in a 8oz mug that has been chilled in the freezer for best enjoyment. The drink should taste sweet, almost like ice cream, if it's not, add more sugar, or milk to taste. *note* For an "added kick" use a bit of bourbon (Jim Beam).
drinks.name: Power Russian

drinks.instructions: Fill glass with ice, add all ingredients, stir well.
drinks.name: Vampyre Brew

drinks.instructions: Shake all ingredients and strain over a large ice cube in a Red Wine glass.
drinks.name: Coffee Dreamer

drinks.comment: A smooth drink that was invented by a patron taste great when stired becomes the color of a tree frog thus the name.Make shure patron stirs the drink. I would limit them to 4 a night.
drinks.name: Leap Frog

drinks.comment: It may sound nasty but is very good. Came about by accident on a very busy night. Glad I had to drink my mistakes! :o)
drinks.name: Lazy Haze

drinks.comment: Can be done without the melon midori if you don't like the taste, the effect is the same!
drinks.name: The Green Monster

drinks.comment: A great summer drink!
drinks.name: Exotic Pimms

drinks.instructions: Stir, and add a slice of lemon and a few mint leaves.
drinks.name: Classic Pimms

drinks.comment: Grand Marnier can, of course, be substituted in lieu of Cointreau. A lemon twist or orange and lemon wheels can be substituted for the orange spiral. A dash of orange bitters can be added for some extra zing.
drinks.name: Scandanavian Sun

drinks.comment: Modified Blue Kiss, Sweeter but still a good buzz
drinks.name: Blue Russian Kiss

drinks.comment: This is just a modification on the traditional Southside (think lemonade for grown-ups). I got the idea at Fazoli's (of all places) where you can have your lemon ice mixed with raspberries. It's a great summer cocktail that you can make with Peachtree instead of the Schnapps. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Raspberry Southside

drinks.instructions: Shake. Pour into glass and add Sprite. Garnish with a strawberry.
drinks.name: Absolut Symphony

drinks.comment: This is our favorite party drink. It has been a hit at every party we have thrown.
drinks.name: Lime Bomber

drinks.comment: Created at Cadillac Jack's Billiards in Edinburg, Tx.
drinks.name: Kentucky Shitkicker

drinks.comment: A favorite from Courvoisier. Presumably named after the "Ladies Man" sketch on "Saturday Night Live": Courvoisier being the title character's favorite beverage.
drinks.name: Ladies Man

drinks.comment: I mix this drink in a "Bennigans" True Pint glass, but any pint glass will do.
drinks.name: Latana

drinks.comment: Ultimately you determine your own tastes, but allow enough Chartreuse to level off the taste of the ginger. The Jager will hold it's own, keep total liquor the same and adjust ratio of Jager and Chartreuse per taste.
drinks.name: Detroit Diesel

drinks.comment: Improvision lead to discovery.
drinks.name: Mt. Fujiyama

drinks.instructions: Mix together and serve in a pitcher with ice.
drinks.name: Great Green Monster

drinks.instructions: Fill a shaker with vodka, blue curacao, lemon juice, and ice. Shake well. Strain into sugar-rimmed martini glass. Garnish with lemon peel.
drinks.name: Blue Neptune

drinks.comment: Use a half coconut instead of the glass.
drinks.name: Batida Summerday

drinks.comment: Amaretto is made from almonds, frangelico from hazelnuts, hence the name.
drinks.name: Nut Case

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain cranberry vodka into a sugar rimmed cocktail glass. Add a splash of lemon juice and cranberry juice. For decoration, insert a stirrer through a slice of lemon to bridge over the glass.
drinks.name: Sugared Rose

drinks.comment: This is like the melon ball, only not quite as fruity.
drinks.name: A Better Melonball

drinks.comment: Will taste much like a Slow Comfortable Screw up against a Wall, except less cherry and more fruit flavor. Hard to taste the alcohol in this if mixed well. Also try with 50/50 orange juice/pineapple juice.
drinks.name: Slow Screw up against a Red Wall

drinks.instructions: Pour a shot of vodka and a shot of brandy into a straight glass. Fill nearly to the top with orange juice. Then take a teaspoon of blackcurrant cordial and gently dribble it onto the surface of the drink so it slowly sinks down to make a lovely pattern. Add a straw, so the drinkee can create swirls if desired.
drinks.name: Nham Zoom

drinks.comment: The name of the drink is my apartment :)
drinks.name: A 243

drinks.comment: Make this for people you LIKE: cleaning the used glasses is a major pain in the butt. For people you DON'T like, hey, your blender is broken...
drinks.name: Banana Splat

drinks.comment: Invented by a baker from Hawaii. Created as a by product while marinating strawberries for a dessert. Serve shaken on the rocks with no ice.
drinks.name: Strawberry Soak

drinks.instructions: Shake Tropico, Midori, Cranberry Juice, and 7-Up on the rocks. Serve in a glass with no ice.
drinks.name: Anime Freak

drinks.instructions: For one shot, just mix right in the shot glass. For a larger amount, use a shaker with the same proportions.
drinks.name: Incredible Hulk #2

drinks.comment: Discovered by myself and SoCo Folchi at our house, El Rancho, mere moments before Lee's first excursion into the world of topless entertainment.
drinks.name: Listerine

drinks.comment: Always work well!
drinks.name: The Great Hercules

drinks.comment: Add rum to a Fuzzy Navel for a kick. And of course since navel refers to the Navy?? And Pirates are sort of involved in Naval affairs. The name Fuzzy Buccaneer truly fits especially after five or six of these suckers. Then try saying the name of this drink, and you may become a bucky fuzzaneer or a buzzy f----aneer.
drinks.name: Fuzzy Buccaneer

drinks.comment: I made this one up as I went along when a patron asked for "something like a Long Island Iced Tea, but sweeter." It's an easy one to drink, plus the color is very cool.
drinks.name: Blazing Fire

drinks.comment: Knock it back and give a pirate's "Arrr!"
drinks.name: Captain's Treasure

drinks.instructions: Stir in a collins glass.
drinks.name: Nuclear Mantis

drinks.instructions: Pour Jack Daniels into highball glass. Add ice cubes. Fill with ginger ale and finish off by topping it with orange juice.
drinks.name: Mellow Tennessee

drinks.comment: Tastes likes one of "The King's" fried banana sandwiches. Looks like the young Elvis' blue suede shoes and has the kick of one of the old Elvis' karate moves.
drinks.name: Blue Suede Shoes

drinks.comment: My friend suggested making a drink called a Dicso Lem-O-Nade, from a line in the Marcy Playground song "Sex and Candy." This is the result.
drinks.name: Disco LemOnade

drinks.comment: Best served while listening to Jimi Hendrix (hence the name of the drink).
drinks.name: Red Haus

drinks.instructions: Fill the hurricane glass with ice, then add the blue curacao, triple sec and peach schnapps. Fill with 7-up and garnish with an orange wheel.
drinks.name: Mind Meld

drinks.instructions: Build in highball with lots of ice. Fill with Sprite.
drinks.name: Eye of Swamp

drinks.comment: Tastes like the candy "Good  Plenty".
drinks.name: Good & Plenty

drinks.comment: Tastes like the candy "Tootsie Roll".
drinks.name: Tootsie Roll #2

drinks.comment: To make a Frozen Strawberry Daiquiri, do the exact same as above, but replace the tequila with a light rum.
drinks.name: Frozen Strawberry Margarita

drinks.instructions: Over rocks, combine schnapps, rum, and triple sec in Collins glass. Fill with orange juice and shake. Serve.
drinks.name: Vulva

drinks.comment: The drink is not as sweet as one might think, as long as it is served cold. I've found that even 'tough guys' like it a lot.
drinks.name: Cotton Candy #2

drinks.comment: Invented by Jamie Blake in Wellington, New Zealand over summer 1999/2000.
drinks.name: L.A. Riot

drinks.instructions: Shake and pour over ice
drinks.name: Tequilaville

drinks.instructions: Combine in shaker. Shake untill cloudy. Pour.
drinks.name: Wife Beater

drinks.comment: Grenadine is optional. It may sound grim, but a nice alternative is to swap the cream for cola. If you do this, please leave out the grenadine! (cola variant name - Cherry Forest)
drinks.name: Cherry Garden

drinks.comment: Tastes like cherry, but the after taste is minty
drinks.name: Cherry Candycane

drinks.comment: If mixed right it will go from red on the bottom to an orange color on top.
drinks.name: I go to Purdue

drinks.instructions: Mix in the glass.
drinks.name: Hubbabubba

drinks.instructions: Pour the alcohol (except 151 proof rum) and ice first, then fill with orange juice. Top off with 151 proof rum. Optional, garnish with orange wedge, cherry and pineapple chunk.
drinks.name: Yah Yah

drinks.comment: First time I tried this drink was actually in Cognac, the town that has given its name to the drink. CT is of course short for Cognac  Tonic, and is basically just replacing the gin in GinTonic with cognac. And please don't use your best cognac for this!
drinks.name: CT

drinks.comment: You could also make it into a cocktail-style drink by adding milk. -- Created at Mount Royal College, Calgary, Canada
drinks.name: Strawberry Blond

drinks.comment: Try it without the fruit juice in shot form taking turns to fill your shot glasss' from the bowl. Originated in a military boarding school in Kent.
drinks.name: Man In A Man Suit

drinks.comment: This was created by the brilliant bartenders at Zig Zag restaurant in Seattle, Washington.
drinks.name: French 76

drinks.comment: This can also be made as a frozen drink.
drinks.name: Senorita Margarita

drinks.comment: This drink got it's name because it looks normal, tastes normal, but you'd never guess it would sneak up and kill you.
drinks.name: Serial Killer

drinks.comment: Came up with this on the spot at the last party. Best if the juice is chilled.
drinks.name: Hawaiian Sunrise

drinks.comment: Careful with this one, it may make you sick: but if it doesn't, you'll be fine until the next morning. Don't drink to much of this one!
drinks.name: Faust

drinks.comment: Don't drink to much or you will die! Enjoy!
drinks.name: Jamestown Kool-Aid

drinks.comment: Tastes good. Great for anyone who doesn't want the usual shot.
drinks.name: Risk

drinks.instructions: Rum first, syrup second. Mix well in shot glass.
drinks.name: Sackville Surprise

drinks.comment: A cutesy named and tasty drink I came across while whipping up mixed drinks at a party...the girls love it. Enjoy!
drinks.name: Two Turtles

drinks.comment: This inspiration came from (of all things) playing games on the Internet. We were conjuring up drinks and this was my contribution.
drinks.name: Satin Sheets

drinks.comment: This is the new, Improved Teatoddy Still good for cold wintersdays or nights. Be careful, though, as this drink tend to gently sweep you off your feet and comfortabely lay you down :-) Enjoy!
drinks.name: Tea Toddy #2
ingredients: 1/2 cup Tea (Earl Grey or Yellow Label)

drinks.comment: Created by Cheryl Loo @ Red Lion, Waikiki, Hawaii. Easy to remember by SPM WHL...S-outhern Comfort, P-each Schnapps, M-alibu Rum WHL-What Hawaii Likes (Pineapple). Named after a member of the Aloha Hash House Harriers drinking club with a running problem (Sperm Whale)
drinks.name: Sperm Whale

drinks.instructions: Pour cranberry and orange juice in cup, then add the sprite. Last, add the rum.
drinks.name: Sloppy Joe

drinks.comment: Randomly made up at 4th Street Cafe in Chattanooga, TN
drinks.name: Trailer Wench

drinks.comment: My recommendation is Budweiser but choose your favorite beer. Randomly made up on a slow night at 4th Street Cafe in Chattanooga, TN
drinks.name: Absolute Chainsaw

drinks.instructions: Shake everything and serve on the rocks
drinks.name: LaPaglia's Punch

drinks.comment: I can't serve enough of these shots, they taste exactly like New York style cheesecake!
drinks.name: Cheesecake

drinks.instructions: Build in an ice filled glass. Serve. Great as a frozen drink.
drinks.name: Green Label

drinks.instructions: Mix it all together. Serve cold, but not with ice.
drinks.name: Brass Skunky

drinks.comment: Notice the first letters of each ingredient. My own creation 20 years ago
drinks.name: Crap Schnapps

drinks.comment: I have my own group of patrons for this original
drinks.name: Bluetail Fly

drinks.comment: This original is tasty
drinks.name: Fuzznutts

drinks.comment: Be careful. Don't go blind. Don't go anywhere. Since 1972, the limit and the record on drinking these monsters is still two.
drinks.name: Bulldozer

drinks.comment: Holy Jeez, This will make you go crazy!
drinks.name: Crazy Maker

drinks.comment: Invented by a bored freshman at Texas AM University. Thanks, and Gig 'em.
drinks.name: Invisible Parrot

drinks.comment: If you like fresh long drinks with fruity but not too sweet taste, this is the right one for you! I didn't invent this drink but it's one of the best drinks I've ever tasted so I wanted to add it here.
drinks.name: Sunrise
ingredients: Fill with Ginger ale or Sprite

drinks.comment: This doesn't sound like it will work, but it does. The sweetness of the rum mixes very well with the punch.
drinks.name: Pirate's Punch

drinks.instructions: Mix liqueur, juice and vodka in a highball glass. Add ice and fill the glass with sprite. You can decorate the drink with a slice of orange, lemon or kiwi if you want.
drinks.name: Participle

drinks.instructions: Mix juices and cinnamon with ice. Strain to a cocktail glass. Serve cold.
drinks.name: Baroness

drinks.instructions: Fill a wine glass with 1/3 chilled vermouth and 2/3 red wine.
drinks.name: Power Sangria

drinks.comment: Enjoyed by the bar staff at Storrowton Tavern.
drinks.name: Chocolate Martini #4

drinks.comment: Created by the bar staff at Storrowton Tavern
drinks.name: Okapi

drinks.comment: To enjoy to the utmost extreme, donn a cheese wedge on your dome and enjoy another Green Bay Packer victory!
drinks.name: Packerita

drinks.instructions: Stir ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass.
drinks.name: Moulin Rouge

drinks.comment: Makes for a good punch. No girl has turned it away. Booze hits fast and hard. Stop DUIs, drink at home.
drinks.name: Drunk-N-ade

drinks.comment: Featured on BBC's The Naked Chef with Jamie Oliver.
drinks.name: Jungle Boogie Punch

drinks.instructions: Pour ingredients into shot glass.
drinks.name: Hawaiian Sugar Plantation

drinks.comment: My variation on the "Negroni". It's less alcoholic switching dry vermouth for gin, and with club soda it makes for a very refreshing summer drink!
drinks.name: Brioni

drinks.instructions: Build over ice in a hurricane glass. Garnish with a lime wheel.
drinks.name: Shore Breeze

drinks.instructions: Pour tonic water over ice in a highball glass. Add a squeeze of lime and Angostura bitters. Stir gently and garnish with a lime wheel.
drinks.name: Southampton

drinks.comment: This Moon Pie shot is so good, you'll want a RC Cola on the side! Yee Haw !
drinks.name: Moon Pie

drinks.comment: From the September 2002 edition of Cheers magazine.
drinks.name: Blue Wave

drinks.instructions: Shake well with ice. Strain into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass. Garnish with a twist of lemon.
drinks.name: The Blue Fin

drinks.comment: Created by Francesco Lafranconi, a master mixologist, and beverage specialist for Southern Wine  Spirits of Nevada and director of the Academy of Spirits and Fine Service.
drinks.name: Blue Goose

drinks.comment: Far from the classic Cosmopolitan, but an interesting experiment with the new white cranberry juice.
drinks.name: White Cosmopolitan

drinks.comment: This cocktail is named in honour of Henrik Ibsen.
drinks.name: Ibsen

drinks.instructions: Pour into a coupette glass/champagne saucer.
drinks.name: Fraise de Champagne
ingredients: 3/4 oz Creme de Fraise des Bois (Marie Brizard)

drinks.instructions: Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass
drinks.name: Cranberry Apple Martini

drinks.comment: Posted by Natrone in the forums on 20. Nov. 2004.
drinks.name: Washington Apple Martini

drinks.instructions: Pour gin, Cointreau and orange juice over ice. Gently pour grenadine along the inside of the glass so it sinks to the bottom.
drinks.name: Gotland Summer Night

drinks.comment: Orange juice should be added to taste, but also to get a nice green color.
drinks.name: Jameson St. Patrick's Day

drinks.instructions: Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of apple.
drinks.name: Sour Apple Martini
